texts.en:
Jenelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buying and selling of charcoal business.

Jenelyn has been in this business for seven years. Jenelyn earns more income from farming rice and a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jenelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Zawadi Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Mwanne,who is in late 30's is married with three children. She has been running clothing shop for eight years now. She works from 6 am to 6 pm daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock her shop with stylish clothes to meet customers demand. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is now proceeding well. 

She used her profit to take care of her family, to repay loan, reinvest in business and pay school fees. She will use this loan to increase on the volume of latest outfit to match with the Christmas festivals.

She dreams of expanding her business into a whole selling store and Build a house. Joyce, will share this loan with her loan group ” zawadi” which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase on the volume of latest outfit to match with the Christmas festivals

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 45 years and a mother of 2. She sells her merchandise in the main market. She has done this business over the last 8 years. The merchandise includes suiting materials for both men and women as well as children. She also deals in ready-to-wear dresses for children. The recent Christmas season gave her very encouraging sales.  Therefore she would like to add other items like mensware and shoes. She therefore seeks KIVA\'S assistance to diversify the product line. She completed the TEACH sessions last November from KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan Nyambura intends to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mukhtor

texts.en:
Mukhtor is a cook. He had worked more then 8 years in a restaurant in Russia. For two years he was a cook during military service. In 2005 he came back Tajikistan and opened his own café. He is renting a premises in the center of Istaravshan. He has 5 assistants. His last loan he used for a new grill and one more refrigerator. Mukhtor says that he is a successful entrepreneur and considers that to get progress in business a person should to be diligent, honest, and respect his clients.

His dream is to have a son; now he has 3 girls. His current loan request is for construction of a summer café near his present café.

loans.use: Open a summer cafe

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary O. is 36 years old. A native of Okpanamu, a town in Delta State, she is the leader of a LAPO group.  She has 2 years' experience in her business, i.e., in the sales and rental of video CDs. Mary is requesting a loan of $625 to purchase more CDs and expand her little micro-business.

loans.use: To buy more CDs for her inventory

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en: Mrs. Chhim N., aged 49, is a farmer who earns $1 per day. She is a widow with 4 children, 2 of whom work at a garment factory earning $70 per month each and 2 of whom are students. They rent the stereo equipment in the picture to neighbors for parties and weddings. She would like to borrow $500 to buy pigs to raise extra income for her family.

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise extra income for her family.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
David and Vilma, a hard working married couple, have great dreams to proviD. the best to their three small children. David is a master construction worker, very well known and sought-after and respected by his work community for the excellent and professional work that he provides, with Vilma his wife by his siD. and his four laborers. They do their work every day from 8 a.m. until 6p.m. every night, with the only goal of saving enough money to purchase a small piece of land where they can build a house and therefore offer their beloved children a propper and safe life. The dream of this hard working couple is to purchase a roofing machine, equipment that will facilitate and help David in his work. For this they already have a small amount of money saved but it's still not enought to purchase the equipment they need; for this reason they are applying for a loan that they plan on repaying within a 6-month term. "Let's support the drive and efforts of this young couple to prosper in their life".

David y Vilma, pareja D. esposos muy trabajadores, con grandes deseos D. brindarles lo mejor a sus tres menores hijos, David es maestro D. obras, muy solicitado, conocido y respetado dentro D. su entorno laboral por los excelentes y finos trabajos que realiza, siempre acompañado D. su fiel esposa Vilma y D. sus cuatro trabajadores. Ellos desempeñan su labor diaria desD. las 8:00 D. la mañana hasta las 6:00 D. la tarD., con el único objetivo D. ahorrar lo suficiente para adquirir un terrenito y construir su casita y así ofrecerles a sus queridos hijos una morada propia y segura.El deseo D. esta emprendedora pareja es comprar una máquina D. techo, herramienta que le facilitará y agilizará el trabajo a David, para esto ya tienen ahorrado un dinerito pero aún no es suficiente para adquirir su tan deseada herramienta; es por esa razón que solicitan un préstamo y se comprometen en reembolsarlo en un lapso D. seis meses. “Apoyemos el ímpetu y esfuerzo D. esta joven pareja por prosperar en la vida”.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Loan is required to acquire new construction equipment that will facilitate the work and increase the work load.

loans.name: Iyos

texts.en: Iyos is 36 years old whose husband, S., has no fixed income. So she helps her husband provide the family needs by selling some foods at her house such as blended ice, fried snacks, etc., and usually earns US $2.50 - $3.50 per day. Iyos is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan to buy more goods and provide tuition for her children. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Lesly

texts.en:
Lesly T. Z. has a store selling groceries in the town of San Juan, district La Banda de Shilcayo, province and department San Martin.  She started the store three years ago from her house with S/. 500.  Over time, the business has grown and she has been able to provide a better service for her community.  Lesly says that she is always friendly and flexible with her customers.

Lesly is 40 years old and married with no children.  Her husband is very supportive and helps her with manual labor. Lesly never had the opportunity to study so she loves running her business because she says it make her feel good.  Before she started her business she spent her time doing house work and working out in the fields.  

Lesly is part of the community bank Las Margaritas and is requesting a loan of S/. 1,000 so she can restock her shelves and invest in new products her clients frequently ask for. She will repay the loan in four months. She is confident that repaying this loan will not be a problem as she already has many loyal customers.

loans.use: To restock her shelves and invest in new products

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
Mirtha is a cook with good tasting food. That is what her most zealous lodgers said. Everyday they attend her cozy dining room to sample the succulent dishes that she prepares. She has been selling food for two years in order to help her dear husband with the household expenses and the education of their two small children which want an opportunity to improve themselves and be able to acquire a good, solid education. Being this goal a great need and wish of this family, they are requesting a loan to set their place and build a small grocery store where the lodgers can get diverse consumer products. Remember that your support is important for the well-being of this family

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Mirtha, es cocinera con muy buena sazón, así lo confirman sus más fervientes pensionistas que día a día acuden a su acogedor comedor a degustar D. sus apetecibles platillos.Ella desD. hace dos años venD. comida para poder ayudar a su querido esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación D. sus dos pequeños hijos, los cuales tienen deseos D. superación y gran necesidad D. poder formarse cognitivamente.Siendo esta una gran necesidad y deseo D. su familia requiere D. un préstamo para ambientar su local e instalar una bodeguita en donD. sus pensionistas puedan adquirir diversos productos D. consumo.Recuerda que su apoyo es importante para el bienestar D. esta familia.

loans.use: Buying better utensils to improve the service to her customers and their comfort.

loans.name: Rukia's Faith Group

texts.en:
Although Rukia A. is only 19 years old, she already shoulders plenty of responsibility. She and her husband are responsible for caring for a 63-year-old family member. To help support her family, Rukia works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day selling food at a local store in her city of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.

Rukia hopes to buy a freezer and more supplies for her business, which is why she's applied for a group loan of $275 U.S. dollars. Her loan partner is Zaina I., who earns a living by selling pillows. Zaina also wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy a freezer for a food vending business

loans.name: Asha's Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Asha is 25 years old and is married with 1 child, age 10 months. She and her husband also take care of two other children, ages 14 and 12 years. Asha owns a small stock of animals. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm, and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more animals to increase her stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Rehema, who has her own business.

loans.use: To increase her animal stock.

loans.name: Fatou Gogo

texts.fr:
Fatou Gogo N. is a woman who lives in the Tenth district in Thies; she is married and the mother of three. Her main business consists of buying and reselling second-hand clothing. She has been in this business since 2005, and with this loan, she proposes to increase her inventory with the goal of improving her revenue.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

FATOU GOGO NDIAYEest une femme qui habite au quartier dixieme à Thies ; elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants; son activité principale consiste à acheter et à revendre de la fripperie ; elle fait cette activité depuis 2005 et avec ce prêt elle compte augmenter son stock dans le but d'améliorer ses revenus.

loans.use: Inventory of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Sabado Samuel

texts.pt:
Sabado is 39 years old and she is from the province of Gaza. Sabado has 7 children with two different wives -- 5 of them are from the same mother and their ages range from 8 to 18 years old. His children from the second wife are 13 and 16 years old. Out of the 7 children, only the oldest one does not go to school anymore. Besides his children, Sabado also supports his mother who lives in Chokwe by sending her a monthly allowance. Sabado went to school until the 4th grade and he says he did not continue his education because he traveled during his vacation to another province and once he returned his spot in the school was not available any longer. In 1980, right after his father death, he moved away from the province of Gaza and relocated to Maputo to look for a better life. In 1981 he worked for Vetagro-Boane and between 1995 and 1997 he worked as a security guard when there were many lay-offs and he was also let go. In 1998 he tried following his friend's steps by opening up a chicken raising business but he had to abandon that activity due to a lethal epidemic that killed many of his hens. Sabado lives in his own home. Sabado learned the trade by watching his friends do it since 1998. He has a permanent location on Namaacha Avenue in the town of Mazanbanine and its normal hours of operation are from 7:00am to 9:00pm -- these hours can be longer if there is a great influx of business. He has been engaged in this field for 6 years and with help from two employees he has been able to sell beer for 25,00mt, juices for 10,00mt and semea for 120,00 per bag. Sabado's income varies between 300,00mt and 1000,00mt per month and, depending on the business volume, it could reach as much as 2500,00mt. It is a goal to Sabado to expand and keep his business growing. His plans for the near future are open up more establishments in the town where he lives and expand his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Sabado tem 39 anos de idade e é natural da província de gaza. Sabado é pai de 7 filhos com duas esposas sendo 5 filhos de uma mesma pessoa, com idades variando entre 18 e 8 anos de idade. Com a outra esposa Sabado tem dois filhos de 16 e 13 anos. Dos 7 filhos o mais velho já não vai a escola e os outros estudam. Para alem dos filhos Sabado sustenta a sua mãe que se encontra em Chokwe enviando valores monetários para ela. Sabado estudou ate 4ªclasse e diz que não continuou por ter perdido a vaga quando nas ferias do fim do ano viajou para outra província e quando voltou já não havia vaga. Em 1980 mudou-se da província de Gaza para Maputo a procura de melhores condições de vida, logo apos a morte do seu pai. Em 1981 trabalhou no Vetagro-Boane, em 1995 trabalhou como segurança até 1997, ano que demitiram trabalhadores e ele foi atingido. Em 1998 tentou seguir os amigos abrindo um negocio de criação de frangos que só veio deixar o mesmo em 2002 quando teve a quebra de morte dos pintos. Sabado vive na casa própria. Sabado aprendeu o negocio copiando aos amigos desde 1998. Tem um estabelecimento permanente sita na AV. Da Namaacha no bairro Mazanbanine. Exercendo atividades comerciais ha 6 anos, o estabelecimento funciona das 7:00h até 21:00h excluindo os dias de muito movimento. Sabado tem dois empregados e tem vendido mais cerveja por 25,00mt, refresco por 10,00mt e semea por 120,00mt o saco. Sabado tem um rendimento entre 300,00mt e 1000,00mt por mês dependendo do movimento, pode ate fazer 2500,00mt por mês. Assim constitui como desafio para Sabado expandir ou manter o seu negocio. Para Sabado é o segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva e nunca teve empréstimo em outras instituições. O primeiro foi de 15000,00mt com qual comprou mercadoria aumentando o seu stock. Assim com este empréstimo Sabado quer comprar novamente mercadoria para de novo aumentar o stock e assim espera melhorar o seu negocio. O plano com o negocio daqui em diante é abrir mais estabelecimento no bairro onde ele reside bairro 07 e futuramente ampliar os negócios.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase stock.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima, 47 years old, is single and lives in a small village in the South of Lebanon. Her goal is to have a regular revenue stream and to provide for the basic needs of her family. Rima produces home-made mouneh (Arabic: food that is stored for later consumption, such as pickles, jams, tomato paste, etc.) She named her business Al Khayr (Arabic: good fortune).

Rima needs a loan of US$500 to purchase more ingredients and thereby expand her business. Rima has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for two cycles and has repaid her loans on time.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material to ensure food items production

loans.name: Gisela

texts.en:
Gisela is 29 years old. She is married with three children, aged eight, six and four. She has owned and run a small shop since 2004. Every day, she works from 6am to 12:30pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $450 from her sales.

Gisela will use her loan to purchase more inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Kunthea P., 27, and her husband, Mr. Sambath Khan, 42, who live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter.

Mrs. Kunthea has been a silk weaver for 15 years, a skill she learned from her aunt. She also has taught her husband to become a silk weaver as well. Besides weaving, he is also a musician. The couple sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Kunthea is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Hul

texts.en:
Hul S., 51, is married and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Currently, she is employed as a marketing officer and makes US$1 each day, while her husband is a traditional musician, earning US$1.50 each day. The couple has three children, two of whom are not living at home.

Hul S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to breed a cow. Leftover funds will be used to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi for extra profit.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M., 68, sells sarongs and homemade ice cream at the local market. Her daughter-in-law assists her in making the ice cream at her home. She has been in this business for the past two years. Sarah is married and has three children.

She is requesting the loan to purchase more sarongs and ingredients for making ice cream. She thanks Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients for ice cream and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Soutara Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe soutara sont des femmes mariées vivant en général dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne cinq (5) enfants. Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et résident toutes à sélengué (sous prefecture de Yanfolila dans la 3e région administrative du Mali).
Pour insuffler une nouvelle envergure à leurs activités, elles ont décidé de faire recours au service de l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt et le prémier prêt a été bien remboursé.
Elles s’pprovisionnent sur place et vendent sur place à l’étale ou en ambulant. Avec ce pret les femmes du groupe soutara comptent acheter 400  kilogrammes de graines d’arachide et beaucoup d’articles divers pour réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 36.000 FCFA par membre destiné à couvrir les dépenses familliales.
texts.en:
The members of the group Soutara are married women living generally in polygamous households and who have five children on average. They know one another by ties of community, and they all reside in Sélengué (sub-prefecture of Yanfolila in the third administrative region of Mali).

To infuse a new significance into their business, they decided on turning towards the services of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second loan, their first loan having been repaid.

They get their supplies locally and sell their goods either through their displays or by going door-to-door. With this loan, the women of the group each intend to buy 400 kg of peanuts and many items of different sorts in order to realize an average monthly profit of 36,000 francs CFA for covering family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts, tubers, and various items

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr: Ces femmes agées entre 25 et 46 ans habittent toutes dans un quartier de mbour a côté de la mer.Elles sont toutes mariées et mere de plusieurs enfants .Pour combattre l' inactivité et chômage qui frappent les femmes ,elles menent au sein du quartier des activités de transformation  et de vente des produits halieutiques .Pour accroitre leur capacite de production ,elles sollicitent un pret.
texts.en:
These women are between 25 and 46 years old and live next to the sea in a neighborhood of Mbour. They are all married and the mother of several children. To fight idleness and unemployment that affects women, they run several businesses in the heart of their neighborhood, in the sector of fish transformation and sale. To increase their capacity of production, they are seeking this loan.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their capacity of production

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Juan José G. le está haciendo falta el piso de concreto de un cuarto para tenerla ya terminado y así sus tres hijos tengan su propio espacio ya que están en edad escolar.
 Don Juan José G. trabaja en una maquiladora en el aria de técnico de calidad este es su ingreso familia y con el desea pagar este crédito. 
El día que fuimos a ser la visita del domicilio del señor Juan José G. no se encontraba estaba en su trabaja es por eso que en la foto aparece su esposa la señora  Juana María Hernández.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan José G.’s home needs a concrete floor in a room to finish it so his three children may have their own space as they are now school-aged. Juan José G. works in a factor as a quality technician and this is his family’s income with which he will pay back this loan. The day we went to visit Juan José G. in his home he wasn’t there as he was at work so his wife, Juana María Hernández, appears in the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Concrete floor

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Chuon S. is 25 years old and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Chuon has a motorbike and trailer and every day he transports wood to earn a living. He is able to make $4 profit per day. His wife stays at home cooking food and looking after their young child. She also has a business raising pigs on a plot of land behind their house. On average, she earns $1 each day. Mr. Chuon is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike and trailer to start a transportation business.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike and trailer to start a transportation business

loans.name: Demetrio Calixtro

texts.es: El Señor Demetrio Calixtro L. García tiene la edad de 52 años, su estado civil es soltero. Don Demetrio tiene 2 hijos que estudian y trabajan. La actividad económica de Don Demetrio es una pulpería. Hace más de siete años que se dedica a este negocio  y comenzó con la venta de golosinas con la ayuda de los financiamientos que Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones le han otorgado el ha podido mejorar su negocio. Los propósitos de Don Demetrio son de seguir manteniendo este pequeño negocio ya que es su principal ayuda en ingresos. El financiamiento es necesario para su capital de trabajo ya que administra de buena de forma el dinero por que recurre a las compras de productos como granos básicos, pollo, carne, queso y gaseosa. Sus deseos son de obtener una tienda de ropa por que le gustaría conocer otro tipo de negocio. la cantidad necesaria es de C$ 6.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Demetrio Calixtro L. García is 52 years old. He is single. Don Demetrio has two children who work and study. Dom Demetrio has a small store. He has had the store for more than seven years and began by selling candies with the help of financing from Fundación León 2000. He has been able to improve his business with the organizations that have funded him. Dom Demetrio’s goals are to continue in this small business, as it is his major source of income. This loan is necessary for working capital to be put to good use in the purchase of products such as basic grains, chicken, meat, cheese and sodas. His goal is to obtain a clothing store, because he would like to learn another type of business. The loan is for C$6,000 córdobas ($300 USD).

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jamuna

texts.en:
Mrs. Jamuna is a shopkeeper in the town of Chetrapati, Kathmandu. She opened her grocery store six years ago as a way to strengthen the economic condition of her family. She sells different types of items, including rice, maize and snacks. Competition is tougher than it used to be because there are now lots of grocery stores near hers. To stay in business, she needs to sells goods cheaply, and that means investing money in her store. That is why Mrs. Jamuna is requesting a loan to make her store better
.
Mrs. Jamuna is married and has three children, all of whom are still in school

loans.use: to buy goods to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Fipe

texts.en: Fipe F., 41, is married with 5 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people/public 2 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US $122).  SPBD loans are Fipe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. All of her loan will be used for the business.

loans.use: Farming supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del  bancomunal Virgen de las Mercedes.
Francisca es separada tiene 52 años tres hijos de 30, 25 y 22 años.
Cuando estaba casada tuvo conocimiento del negocio, y se le presento la oportunidad de comprar maquinarias de segunda y la compro con apoyo de sus hijos, hace cuatro años que alquila a las empresas maquinarias para construcción. Sus hijos le ayuda a repartir las maquinarias y su hijo le ayuda atendiendo a los clientes.
Francisca necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para la compra de repuestos de sus maquinas, como piñones, motor.
Desde que esta en Finca, su economía es mejor, ha podido adquirir un rotó-martillo para romper paredes, aprendió a ser puntual, responsable con los prestamos, ha recibido capacitaciones en la cuales ha aprendido el manejo del negocio, ahorrar para las emergencias.    
El sueño de Francisca es tener una flota de maquinas nuevas
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Virgen de las Mercedes community bank. 52-year old Fransisca is separated and has three children aged 30, 25, and 22. When she was married, she learnt how to run a business and had the opportunity to buy some used machinery which she bought with the help of her children. For the last four years she has rented out machinery used in construction. Her children help to repair the machines, and she and one of her sons attend to the clients. Francisca needs a loan of 1600 soles to buy spare parts such as pinions and engines. Since she has been with Kiva partner, Finca, her finances are better; she has been able to obtain a jack hammer for breaking up walls; she has learned to be on-time and responsible for her loans; she has undergone training and learned how to manage a business and how to save for emergencies. Francisca’s dream is to own a range of new machines.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as pinions and engines

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru: Гавхар Кахорова 1963 года рождения , замужем имеет 2 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. за кредитом обратилась в 2006 году. Кредит потратила на расширение бизнеса. Торгует на рынке конфетами и другими сладостями почти 12 лет. Когда получила первый кредит ей необходимо было провести свадьбу но с оборота денег не хотела  брать. Тогда решила обратиться за кредитом. Провела свадьбу, а бизнес продолжал развиваться. Раньше торговала мелочами. Сейчас благодаря КИВА  расширила свой оборот до большого размера.
texts.en:
Gavhar K. was born in 1963. She is married and has two children, but did not go to college. She came to MicroInvest in 2006 for a loan, which she spent to expand her business. For nearly 12 years, she has sold candy and other sweets at the market. When she received her first loan, she had to put on a wedding, but did not want to take the money out of her working capital, so she decided to apply for a loan. She was able to put on the wedding, and her business continued to grow. In the past she dealt in small items, but thanks to Kiva has increased her turnover dramatically.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Alejandro Santos

texts.es: Alejandro Santos S. E. de 40 años de edad, reside en San Martín junto a su esposa y un hijo. Él posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad en su casa, y su esposa colabora con los ingresos familiares con una venta de tortillas. Alejandro solicita un préstamo con el fin de poder surtir más su tienda con productos como lácteos, bebidas, golosinas, entre otros más. Alejandro tiene como meta el mejorar su negocio, ya que es de esta manera donde obtienen la mayor cantidad de ingresos, es por esto que es muy importante para él obtener dicho préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejandro Santos S. E. is 40 years old and lives in San Martin with his wife and son. He runs a store from his home, where he sells basic household items. His wife contributes to the family's income by selling tortillas. Alejandro is requesting this loan so that he can stock his store with a wider selection of items, including dairy products, drinks, candy and other products. Alejandro's goal is to improve his business, since this will allow him to maximize his profits. This is why it is very important for him to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Offer a wider selection of items in general store

loans.name: Akoété

texts.fr: Monsieur A. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail des cartes de recharges MOOV, TOGOCEL et ILLICO,il fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. la vente de carte de recharge est très développée à Lomé, cela est dû à  l’existence de plusieurs sociétés de téléphonie. Dans son quartier il est le seule à exercer cette activité ce qui constitue encore un plus pour lui. Sa clientèle grandit, pour mieux les satisfaire, il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 02 cartons de cartes ILLICO, 04 cartons de cartes TOGOCEL et 02 cartons de cartes MOOV.
texts.en:
Mr. A. earns his living retailing phone cards for MOOV, TOGOCEL et ILLICO. He sells his phone cards on foot, door-to-door. The sale of phone cards is widespread in Lomé, due to the existence of several phone companies. In his neighborhood, he is the only one in this line of work which is an advantage for him. His clientele is growing and so that he can better satisfy them, he is asking WAGES for a loan to buy two boxes of Illico phone cards, 4 boxes of Togocell cards, and 2 boxes of Moov cards.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of phone cards for resale

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
A. Rose 32, is the leader of Mpasha Bamwe loan group in Ibanda. She is a determined and very hard-working lady with a retail shop that she has owned for 2 years. Rose was a housewife involved in farming until the proceeds from her farm helped her to open her retail shop. She says that her good customer care and general organization have helped her succeed in business. She can now make 200,000/= profits per month. She hopes to expand her shop further.

Rose is married and has four children, aged 13 to 9 months, in primary schools and she cares for one additional dependant. She dreams of seeing all her children attend and have the best education so that they can be responsible people in future. Rose’s loans help her avoid running out of stock, and this loan will help her buy more shop products to increase her stock.

loans.use: Restocking her retail shop.

loans.name: Bizainab

texts.ru:
Бизайнаб торгует детской одеждой . Зимой  она торгует  куртками  и другой теплой одеждой.   Недавно  приехал ее  муж с России на  2 недели и ей придется сидеть дома ухаживать за ним.      Муж присылал  деньги с России , что и помогало ей поддерживать бизнес.  А теперь когда он   приехал  и привезенные деньги  потратят на дом и подготовку детей к школе.   
А Бизайнаб возьмет кредит  и поедет за товаром в Уратюбе.
texts.en:
Bizainab sells children's clothing. During the winter, she sells jackets and other warm clothing. Her husband recently returned from Russia for two weeks, and she has to stay home and take care of him. Her husband used to send money from Russia, which helped Bizainab support the business. And now that he came back, they will spend the money he brought back for the house and to prepare their children for school. Bizainab plans to obtain a loan and go to Utratube for the merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao N., age 36, is married and has six children. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. To make a living, she is engaged in a small business of producing Cambodian traditional cake (bananas with rice wrapped together in banana leaves), typically earning a gross income of US $4.00 per day. Her husband also plays a major role in the family finances. To generate a better source of income for his family, he is engaged in a business transporting palm sugar to sell with an income of US $9 per day. The family is also assisted by two of her children who are currently employed in a local garment factory.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, N. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most.

In light of the country's economic difficulties, N. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer, a purchase that she sees as a great opportunity to collect coconuts from her village and other nearby places and sell them off at a fair but profitable price.

loans.use: purchasing a motorbike and a trailer

loans.name: Kaku

texts.en:
Kaku P., a 40-year-old woman living in Atlabara near Nyokuron Cultural Center, is widowed due to the death of her husband from malaria, two years ago. She is the mother of four children who are all attending Buluk Primary School. Kaku sells rice and beans at the market and is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders in order to stock more beans to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, Kaku is hoping to open up a shop near her home in the future.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy necessary farming materials.

loans.name: Glicerio

texts.es:
Glicerio tiene 60 años, está casado, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos mayores de edad en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva arroz (20 hectáreas), pero mientras este producto tenga consistencia y madurez, se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, tiene 80 animales, los mismos que alimenta adecuadamente para que obtengan un peso y tamaño atractivo para su comercialización. Glicerio cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y su esposa, quienes aprovechan los espacios de terreno para sembrar productos para su consumo diario. Lo que a Glicerio le gusta de su trabajo es que se mantiene activo y enseña a sus hijos lo que aprendió, además es una actividad muy rentable, porque ya cuenta con un comprador de arroz estable y con respecto a su ganado, obtiene ganancias netas cuando los vende.
Con MFP ya tiene 11 créditos y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas confiables y muy responsables. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará un aproximado de cien soles en granos de arroz para seguir sembrando, con lo restante y aportando de sus ahorros adquirirá un toro de buena raza.
texts.en:
Glicerio is 60 years-old, married, and lives with his wife and his 2 adult children. For 20 years he has worked in the agriculture business. Today he grows rice (20 hectares), but when this product is consistent and growing he also works raising cattle. Now he has 80 animals which he feeds appropriately so that they gain weight and their size becomes attractive to customers. Glicerio is helped by his children and his wife who take advantage of the space on the land to plant products for their daily consumption. What Glicerio likes about this work is that it keeps him active and he can teach his children what he has learned. Also, it is very profitable business as he already has a stable rice buyer and always makes a net profit when selling cattle.

Glicerio has already gotten 11 loans with MFP. He likes the communal bank because his fellow members are very trustworthy and responsible. With the money from the loan he is asking for, Glicerio would buy about 100 soles worth of rice to plant, and with the rest and his savings would acquire a bull from good stock.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and a bull

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
Mirna Ordoñez B. es una señora de 39 años de edad quien vive con dos de sus cuatro hijos. La comunidad donde vive doña Mirna se llama Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio.

Desde hace más de 18 años doña Mirna se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de granos básicos. Dice que el mercado para estos productos es muy bueno ya que es forman parte de los alimentos principales que se consumen en Costa Rica. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.

En estos momentos doña Mirna desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢450,000 (cuatrocientos cincuenta mil colones), para agrandar un poco más su siembra, darle mantenimiento, además comprar fertilizantes, semillas entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con productos de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto. 

Doña Mirna es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su cuarto  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mirna Ordoñez B. is 39 years old and lives with two of her four children. The community where she resides is called Canalete and is located in the province of Alajuela. This region is a semi-mountainous area where the main business activities are agriculture and livestock breeding. It is a community that has great opportunity for development and establishment of micro-enterprises in both agribusiness and commercial trade.

Doña Mirna has been involved in agriculture for more than 18 years, specifically the cultivation of basic grains. She says the market of these products is very good because they are staples that are consumed throughout Costa Rica. Thanks to her business, her living conditions have improved considerably. Mirna also claims that she has grown as a person and has acquired much knowledge.

At the moment, she is requesting a microloan of 450,000 colones in order to increase her plantings slightly. Doña Mirna will also pay for maintenance and purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other supplies. Through this investment, she expects a good harvest and hopes her output will command a high market price.

Doña Mirna is a member of the Community Credit Enterprise of Canalete, one of 100 partner organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her fourth loan and she hopes to continue growing personally and financially. She is an active participant of her local credit organization.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for cultivating grain

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is a 30-year-old married woman with four children aged between 4 and 12 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with six people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.

Jalia owns a stationery shop in Nabulagala selling all types of stationery such as pens, exercise books, black books, masking tape, etc. She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week and receives an average of twenty customers a day and an income of 50,000/=.

Jalia’s major business challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing price of stationery. Her monthly expenses include school fees, and feeding the family and rent for the business. She incurs additional transport costs to and from shopping for her stationery in the shops in Nkrumah Road in Kampala city center.

Jalia has been in this business for over four years and with MCDT for one year. She is servicing her third loan working with the same group members. She joined MCDT because it was near her home. She wants to use this loan to buy more stationery like books, pens and masking tape.

Jalia is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more stationery for her store

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La señora Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el  distrito de Capachica, Provincia Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 58 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Hilata, estudio educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años y su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado ovino, que luego venderá al menudeo (carne por kilos) en las ferias de la zona, una vez por semana.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando para poder educar a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y la forma de los préstamos.
texts.en:
. Alejandra, 58, is a member of the “Juchuy Niño” communal bank located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is married and has 4 children. She lives in Hilata and finished elementary school. She has been associated with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 6 years. Her initial, 300 new sol, loan was used to buy small farm animals. Currently, she needs a 700 new sol loan to buy sheep which she will later sell at retail (meat by the kilogram) in the local markets once a week. Her greatest wish is to continue working so that she can afford her children's education. She likes the savings and the way the loans are administered.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fertilizer to enrich soil

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
La actividad pecuaria es una actividad que requiere de mucho esfuerzo y gran dedicación porque son trabajos que en muchas ocasiones provocan fatiga por la exposición al sol y el traslado de ganado en el municipio de Nagarote en León.

La señora Jaqueline Q. desde hace cinco años inició el trabajo de la actividad pecuaria por medio de la crianza de ganado como lo son terneros de desarrollo los que son cuidados por ella misma habiendo alcanzado experiencia en esto por su gran dedicación.

El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de cinco terneros de desarrollo para proceder a su crianza y así extraerle la leche para comercializarla y obtener el sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
Raising livestock is an activity that requires a lot of effort and commitment because many times the work causes fatigue due to sun exposure and moving livestock in the municipality of Nagarote, Leon. Jaqueline Q. started this activity five years ago, raising cattle on her own allowed her to gain experience in the business due to her great commitment. The loan requested is to purchase five calves to raise and milk them, and this way make money to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase five calves

loans.name: Rabiyya

texts.en:
Rabiyya I. is a 41-year old single woman who lives with her parents. Her diligent search for a source of additional income has been a permanent and difficult task for Rabiyya. After trying to earn more by working as nurse, she decided to try a livestock business to find an additional source of income. She started this business 20 years ago with the support of her parents. Now that Rabiyya has experimented and acquired the necessary knowledge, she would like to expand her business.

Rabiyya is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to buy more three more calves and fodder so that she can increase her earnings and continue to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is from the village of Bagong Silang, Iligan City. She is 28 years old. Alice is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alice owns and operates a specialized retail business, buying and selling video taped movies and other video tapes in the local community.  Alice has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Alice joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Alice is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in renovating her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Claudia Guissel

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, específicamente en el mercado El Bisne, la señora Claudia T. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a su actividad de venta de alimentos siendo preparados por ella misma con el fin de ofertarlos para así obtener sus ingresos para el mantenimiento de su hogar.
Ella está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como lo es el aceite, arroz, frijoles, plátanos, entre otros. Con este crédito ella continuará elaborando los deliciosos platillos para su respectiva venta.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega department, in the El Bisne market, Señora Claudia T. works hard selling food that is always prepared by herself personally, in order to earn money to maintain her home. She is requesting this loan to purchase raw materials such as oil, rice, beans, and bananas among other things. With this loan she will continue to create her delicious dishes for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for food preparation

loans.name: Tsalom

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme  est un célibataire et réside dans le quartier de Tokoin wuiti, pour subvenir à ses propres charges, il s’est lancée en 2005 dans le commerce de cartes de recharges, ce commerce marche très bien à Lomé, car il y a 3 entreprises de téléphonie mobile sur place  et les togolais consomment beaucoup en crédit de communication, il fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. Actuellement la demande de ses clients est élevée pour se réapprovisionner, il sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de cartes de recharges de TOGOCELL, MOOV et ILLICO.
texts.en:
Tsalom K. is a single young man who lives in the Tokoin Wuiti quarter. To provide for his needs, he entered the top-up card trade in 2005. This trade is very good in Lomé because there are three cellular phone businesses and the Togolese use a lot of communication credit. He does his business moving place to place. Nowadays, his clients' demands are very high. He is asking for his first loan from WAGES to restock and purchase top-up cards from TogoCell, Moov, and Illico.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of top-up cards

loans.name: Bat-Undrah

texts.en:
Bat-Undrah is 29 years old and lives with her husband, son and daughter in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house. Bat-Undrah's husband is a carpenter by trade and works in housing construction.

Presently, Bat-Undrah operates a small cafe in the city. She started her business in October 2009 with one employee. Bat-Undrah previously worked as a cook at another popular cafe for a year and gained experience in her trade. In just a short time she has made much progress with her business and attributes her success to her cafe's good location.

Bat-Undrah is a very hardworking person and has good business sense. She is already making plans to expand her cafe by improving the quality and taste of her food, as well as adding more tables and chairs to accommodate her many new customers. She says “I would like grow my earnings so that I can purchase my workspace.”

Bat-Undrah is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug loan to purchase a freezer, a display refrigerator, and a stove for her cafe. She also hopes to use some of the funds to purchase meat before prices go up.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer, refrigerator and stove for her café

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 39 years old and has been farming for ten years in the Kitale region of Western Kenya. She cultivates a mixed crop and sells maize, bananas, potatoes, and vegetables at the local market. She also earns some extra income selling second-hand clothing. She says the greatest challenge to her business remains the changing weather patterns, which have been a big setback because it makes it difficult to plan farming operations appropriately. 

She requested this loan for Ksh. 31,200 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow to add to her farm. She says that because this is her first loan she will work hard to achieve greater things as far as her farming is concerned. Joan says that she feels optimistic that through Juhudi she will liase with other members to pool together their resources to buy and operate a mini-chilling plant for their milk in the next five years. 

Joan is married with seven children, five of whom are attending school. She hopes that the added income generated by this loan will be a boost for her family by allowing her children to get a quality education and have a quality meal at the end of the day.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 54 years old and married with seven children ranging in age from 15 to 35 years old. Only her youngest child is still enrolled in school. She has been running her mixed farm in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, for the past 12 years now. Her primary income comes from the sale of maize, beans, and potatoes. She also runs an agrovet (a small animal veterinary store) in her home area for additional income. She says that the main challenge to her business is fluctuation in market prices for local goods. This also makes it difficult to get customers to buy supplies from her shop if they are making less income than before.

Jane has built up a good credit history with Juhudi Kilimo, having satisfied two loans of Kes. 10,000 and Kes. 20,000. She has now requested this loan for Kes. 30,000 to expand her stock of poultry. She says that this loan has helped her diversify her farming and enabled her to have multiple sources of new income. She is also in a better position to meet her family's basic needs. In the future, Jane would like to expand her agrovet business to other town centers within the area because she feels there is an untapped market.

loans.use: To expand her stock of poultry

loans.name: Escarlatas 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Sonia, 59, is the coordinator of her group Las Escarlatas (The Scarlets), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two adult children.

Sonia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling natural medicines, purses and sweets. She will use the profits to pay for her medicines. She also intends to aid her daughter in achieving her dream of completing a master's in medicine. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines, purses, and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Ramatou

texts.fr:
Née le 02 Juin 1967 à Bobo Dioulasso (au Burkina Faso), Ramatou O. est mariée et mère de six enfants, elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Madame Ramatou O.  mène une activité d’achat et  de vente des condiments alimentaires il y a plus de trente ans, depuis très jeune auprès de sa maman. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’accroitre, elle décida  de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ sept ans. Elle a eu plusieurs  prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) avec une association des femmes à Kadiolo Noumousso et est maintenant à son 4ème prêt individuel, tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce présent prêt, elle compte acheter, 12 cartons de  concentrée de tomate, 6 cartons de cube maggie, 3 sacs de graine de poivre, 3 sacs d’oignon séchés, 2 sacs de feuilles de Lorié, 5 cartons de moutarde et d’autres condiments au grand marché de Sikasso. 
Elle revend ses marchandises en gros, en détail, au comptant et à crédit,  aux consommateurs et aux détaillants du nouveau marché de Médine  où elle mène son activité. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA qui sera utiliser pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Elle ambitionne devenir une grossiste au niveau du marché où elle opère afin de servir les détaillantes de ce marché qui ont souvent du mal à s'approvisionner facilement.
texts.en:
Born July 2, 1967 in Bobo Dioulasso (in Burkina Faso), Ramatou O. is married and the mother of six children. She lives with her spouse and their children in Hamdallaye, one of the quarters of Sikasso. Mrs. Ramatou O. has bought and sold food condiments for 30 years, following her mom's work since she was very young. With the intention of better satisfying her ever-growing clientele, she decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about seven years ago. She received several group loans with an association of women in Kadiolo Moumousso and is now on her fourth individual loan. All of her previous loans have been repaid in full. With this loan, she plans on buying 12 cartons of tomato concentrate, six cartons of seasoning, three bags of pepper grains, three bags of dried onions, two bags of Lorié leaves, five cartons of mustard, and other condiments at the large market in Sikasso. She sells her products at wholesale and retail. Sales are done cash and credit to customers and retail distributors at the new Médine market where she does her business. With this loan, she foresees making a monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA which she will use to contribute to her family's needs, pay the interest on the loan, and invest the rest in her business. She plans on someday becoming a wholesale distributor at the new market where she works in order to serve the retail distributors there who often have difficulty getting supplies.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of condiments

loans.name: Sokleang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokleang T. (pictured here), 43 years old, and her husband, Mr. Piseth Huy, 53, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. The eldest daughter is a garment factory worker and other three attend school. 

Sokleang is a farmer. She grows bananas and flowers. Her husband is an electrician. She does not have enough capital to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to maintain her banana and flowers farm. So, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to help her capital.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is thirty-seven years old, married, and has one child aged twelve years old. Her business is located at Mukuru kwa Njenga, a busy market, especially during the morning hours. She has been selling fruit and vegetables such as oranges, onions, kale, cabbages, carrots and other vegetables for the last ten years to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is the changing weather which destroys the vegetables. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. 

Rose is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more fruit and vegetables to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and be able to open a supermarket some day. She also sees herself owning a home. She describes herself as very hard-working and honest.

loans.use: Fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Trustful Friends Group

texts.en:
Reatta Z., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "Trustful Friends." She is 27 years old, married and has three children between one and 7 years old. She also cares for two siblings She was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to financial constraints.  For two years, she has been selling red palm oil in Gbarnga, Bong County, central Liberia. She plans to use her 4,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 20,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more gallons of red palm oil. She describes herself as jovial. Her goal is to improve her business, build a storeroom and continue to educate her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Amelia is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red palm oil.

loans.name: Moshina Enole

texts.en:
Moshina Enole M. is a 56-year-old married woman. Her husband's name is M., and they have two children.

To earn a living, she is a farmer. She farms her own piece of land, and she notes that she has been in this business for the last seven years.

She learned about KADET through KADET staff in her area of residence. This would be her first loan through KADET. She is seeking $40,000 KES ($500) to prepare her land so that she can plant wheat. With the expected profits from the proceeds of this loan, she intends to plant wheat on a larger plot of land. Her dream is to be able to buy a bigger plot of land, where she could engage in commercial farming. She explains that she is a hardworking woman and very determined to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To expand the business by preparing her land for wheat production

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian, Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones.
Antonia es de la comunidad de Chanquil y se dedica a la venta de quesos que compra en su comunidad y también produce, Antonia para la mayor parte de su tiempo en la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde estudian sus hijos, y los días sábados y domingos en su pueblo en donde se dedica a la siembra y crianza de animales, el mayor sueño de Antonia es comprar un terreno en la ciudad de Ayacucho para que sus hijos tengan mas comodidad, pues hasta la fecha vive en casa alquilada. El préstamo que solicita será invertido en la compra de ganado.
texts.en:
Antonia is married and has 6 kids, 4 of whom are in school. Antonia is a member of the Communal Bank Futuro and the thing she likes the most are the training sessions. Antonia is from the community of Chanquil and works selling cheese, which she both produces and buys from her community. Antonia spends the majority of her time in the city of Ayacucho where her children study. On Saturdays and Sundays she spends her time in her town where she works planting crops and raising animals. Antonia's greatest dream is to buy land in the city of Ayacucho so her children can have more comfort. As of today she rents the house they live in. The loan she is requesting will be invested in cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 21-year-old single woman who has worked as a hairdresser since 2006. Sara is a hard worker who is talented in her business and loves her business a lot. In addition to the hairdresser work, she also does faciA. treatment, makeup, tattoo, massage and waxing services, which increases her work and improves her picture among her clients. 

Sara seeks perfection in her work; she’s updated with every new product to use, in addition to new hairstyles and makeup. Sara believes that to deA. with people, you have to be patient and know how to deA. with different types of people. 

This is the first time Sara requests a loan from A. Majmoua and she’s hoping to increase her beauty products in addition to fixing certain important issues. Sara hopes to buy a sauna machine, a tanning machine and a laser machine so that her beauty center will be more than perfect.

loans.use: To increase her beauty products

loans.name: Cristian  Maria

texts.es: La señora Cristian Maria,  tiene 40 años, ella es casada  y tiene tres hijos de 7, 10 y 13 años respectivamente. Su esposo trabaja como vendedor de granos básicos de manera ambulante. La señora tiene un negocio pequeño de pulpería, el cual está localizado en su casa de habitación,  empezó con este negocio desde hace cuatro años, ahora posee buena clientela establecida. Este negocio nació ante la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra para su familia, ya que el ingreso del esposo es insuficiente para mantenerse. Ella desea este préstamo con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de mercaderías para el negocio, ya que surtiendo la venta con más y mejores productos espera vender más e incrementar sus ganancias. Su sueño es llegar a convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea o mini súper que pueda suplir las necesidades de ella y de su comunidad al no tener que viajar a otros lados a realizar las compras.
texts.en:
Cristian Maria is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are 7, 10, and 13 years old. Her husband works as street vendor selling basic grains. Cristian Maria has a small neighborhood store, which is located in her own home. She started this business four years ago, and now she has a good established set of customers. The business was born out of the necessity to earn extra income for her family, since her husband's income was not enough to make a good living. She is requesting this loan with the objective to invest it in the purchase of merchandise for the business, since by stocking the store with more and better products, she hopes to sell more and increase her earnings. Her dream is to be able to convert her small store into a general store or mini supermarket, which can meet her own needs and those of the community, so that they don't have to travel elsewhere to do their shopping.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase merchandise for her small local store

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Nicasia; ella tiene 61 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio D. venta D. golosinas en forma ambulatoria, ella venD. en la puerta del colegio Sivirichi  desD. las 10:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, ella venD. variedad D. golosinas como galletas, dulces, chicles y chupetes, la socia quiere tener un puesto para vender las golosinas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  golosinas al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member is Mrs. Nicasia. She is 61, married, and has 2 children. The member alternates her daily activities with selling sweets as a street merchant. She sells them in the entrance to the Sivirichi school from 10 am to 6 pm. She sells a variety of sweets such as cookies, candies, gum and lollipops. Nicasia would like to have a stand where she can sell the sweets, and she is asking for the loan to buy them wholesale. Nicasia thanks those who are part of her dream and commits to making her payments in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is asking for a loan to buy sweets wholesale

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel  de Jesus M. C., de 49 años de edad, casado, docente,Tiene tres hijos  de 19, 15 y 9 años de edad, los cuales estan estudiando, la esposa es maestra de secundaria y le ayuda en los gastos del hogar.

  El Sr. M. C.  labora para el Ministerio de Educación desde hace 22 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad. 

 Esta solicitando su 7mo. credito para comprar zing y ponerle parte del techo que le falta a su casita que junto a su esposa han venido construyendo.  Su sueño es continuar trabajando con financiamientos que le brinda Afodenic para de esta manera mejorar cada dia mas su vivienda y brindarle mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesus M. C. is 49 years old; he is married and he is a teacher. He has three children, aged 19, 15, and 9 years old. They are all attending school. His wife is a high school teacher and she contributes to the household expenses. 

Mr. M. C. has worked for the Ministry of Education for the past 22 years, working with great responsibility and honesty.

He requests a seventh loan to purchase roofing materials to install the roof on the house that he and his wife have been building. His dream is to keep up with the loans provided through Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) and to continue building their home, and to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To replace a roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita G. is from the village of Research Minante 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 45 years old. Jovita is married. To make a living, Jovita owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. She also sells some livestock feed. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Jovita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Yoli Jane

texts.es:
Yoli de 39 años, tiene tres hijos de 17, 8 y 4 años está separada de su esposo. Es comerciante informal de sabanas, toldos en una zona periurbana ubicado en la Perimetral de Guayaquil zona rodeada de un estero.

Empezó hace 7 años a ser comerciante porque le generaba buenos ingresos y también le daba tiempo para pasar con sus hijos. En la actualidad ella comprar sabanas, toldos y los vende a sus vecinos conocidos y potenciales clientes a crédito y al contado. El juego de sabanas las vende $ 38.00, los toldos a $ 45.00 (son cubiertas para camas y así evita que entren los insectos). Trabaja en horarios variados para poder ayudarles a sus hijos en los estudios. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar toldos, sabanas para tener variedad en los diseños. En el futuro quiere tener un local de la mercadería que vende y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en: Yoli is 39 years old. She has three children who are 17, 8, and 4-years-old and she's separated from her husband. She's an informal merchant and she sells sheets and mosquito nets in the outskirts of Guayaquil by the Perimetral, which is surrounded by a marsh. She began selling 7 years ago because she made good money and it let her spend time with her children. She currently buys sheets and mosquito nets and sells them to her friends and neighbors and occasionally gives credit to potential customers. She sells the sheet sets for $38 and the mosquito nets for $45. She works odd hours so that she can help her children with their schoolwork. With this loan she wants to buy mosquito nets and sheets in a variety of designs. In the future she wants to have a shop and to finish building her house.

loans.use: Purchase of sheets and mosquito nets

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira D. is a married woman who lives in Basak Merkado, Brgy Basak, Lapu-lapu City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, an electronic reloading business and a frozen products business. Her husband Richard D., who is 41 years old, works as a painter in Dubai. They have three children between 10 and 20 years old. 

Elvira joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elvira has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 20,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her fourth cycle loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP to use as working capital to continue to save for the future.  Elvira D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have chosen a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to use as working capital

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita A. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Marlita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlita buys and sells seafood products, including fish like bariles & sardines. Marlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Marlita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like mackerel and milk fish. This Marlita's 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like mackerel & milk fish

loans.name: Malikahon's Group

texts.en:
Malikahon S., 50, is the treasurer of this group. She is married to a barman. She has raised two sons. Both sons are working in Russia in a furniture factory. In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Malikahon sells convenience goods on the market. In this way, she earns 8,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a variety of goods in order to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to expand her business and open one more trade place.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Mathew Ndambuki

texts.en:
Mathew is 50 years old and married to Rose who contributes to the family income. He supports 10 members of his family. He has been farming for the past two years with an income of about KES. 20,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD  and he intends to use it to buy farm equipment such as jembe (a hoe), fork and fertilizer. He hopes to grow a variety of crops in his farm to increase his profit and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment such as jembe (a hoe), fork and fertilizer.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr:
Cliente très serviable, des que l'on rentre dans son resto, elle est très pragmatique a des prix très 
 abordables, a une forte esprit d'initiative puisqu'elle  crée  des nouveaux menus, et a use de beaucoup de stratégies de ventes pour bien écouler ses produits.
Par jour elle vendait jusqu’à 50.000F avant le premier prêt, après elle a augmenté  ses ventes jusqu’à 75000F jour car elle a bénéficié et pratiquée ce qu’elle a appris dans nos institutions.
Le prochain prêt va lui permettre d’augmenter son stock en achetant : 1carton de poissons salé, panier de poisson fumé, haricots, pâte d’arachides, sac de riz , bidon d’huile, tomate, ajouter quelque ustensiles qui lui manquent pour son restaurant.

Elle veut générer  plus de revenus qui vont lui permettre de soutenir les études  de sa fille en journalisme.
Femme seule elle se bat pour son épanouissement au travers son activité.
texts.en:
This client offers a friendly welcome to customers the moment they enter her  eatery. She is very pragmatic, and  sells at reasonable prices. She has a creative spirit as she  comes up with new menus and uses different  sale strategies in order to keep her products moving. Before the first loan, her daily receipts amounted up to 50,000 Francs. Now that she is able to increase her income to 75,000 francs per day as she practices the skills she was able to learn at our institution.

The new loan will allow her to expand her stock by purchasing one box of salted fish, a basked of smoked fish, beans, peanut paste, a bag of rice, a jug of oil, tomatoes and some utensils missing for her eatery. She would like to increase her income in order to be able to pay for her daughter’s journalism studies. A single woman, she works very hard to succeed in her business.

loans.use: Achat : a box of salty fish,  a basket of smoked fish,  a jug of vegetable oil,   a braid of onions  ,  beans, peanut paste,  canned tomatoes

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María  tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a sus tres hijos y su esposo en el caserío Valle San Juan del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.
