Se dedica a la venta de bebidas como cerveza y chicha de jora, ella ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona, El negocio tiene una antigüedad de 2 años y es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de el se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía familiar.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de productos ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María, 48, is married and lives with her three children and her husband in the Valle San Juan Hamlet in Tambogrande district, an agricultural zone located in Piura region, over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

She sells beverages like beer and chicha de jora (drink based on fermented corn) to her neighbors and people who come into the zone to work.  She’s been in business for two years and it is of great help to her family because through it she’s able to help support the family economy.

María would like to expand the business buying products because demand has increased.  She has, therefore, deemed it advisable to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that she plans to use to reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy more stock items for her pub.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Mrs. Helen R. is 40 years old, widowed, and lives at Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta City. She has four children. It is not easy for Helen to be a mother & father at the same time. Determination and hard work are what Mrs. R. believes in. She joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to avail herself of its loan facilities. The co-op teaches their members to have a "livelihood project" or business in order to become productive and self-reliant. 

Helen has accessed loans several times. Some were used for the payment of tuition fees for her children. Now, she is applying for PHP 2,000 to buy additional goods for sale for her sari-sari store business.

She would be contented & happy as a mother if she sees all her children become successful in their chosen career.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for sale

loans.name: Kalume

texts.en:
Kalume is married with 3 children; two attend school while one is still young for school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

For the past 3 years, he has operated a vegetable stall and sold dry fish to the local residents. Kalume faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation of dry fish from Nyanza Province. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES, Kalume wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and sacks of dry fish to sell. He joined Yehu Microfinance because of efficiency of a variety of loan products.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables and sacks of dry fish to sell

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine A. O. is a married lady. Her husband is a trader and they have six children aged between twenty-three years old and twelve years old. She owns a clothing sales business in which she sells second-hand clothes to the local people. Her business is located at the busy Oile market in Kisumu. She also goes to other market centres outside Kisumu town for specific market days. Kisumu is the region in Kenya known for production of fish. It harbours Lake Victoria and is commonly known as the Lake Basin. 

Dorine has been in this business for twenty years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is lack of a permanent place to run her business, making it difficult to work for long hours as well as retain customers. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 60,000 to buy more clothes to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes that in future, she will be importing clothes, shoes and bags. She describes herself as tolerant and responsible.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rosio Micaela

texts.es: La Sra. Rosio, vive en  la zona de  Molle Molle,   viven en alquiler  hace varios años en la misma zona, tiene  dos hijos  su esposo es profesor , la Sra. Rosio tiene una tienda de barrio a una cuadra de la escuela de la zona en plena esquina ella atiende su tienda de lunes a domingo se levanta desde muy temprano para abrir su tienda y atender a su familia, es una pareja joven trabajadores  están trabajando ambos  con la ilusión  de poder  ahorrar para comprar un terreno y así poder tener su propia casa . El préstamo lo destinara  para surtir su tienda comprando dulces, refrescos, abarrotes, la Sra. Rosio esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del  crédito.
texts.en:
Rosio has lived in the Molle Molle neighborhood in a rented home for a few years.  She has two children and her husband is a teacher.  

Rosio has a convenience store that is located one block from the local school.  She tends the store from Monday to Sunday.  She gets up very early to open the store and care for her family.  Rosio and her husband are a hardworking young couple who are working together to be able to save money to purchase land and be able to have their own house.  

She will use this loan to stock her store with sweets, drinks, and groceries.  Rosio is thankful to the institution for the support they have given by granting the loan.

loans.use: to stock her store with sweets, drinks, and groceries.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Roberto le esta haciendo falta un cuarto que será para sus hijos.
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es block, cemento y varillas, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y terminar la recamara de sus hijos y así podrán tener su propio espacio en su casa. 
Pagara el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fabrico.
texts.en:
Mr. Roberto's house is in need of an additional room for his children.  He is requesting a loan to buy materials such as blocks, cement and rods since he does not have the money himself right now.  He wants to finish his childfren's bedroom so they can have their own independent area in the house.

He will pay back the loan with part of the salary he receives as a factory worker.

loans.use: To finish a room

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 51 years old, divorced and lives with two family members, one of whom works.

Amale has been a tailor since 2000. She makes or repairs women’s clothing. She has good experience in this field and a good reputation and she is becoming well known in her area.

She is requesting $3000 to buy a generator and a sewing machine. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator and sewing machine.

loans.name: Ximena Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ximena, tiene 25 años, está casada y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de dos años  de edad. Su esposo esta en el extranjero. Ella estudia ingeniería en Marketing en la Universidad Laica de la ciudad de Manta.

Es una gran madre que comparte su tiempo entre el estudio, el cuidado de su pequeño hijo y el comercio ya que se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, en las mañanas recorre la ciudad visitando a sus clientes, también vende a sus compañeras de la universidad donde estudia.  Nos cuenta que  sus clientes le realizan muchos pedidos. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas y en las noches en la universidad. Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días. Tiene cuatro  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos, es la secretaria del mismo y le gusta por los beneficios que entrega la institución.
 
Sus sueños son terminar  sus estudios y ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes community bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial architecture and its handicrafts which are famous both nationally and internationally.  It is the home of the famous Panama hat.

Here we meet 25 year-old Ximena who is married and has a two year-old son.  Her husband is abroad.  Ximena is studying marketing engineering at Laica University, in the city of Manta.

Ximena is a great mother who divides her time between her studies, looking after her young son and her business selling all types of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door.  In the mornings, she travels round the city visiting her customers.  She also sells to her fellow students at university.  She tells us that her customers make a lot of orders with her.  She works every morning and studies at the university every evening.  She leaves her goods with her customers on credit and collects payment every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil every two weeks.  Ximena has been in this business for four years and it is going very well.

Ximena will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.  She has been a member of her community bank for three loan cycles and is the bank's secretary.  She likes it a lot because of the benefits that the institution provides.

Ximena's dreams are to complete her studies and become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 32-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and young child. He has owned a small grocery store since 2009, where he sells flour, sugar, tinned foods, etc. He is thankful for his decision to start a business; it allows him to improve his family's financiA. status. With his requested loan of $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., he will purchase additionA. merchandise for his shop. With these purchases he will be able to increase his sales and therefore his income. In the future, he is planning to also sell vegetables from his shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose a single mother of six children, all of whom are in school, lives in  Kampala, Uganda where she has been selling food at the market for three years, seven days a week. Her main business challenges are seasonality and theft. Rose has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bunches of bananas, sweet and Irish potatoes, and beef.   

Rose lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.  Rose's goals and aspirations are to own a fully-stocked restaurant and to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Marissa has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell. Marissa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marissa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Santos Rosas De Lima

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Santos le está haciendo falta la losa de concreto en dos cuarto. 
Está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material que es cemento, arena, varilla, madera y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y poner el techo de concreto porque es mas duradero, seguro y prevenir enfermedades a su esposa e hijos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una empresa como guardia de seguridad. Es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos’ house is lacking concrete roofing in two rooms.  He’s asking for the loan to be able to buy the material, which is cement, sand, iron rods and lumber and to pay the person who will do the improvement.

He wants to improve his family’s quality of life and install concrete roofing because it lasts longer, is safer and it helps prevent his wife’s and children’s illnesses.

He plans to repay the loan with part of the salary he earns working as a security guard at a firm.  This is his family’s source of income.

loans.use: to install concrete roofing.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes has one child who is in school. She is married. Agnes is a charcoal seller. She has been in this business for one year. She took a loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal to sell. She will use the profit from her business to pay for her child to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Afoua

texts.fr:
Afoua est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est mariée å un revendeur. Elle a 03 enfants.
Afoua travaille comme revendeuse de charbons de bois et céréales depuis 2000. Elle vend dans un marché de la place après achat à Anié. 
Afoua a requis son second  cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de charbons et des céréales.
texts.en:
Afoua is a 41-year-old woman who is married to a retailer. She has three children. She has been working as a retailer of charcoal and grains since 2000 selling at a local market. She first gets her supplies in Anié. 

Afoua has requested her second loan cycle at WAGES for buying sacks of charcoal and grains.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La señora Benedicta que tiene la edad de 27 años, estudio la secundaria, se encuentra casada con el señor M. que trabaja de obrero, ellos tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos se encuentra estudiando y uno tiene un año de edad. Ella y su familia viven en una region que se caracteriza por ser una de las mayores productores de azucar.

Doña Benedicta nos platica que desde hace un poco mas de 5 años decidio inciar con su negocio de venta de ropa porque penso que queria apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y como la situacion economica cada vez es mas dificil pues los gasto con sus hijos estudiando son mas y ella quiere ofrecerles una educacion a sus hijos y en un futuro una profesion.

Ella nos platica que  realiza sus ventas de ropa casa por casa mostrando sus prendas a sus amigas y vecinas,  algunas veces levanta pedidos y cuando se surte ya solo los entrega, ella nos dice que le gusta mucho ser comerciente porque ha conocido y hecho muchos amigos ademas de que con el tiempo ha hido aprendiendo muchas cosas sobre el comercio, tambien nos dice  que quiere que su negocio siga crediendo y continuara trabajando muy fuerte para lograrlo. 

Doña Benedicta necesita este prestamo para la compra de blusas, vestidos, pantalones, faldas, camisas, playeras, shorts, camisetas, ropa interior para dama y caballero para su posterior venta.

Ella espera que con este credito su negocio pospere y tambien nos dice que se encuentra muy agradecida con fundacion realidad por la confianza que le dan.
texts.en:
Sra. Benedicta is 27 years old and has a high school education.  She is married to Sr. M., who is a laborer.  They have three children, two of whom are in school while the other one is only a year old.  Benedicta and her family live in a region that is known for being one of the largest producers of sugar.  

Doña Benedicta says that she started her business selling clothes a little more than five years ago because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses.  Their financial situation gets more difficult each time now that they have children in school, yet she wants to offer her children an education so that they can pursue a profession in the future.  

Benedicta says that she sells clothes by going house to house, presenting her merchandise to her friends and neighbors.  Sometimes she takes orders and then handles the delivery by herself when the merchandise arrives.  Benedicta says she greatly enjoys being a merchant because it has allowed her to meet and make many friends.  Over time, she has learned many things about the retail business.  She also says that she wants her business to keep growing, so she will continue to work hard to make that happen.  

Doña Benedicta needs this loan to buy blouses, dresses, trousers, skirts, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, undershirts, and underwear for women and men that she can sell later.  

She hopes that this loan will prosper her business.  Benedicta also expresses her appreciation to Fundación Realidad for the trust that has been demonstrated to her.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, trousers, skirts, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, undershirts, and underwear.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, es agricultor, vive con su familia, es padre de ocho hijos, los cuales mantiene a través del trabajo agrícola, tiene 20 años de estar dedicado a la actividad y quien le enseño fue su padre.
Por el momento necesita comprar abono y semilla de maíz, para realizar el cultivo, teniendo estos materiales podrá sin ningún inconveniente realizar sus actividades.
El propósito de Wilfredo es que a través de préstamos, pueda enriquecer sus cultivos y apoyar a sus hijos, de la presente siembra espera tener abundancia de cosecha para poder comercializar.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is a farmer and lives with his family.  He has eight children and supports them through his agricultural work which he learned from his father and has been active in for 20 years.

He is in need of fertilizer and corn seed to carry out his activity and grow his crop.

Wilfredo's goal is to use the loan to make his crops better so he can provide for his children.  He hopes to have an abundant harvest.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and corn seed.

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en: Battsetseg is 52 years old and lives with her two daughters and husband in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. Her two daughters are currently unemployed. Her husband repairs cars. She started her business in 2000 by selling vegetables. She has been selling vegetables since then. In the beginning, she used to sell them at an open space. Now, she rents a commercial space at the local market and pays 26,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) per month. She purchased a storage house and truck for her business with her profits. She pays lots of attention to her children and their future. She is a diligent and hardworking woman who says, "I am very satisfied with my business and its future prospects. I have a plan to expand my business." She is requesting a 750,000-MNT loan to purchase vegetables and store them when the price is cheap.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 33 years old, single and blessed with three children. She sells secondhand clothes to the residents of Kangundo where the market has potential to grow if enough stock is in the business. There are regular customers. Rosemary has been in this business for the last six years and gets an income of KES.6,000 per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET officer. She has a good credit history in KADET and she is applying for her second loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to purchase socks, children's dresses, trousers, blouses, shirts and skirts.

She will use the anticipated profit to save for the future of her two boys. She is a very hardworking, self-driven business lady.

loans.use: to purchase socks, children's dresses, trousers and blouses.

loans.name: Resilene

texts.en:
Resilene is a young mother who has one infant child. She did not pursue college because she got married early. It is difficult for them to move on the first time, because they don't have any profession. Through the help of their parents, she is engaged in a hog-raising business while her husband manages their farm. They aim to earn and save more income to satisfy their needs and save for the future of their child. 

She wants to improve her hog-raising business to increase her income but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP10,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hog-raising business. She mentioned that this loan will be a great help for her to improve her business and make it a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 23 years old married woman (Her husband is shown in the picture.).

She has three sons.  Her husband works for the Palestinian National Authority and has a decent salary.  He also works as a taxi driver to increase his income. 

Huda wants to help her husband pay the expenses required to make repairs to his taxi.  This includes, changing tires, painting,...etc.  But she doesn't have enough money on hand, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN. 

The loan will help her husband work extra hours to increase his income and provide better living conditions to his family.


About this loan product:

 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to pay for making some repairs to the taxi.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is married with seven children aged 5 to 22. He has been a maize farmer for 34 years. He would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crop.

He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. Fertilizer is needed in order to increase production.
 
With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides to grow his crops.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora D. 64 años vive en compañía D. su esposo y uno D. sus hijos, en la localidad D. San Pedro D. Saño.  Hace 6 años abrió su tienda D. comestibles en su propia casa a fin D. poder tener una vida más tranquila, ella y su esposo se jubilaron es por eso que  desean seguir trabajando  pero D.  manera independiente, es así que Doña Teodora  es la encargada principal D. la atención D. su establecimiento en las cuales los días; donD. recibe mayores ganancias es cuando son las fechas muy festivas en su localidad como las fiestas patronales, fiestas patrias, día D. los santos, etc. Teodora no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad para crecer es por ello que siempre esta al pendiente D. innovar y mejorar su tienda para mantenerse activa. Ella pertenece al grupo oslidario “Cantuta” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donD. se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo D. todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago D. sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Teodora D. recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en surtir su tienda D. comestibles para esta campaña naviD.ña.
texts.en:
Teodora, 64, lives with her husband and one of her children in the town of San Pedro D. Saño.  Six years ago she opened her general store in her own house to be able to have a more peaceful life.  She and her husband retired, so they want to continue working, but independently.

In this way Teodora is the main one in charge of their business.  They receive the greatest profits on the most festive days in their town, such as patron saint days, national holidays, birthdays, etc.  Teodora does not miss any opportunity to grow, which is why she always devotes time to making innovations and improving her store, to keep it productive.

She belongs to the Cantuta solidarity group, and this is her sixth loan with MFP.  She feels happy about it since she is receiving the support of all of you, who allow her to continue with her business.  She also promises to be punctual in making her payments, since her bank is maD. up of responsible and supportive people.

When Teodora receives her support she will invest the money requested in supplying her store for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy sweets and various products for her store.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married and has 2 children. 

Jessica has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Jessica has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José, administra un taller de estructuras metálicas, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 5, 6 y 8 años de edad, todos son dependientes, él trabaja en la elaboración de cocinas y otros mobiliarios de hierro, todos sus productos los comercializa en el mercado.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de láminas, tubos, hierro, para la elaboración de las cocinas, ya que son su mayor demanda y se ha especializado mayormente en este producto,  el préstamo será una gran ayuda para poder comprarse todo lo necesario y continuar en la ejecución de su trabajo.
La aspiración de José es poner su propio negocio en otras zonas que le generen mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
José runs a metal shop.  He lives with his wife and three children, ages 5, 6, and 8, all of them dependent.  He works making stoves and other metal furnishings.  He sells all of his products in the market.

Currently he is requesting a loan to buy sheets of metal, pipes, and iron to make stoves, since they are in great demand and he has specialized primarily in this product.  The loan will be a great help to him to be able to buy himself all he needs and continue carrying out his work.

José's goal is to set up his own business in other areas that will generate greater profits for him.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal, pipes, and iron to make stoves.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es: Silvia de 33 años de edad es la propietaria de una miscelánea, donde  además de vender mercancías variadas, como accesorios, papelería, ropa etc., también ofrece el servicio de llamadas a celulares, aprovechando la clientela que diariamente le compra. Así ha logrado generar ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de hogar,  conformado por su cónyuge y sus  dos hijos en las edades de 14 y 15 años. Desde el año 2006 inició su negocio, vendiendo mercancía en pocas cantidades, luego agregó dos líneas a celulares, posteriormente dos vitrinas y poco ha poco ha ido logrando un buen surtido en su negocio. En la actualidad exhibe sus vitrinas en la puerta de su casa y sus hijos la ayudan. Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones habitacionales y lograr brindarles una educación exitosa a sus hijos,  para que puedan ser prósperos. En su negocio vende a crédito y principalmente de contado; su gran desafío diario es lograr ventas importantes, pero sobre todo que sus clientes regresen y sean fieles. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa, juguetería respondiendo así a los pedidos de sus clientes, que se alistan para tener en familias una navidad y un recibimiento de año muy felices y muy bien vestidos.
texts.en:
33 year old Silvia is the owner of a general store, where as well as selling various merchandise, like accessories, stationary, clothes etc., as well as offering a service of calls to cell phones, making the most of the clients that buy it every day. 

In this way she has managed to generate income to support the well-being of her family, made up of her spouse and two children aged 14 and 15. She started her business in 2006, selling small quantities of merchandise, next added to cellphone lines, then display cases and little by little she has been obtaining a good range for her business. Currently, she exhibits her display cases in the doorway of her house and her children help her. 

Her dream is to improve their living conditions and be able to provide a successful education for her children, so that they can prosper. 

In her business, she sells on credit and mainly cash sales; her main challenge is obtaining important sales, but above all that her clients come back and are loyal. 

Currently she is applying for her first kiva loan, with which she will buy clothes and toys in response to her clients requests, as they are preparing to have a  very happy and well dressed Christmas and New Year celebration with their families.

loans.use: to buy clothes and toys in response to her client's requests.

loans.name: Raïmatou A. Togni's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Raïmatou A. Togni, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 24 ans est mariée à un certain Abdoulaye. Le couple a trois  enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Raïmatou A. Togni vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Depuis six ans environ, Raïmatou A. Togni vend des serrures, des pointes et des baguettes, ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Raïmatou A. Togni s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Raïmatou A. Togni sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des serrures, des pointes et des baguettes.

loans.name: Sourou Zansi Florence

texts.fr: Sourou Zansi Florence âgée de 36 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Sourou Zansi Florence est mariée à un couturier du nom de Mathieu. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Sourou Zansi Florence vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Sourou Zansi Florence vend de la nourriture, des biscuits et des bombons à son domicile depuis quinze ans. De façon secondaire des pâtes alimentaires et des savons ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Sourou Zansi Florence s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Sourou Zansi Florence devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Sourou Zansi Florence sollicite une septième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des biscuits, des bombons et des céréales.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Fifty-nine-year-old Margaret has no academic papers to show off but she is an accomplished farmer who hails from the remote village of Kamplamai, in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, is blessed with eight adorable children. Despite her considerable age for the past 30 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, farmers come to seek advice from her. Margaret is the breadwinner of her family, and this really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Although she makes a profit from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Kitale area, one of the country's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Margaret could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Margaret, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Margaret believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Margaret to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.She dreams of building a modern house and moving from the mud house where she currently stays in.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Houégnamétor

texts.en:
Born on August 7, 1965 in Lomé, Ms. Houégnamétor A. is a married mother of two children and also takes care of one other child. As soon as she was married, her aunt got her into the business of selling tomatoes. Her husband, a taxi driver with unstable employment and income, leaves the responsibility of almost all of the household expenses up to his wife, who has difficulty paying them all. Setting up her business has not been easy for her because of her very limited means. With her belief in what she was doing and her courage, she succeeded in increasing her capital thanks to having obtained an initial loan of $250. Despite the fact that she is illiterate, she has an acute business sense and is rigorous in the management of her business, which has allowed her to repay her loan before the payment date.

She is requesting a new loan of $750 to go to neighboring villages to buy tomatoes in bulk and sell them retail. This will increase her profit margin, and she will be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 07 Août 1965 à Lomé, Madame A. Houégnamétor est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants et à sa charge 1 enfant. Initiée par sa tante aussitôt mariée, elle se lance dans le commerce des tomates. Son mari un chauffeur de taxi aux emplois et revenus irréguliers, laisse presque toutes les charges du foyer sur sa femme qui a du mal à s’en sortir. Les débuts de cette activité n’ont pas été faciles pour elle à cause de ses moyens très limités. Avec sa foi en ce qu’elle fait et par son courage, elle a réussi à augmenter son capital grâce à un premier crédit de $250 obtenu. Malgré qu’elle soit analphabète, elle a un sens aigu et rigoureux de gestion de son commerce, ce qui lui a permis de rembourser son crédit avant l’échéance.

Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 pour aller dans les villages environnants acheter en gros les tomates pour les revendre en détail. Ceci augmentera sa marge bénéficiaire et ainsi elle pourra améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Emily Kiteyia Sitat intends to buy beads in bulk

loans.name: Markline A.

texts.en: Markline is 23 years old. She is highly skilled in mat making. She hopes that with her loan she will be able to setup her own shop, and take control of her orders and supplies. This will allow her to be financially independent and venture into other fields as well.

loans.use: To set up a carpet making business.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Mrs. Tina L. lives in Asaba, Delta State. She is happy to be a Lift Above Poverty Organization member. She is married with five (5) children. She said LAPO has brought rain to her family and she needs the above loan to expand her business. She has 5 years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy more provision & foodstuff for sales

loans.name: Llane

texts.en:
From the time she was a little girl, Llane learned to sell fruits next to her dear mother who, with her ability and gentle touch, taught her daughter diligence and patience. She is now the mother of two school-age children. With her sister's assistance in selling her products, and her husband's help with the household expenses, she buys and sells fruits, corn and beans around the small farms lining the Federico Basadre highway in her hometown. In this form she tries to generate additional income to improve her family's quality of life.

During this entire time, she has been saving money with the goal of buying a small space to sell her products, but her savings are not quite enough. For this reason, she's requesting a loan in the amount of $200, which she will repay over a period of six months.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Llane desde muy pequeña aprendió y desempeño la actividad de venta de frutas a lado de su querida mamá, quién gracias a su habilidad y buen trato inculcó en ella mucha diligencia y paciencia. Ahora es madre de dos hijos que aún se encuentran en etapa escolar; mientras recibe el apoyo de su hermana en la venta y la colaboración de su esposo para satisfacer los gastos que genera diariamente su hogar se dedica a la compra y venta de granos de maíz y frejol por las tierras de cultivo que se encuentran en los márgenes de la carretera Federico Basadre de su ciudad. De esta manera trata de generar un ingreso adicional para incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia. Durante todo este tiempo ha estado ahorrando con el propósito de adquirir un espacio propio de ventas en el mercado, sin embargo aún el dinero con el que cuenta es insuficiente para concretar la compra; por esa razón solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares con el propósito de alcanzar sus objetivos motivo por el cual ella ha puesto en nosotros todas sus esperanzas y se compromete a devolver lo solicitado en un periodo de seis meses.

loans.use: To buy more inventory to increase her sales and save enough to open her own retail space.

loans.name: María Leticia

texts.es:
In March 1991, a friend of Leticia’s mother offered to make a demonstration in her house of the products which she now sells. This same friend suggested to her mother that she should sell these products, but her mother said it would be better is Leticia sold them and in this way she was able to fund her training, and later she changed her aims to try and meet the expenses of her two small children, as her husband is a construction worker and earns very little. This was how she began, first as a saleswoman and now she is the coordinator of a group of saleswomen and is working very hard to become a director – she hopes she will be able to achieve this.

However, the road is difficult and requires much strength and effort: for this reason she is asking for a loan of $575 USD which she will repay over a 5 month period, in order to buy the orders which have been made during this season, and thus achieve her outlined goals. With your help Maria Leticia will be able to move forward with her family.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde Marzo de 1991, una amiga de la mamá de Leticia le ofreció hacer una demostración en su casa de los productos que actualmente vende. Esa misma amiga le sugirió a su mamá vender dichos productos, pero su mamá dijo que mejor Leticia los vendiera y de esta forma ella se ayudaba a costear su carrera, y después cambió su finalidad a tratar de costear los gastos de sus dos pequeños hijos, ya que su esposo es albañil y gana muy poco dinero. Fue así que empezó primero como vendedora y actualmente es coordinadora de un grupo de vendedoras y está trabajando muy fuerte para llegar a ser directora esperando lograrlo.

Sin embargo el camino es difícil y se requiere de mucho esfuerzo, es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses, para poder comprar los pedidos que le hicieron en esta temporada, y así poder cumplir con la meta que se trazó. Con tu ayuda María Leticia podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Stock merchandise to offer to her customers

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is 48 years old. She lives and works in Bekaa, in a region called Al Ein (which literally means 'the eye' in English). Zeinab owns a grocery store. This is the second time Zeinab is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She is known to be a hard-working woman. Zeinab needs to buy new merchandise for her grocery store to sustain her business and insure its continuous growth.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue to invest in his and his parents' businesses

loans.name: Neli

texts.es:
Neli is a very dedicated mother of a family, and it is her wish to be able to provide them with the best so they can fulfill all of their needs. She therefore decided 4 years ago to devote herself to agriculture. She inherited the land from her parents with the purpose of maintaining its upkeep. She plants all types of crops in these fields, such as vegetables, tubers and gladioli, and sells them directly to customers. She stays motivated during her long workdays by focusing on her commitment to providing her 3-year-old young daughter with a quality education. In order to continue working toward her goal, she is seeking a monetary loan to invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of seeds, manure and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer

Neli, es una madre de familia muy dedicada y su deseo es poder ofrecer a su familia lo mejor, a fin de que puedan satisfacer todas sus necesidades.Por esta razón ha decidido dedicarse a la agricultura hace 4 años ya que sus padres le heredaron las tierras que le corresponden con el objetivo de que pueda obtener sustento de ellas, en éstas parcelas siembra todo tipo de cultivo como verduras, tubérculos y también gladiolos los cuales comercializa directamente a sus clientes.Las intensas jornadas de trabajo son motivados por el compromiso de otorgarle una educación de calidad a su pequeña hija de 3 años. Para seguir trabajando con el noble propósito de alcanzar lo que se ha propuesto solicita un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de semillas, abonos y fertilizantes.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds, manure and fertilizer

loans.name: Asha's Raia Mwema Group

texts.en:
Aisha I. is mother of nine living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. For the past eight years, she has sold spices and vegetables to support her family. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day, earning about $90 a month.

To expand her business, Aisha has requested a group loan of $650 U.S. dollars with four other women. The other women sell vegetables, fish, and charcoal. Because Aisha is extremely hard-working, she is confident that she can repay back the loan.

loans.use: To buy produce and spices for a small business

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 38 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 8, 3, and 1 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 50 and 68 years old. Asha owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 1999. Everyday, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hard working, 37 year old mother of five. She lives in the Mjimwema area of Dar Es Salaam. She has been doing business for the past ten years, and the profits have helped her sustain her family.

She runs a food store selling all sorts of common seals in the Mjimwema market. She is in need of a loan to help her expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her food store

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel T. sells furniture that he makes, but although he is single, his income is not sufficient for his expenses. Since demand for his goods is high, he is seeking a loan of $300 to expand the business in order to increase  profits.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Kayan

texts.en: Kayan, 44 years old, is a mother of 4 children in Tripoli, North Lebanon. Kayan has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for 15 lending cycles and has always repaid her loans on time. During this period, Kayan was an active member in a group composed of several women. From the loans she took, she opened a flower shop next to her home. She is now requesting an individual loan of US$1,200 to purchase flowers and arrangement accessories in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase flowers and flowers arrangement accessories

loans.name: Hajra's Alfa Na Omega Group

texts.en:
Hajra K. is 25 years old. She is married with one three-year-old child. She has been selling clothes since in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 12pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250.

Hajra is applying for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her group member Fatuma, who has a business selling fish and cassava.

loans.use: To buy more clothing inventory.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma  is 27 years old. She is married with 3 children ages between 6 months and 8 years old. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since February 2008. Every day, she works from 7 am to 9 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

Fatma now requests a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to expand her buisness.

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.en: Sadriddin C. is 30 years old and he is married with two children. Sadriddin has a middle special education. His specialization is engineering. But he went to agrobusiness because his salary was low. And with the low salary he has to feed his family and pay for his children’s education. Sadriddin works hard to cultivate his products such as grapes, potatoes, onions and carrots. He works from early morning 'til late night hoping to have a rich harvest. Sadriddin sells his produce in the market where they are always in high demand due to their good quality. His work fills him with great optimism and allows him to help his beloved children. His goal is to improve the quality of his agricultural products even more and grow his business. Today Sadriddin is requesting a loan of $1000 USD for the term of 12 months to buy greater quantities of seeds and fertilizer, in order to better meet the demands of his customers who wait for him every Saturday at the market. Let's help Sadriddin as he works hard to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: Sadriddin would like to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers to grow seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Vilma es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 1 hijo, Vilma viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región 2 veces a la semana, donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra quesos, cereales que luego vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho de casa en casa.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz.
Los sueños de Vilma son tener un negocio estable, vender por mayor y que su hijo estudie y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Legioncito Community Bank. She is 23 years old, lives with her partner, and has a son. She travels around to the various markets in the area twice a week selling groceries and buying cheeses and grains which she then sells door-to-door in the city of Ayacucho. She needs a loan of 800 soles to buy sugar and rice. Vilma’s dreams are to have a profitable business, to sell wholesale, and to have a well-educated son with a good job.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Erick Enmanuel

texts.es: El joven Erick Manuel tiene la edad de 29 años habita en la Concepción, junto a su mamá y hermanos este joven es muy trabajador, se dedica a la agricultura y a la vez trabaja en una empresa para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar a su mamá y hermanos .E l papá de l joven le ayuda en la finca para que el vaya a trabajar. Los sueños de este joven es llegar a establecer una manzana más piña. Ya que el se siente muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda nuestra financiera. El solicita la cantidad de C$ 10,000.00 córdobas para darle el mantenimiento necesario al cultivo en la fertilización y abono del cultivo.

loans.use: Comprar abono y veneno para el cultivo

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio está casado con la señora Herminia Martínez de R., actualmente tienen 52 años, tienen 2 hijos, uno está entrando en la facultad y el otro en edad escolar.
El señor Ignacio tiene un taller mecánico en el barrio Las Mercedes de Ciudad Pdte. Franco, el negocio ya tiene hace 10 años, es su segunda operación con Fundación Paraguaya, es un cliente excelente y muy responsable con sus pagos. Está muy conforme con la ayuda que le está proporcionando la Fundación.
 Además de la reparación de vehículos también  compra vehículos obsoletos y quita todos los repuestos y posteriormente los vende, a muy bajo costo, pero le deja muy buena ganancia.
texts.en:
Ignacio is married to Herminia Martínez de R., both are 52 years old, have two children, one entering the university and the other is school-aged. Ignacio has a mechanic's shop in the neighborhood of Las Mercedes de Ciudad Pdte. The business is 10 years old and this is the second time working with Fundación Paraguaya. He is an excellent client and very responsible with payments. He is very satisfied with the help provided by the Fundacion. Besides auto repair, he also buys salvaged cars, removes their parts, and sells the parts at a very low cost while still allowing himself good earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of used auto parts.

loans.name: Elecita

texts.en:
Elecita S., 47 is from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. She is a single parent and bravely raised her 3 children. PMPC supported her by lending her the capital to start her piggery business. She sold one pig at a time, helping the family survive. She gave her best efforts to produce good pigs, in order to sell them continuously.

Elecita is now trying to expand her piggery business and has a thought of venturing into opening a little restaurant. She presented her project proposal to Paglaum MPC to finance the project and has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wants her business to show up and build a good business management for her loyal customers.With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school and have them find stable careers.

loans.use: additional capital for her restaurant and piggery

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn S. is 40 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She grows and sells rice from her rice field and earns around $3 per day. Her husband catches fish in the lake and sells the fish in the market. He makes $4 every day. This couple has three children; two are in school and one is a farmer.

Chorn S. has a new idea to make additional income to help support her family. She requests a loan to purchase a car for her husband to start a taxi business.

loans.use: Purchase a car to start a taxi business

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette dame a pour activité la vente de friperies, elle fait ce commerce dans le marché de totti et de façon ambulante, elle-même habite vakpossito, un quartier périphérique d’agoè au nord de Lomé. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2007 et elle s’approvisionne au marché de hedzranawoé qui est le second marché le plus animé de lomé. Elle veut agrandir son commerce c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de wages un prêt pour s’acheter un balle de friperie. Elle est célibataire et avec le bénefice de son commerce elle subvient à ses propres besoins et aux besoins de certains membres de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman's lives in Vakpossito, a suburban neighborhood in Agoè in the north of Lomé. Her business consists in selling second-hand clothing, at the Totti market or as an ambulant saleswoman. She has been in this business since 2007, and gets her supplies at the Hedzranawoé market, the second busiest market in Lomé. She wants to bolster her business, and she's thus seeking a loan from Kiva's partner WAGES, in order to purchase a bale of second-hand clothing. She's single, and with her profits, she provides for herself and for other members of her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell second-hand clothing

loans.name: Tushikamane Group

texts.en:
Fadhili has been a cosmetics seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 5 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 125. Each day she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cosmetics items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Fadhili is 30 years old, married, and has three children: ages 13, 8 and 6. She also cares for one additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Tabia, who has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics items for her business

loans.name: Laitalie

texts.en:
Laitalie L., 49, is married with seven children. She has three years of experience selling handicrafts. She sells to the general public and people in her village four days per week. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools and supplies such as brooms, carving equipment, and varnish.

This is Laitalie’s fourth loan through SPBD. These loans are her only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala ($145 USD).

loans.use: Purcahse varnish, brooms, and carving equipment

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 41 años es una madre de familia muy luchadora, vive en la casa de sus padres, quienes no dudan en ayudarla para que pueda sobresalir en la vida. El puesto de venta de ropa de Carmen, esta ubicado en la explanada Laguna Temporal (Lugar donde se hacen ferias en la ciudad de Juliaca), ella vende ropa para niños y es muy buena vendedora, puesto que siempre convence a sus clientes de comprarle un prenda de vestir. Carmen disfruta mucho de conversar con sus vecinas de venta, lo cual hace menos fastidiosas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poderlo descuidar, anhela tener una tienda de ropa más grande, donde pueda vender con más tranquilidad sus prendas de vestir. Este es el primer préstamo de Carmen en MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, para no meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles de préstamo, Carmen comprará más ropa para aumentar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene en su puesto.
texts.en:
Carmen, 41, is a mother who is very determined. She lives in her parents’ house, and they help her so that she can get ahead in life. The stand where she sells clothes is in the Laguna Temporal plaza (a place in the city of Juliaca where they have fairs). She sells children’s clothes. She is a very good sales person; she can always convince her customers to buy an article of clothing. Carmen really enjoys talking with her neighboring vendors; it makes the long work day seem less tiring. She has been doing this for 10 years. What she likes least about her work is having to stay in her stand all day without being able to leave. She yearns to have a larger clothing store where she could sell her clothes more calmly. This is her first loan with MFP. She knows that she has to repay on time so that the she does not cause problems for the members of her community bank. With 1,000 PEN Carmen will buy more clothes to increase the merchandise she has at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
"I sell fish and earn enough money for my family. My husband is a fisherman and all his catch is mainly intended for our own consumption. Aside from selling fish, I have a store where I sell various types of goods to supplement our income. My store business is doing great and I hope to maintain the good sales in the coming days," says Anabel D., 35-year-old mother of three children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store and fishing materials for her fishing boats. She thinks that by accessing loans to improve her fish selling and store, she will earn better income for her family.

CEVI gives not just loans; they also provide training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additonal merchandise for her store and fishing materials for her fishing boats

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús es una persona muy trabajadora por la razón que se dedica a laborar arduamente en su negocio de venta de ropa comercializada por ella misma en su localidad en la ciudad de Chinandega.

Hoy en día, la señora María ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de la ropa y de esta manera Salir adelante en su negocio ofreciendo variedad para niños, damas y caballeros. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su familia que tiene que mantener.
texts.en:
Señora María de Jesús is a very hard-working person and works hard at her business of selling clothing in the city of Chinandega. María has looked to Ceprodel for support to purchase clothing and in this way get ahead in her business. She offers clothing for children, women, and men. Both she and her family will benefit from this credit because she supports them.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Kick Poor United Group

texts.en:
Here are Issa L., Yeabu K. and Kadiatu K.. They named their group Kick Poor United. This is the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With previous loans, these entrepreneurs were able to expand their businesses, both in size and in quality. As a result, they experienced a vast improvement in sales, profit margin and in their standard of living. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan in order to further strengthen their businesses.

Issa L. (middle) is the leader of the group. Issa was born in Magburaka town 42 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children together. All of their children are still in primary schools. Issa sells cosmetics and ready-to-wear-clothes in Magburaka town. He has been a businessman for more than 10 years now.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 51 years old, and married with four children. She sells crates of drinks in wholesale and retail. She hopes for the loan amount to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch N., 35, is married and has a two-year-old child. He lives with his wife in Battambong province. He is a construction builder who commutes from place to place to find a construction site on which to work. He typically is able to generate an income of US$3.50 per day as the primary source of income to cover his family’s expenses.

Global financial problems have hit many people hard. These economic struggles have forced many people to cut back on expenses and to find ways to save money. N. and his wife see an opportunity to cut back on the repair expenses of his old motorbike through the purchase of a new motorbike. He and his wife have approached CREDIT for a loan of US$700 to purchase a new motorbike that will allow them to save more money and to raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike and some construction tools

loans.name: Merci

texts.en:
Merci G. lives in the village of San Juan, Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old and married. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (or variety) store. She has been in this business for more than two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Merci joined HSPFI to gain access financial services to improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. She will use this loan, her first, to generate additional revenue and supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households in Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Mrs. Marissa G. is from Punta Tagda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental.  She is 43 years old and married with 4 adult children. She started her buy-and-sell business in 1998 with her first loan of PHP 3,000 from NWRF. 

Later, she and her husband decided that they could increase their income potential if they had their own fishing boat, so she and her husband pooled their capital and bought a small fishing boat. They sell most of the day's catch in the local market and they also make salted dried fish, which they sell to a select clientele. 

Now, Marissa is planning to borrow PHP 19,500 to expand her fish business. She will also use the profits to have their house repaired and make a few home improvements.

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon

loans.use: House Repair

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen C., 27, is a widow with a young child and resides in the Phnom Penh. She works in a grocery store, making around US$3. Pen is asking for a loan of US$500 to expand her grocery stand.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos tiene 44 años, es soltero y vive solo en su casa propia. Se dedica a la siembra de cacao (planta que sirve para la elaboración de chocolate), cuenta con 2 hectáreas cultivadas de este producto y también de plátanos y otras frutas. Sembrando cacao lleva un periodo de 2 años; pero como su terreno es muy amplio, hace un año lo alquiló para la crianza de ganado, animales que él mismo cuida y obtiene ingresos extras por esta actividad. Lo que le gusta a Santos de su labor es que se mantiene ocupado y lo ayuda a olvidarse de algunas circunstancias difíciles, además la venta de cacao le permite tener lo necesario para vivir tranquilo. Para más adelante está planeado sembrar yuca y maíz. 
Con MFP ya tiene 2 préstamos y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los miembros se apoyan entre sí, no hay problemas y pagan sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono para sus plantaciones de cacao y contratará a 2 personas para que le ayuden a cosechar su producto.
texts.en:
Santos is 44 years old. He is single and lives alone in his own house. His business is growing cacao (the plant used to make chocolate). He has 2 hectares planted in this product as well as bananas and other fruits.

Growing cacao takes 2 years, but because his land is large, a year ago he rented it for raising cattle. He takes care of the animals himself and is paid for this. Santos enjoys his work; it keeps him busy and helps him forget some of his difficult circumstances. The cacao business gives him what he needs to live happily. In the future, he plans to plant yucca and corn also.

Santos already has taken out 2 loans with MFP. What he likes about his communal bank is that the members help each other, there are no problems, and they make their payments on time. With this loan, he will buy fertilizer for his cacao plantation and hire 2 people to help with the harvest.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rocío Del Pilar

texts.es: Rocío del Pilar es una socia dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 33 años, es madre de tres hijos, uno mayor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de panes, galletas y gaseosas, actividad que realiza desde su casa, cuenta del apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la venta de tablas (madera). Rocío forma parte del Banco Comunal “Rumbo al Éxito “ desde hace dos años. El primer crédito que recibió fue para invertir en gaseosas para vender, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2300 soles, que será utilizado para comprar panes, galletas y gaseosas que luego venderá.  La otra parte será para la compra de madera para fabricar una pequeña tienda, ya que Rocío vende sus productos en un triciclo en forma ambulatoria. La meta de Rocío es tener una tienda bien surtida de abarrotes en general
texts.en:
Rocío del Pilar is a dynamic member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 33 years old and is the mother of three children, one of which is older. She is involved in the sale of breads, cookies, and sodas, which she sells from her home. She has the support of her husband, who sells wood planks. Rocío has been a member of the “Rumbo al Éxito” (Bound for Success) communal bank for the past two years. The first loan that she received was to invest in sodas to sell.

Now, Rocío needs a loan of 2300 PEN, which will be used to purchase breads, cookies, and sodas that she will then sell. The other part of the loan will be for the purchase of wood to build a small store, since Rocío currently sells her products door to door from a tricycle.

Rocío’s goal is to have a well-assorted general grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (breads, cookies, sodas) and to buy wood to build a store

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette D. est une femme de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Son crédit lui permet de développer une activité commerciale en vendant des légumes (carottes, manioc, aubergine etc.) et du poisson. elle soutien son mari pour les charges familiales à partir des bénéfices qu'elle réalise
texts.en:
Maguette DIOUFis a 26 year old woman, married, and a mother of 3 children. Her loan permits her to develop a commercial activity of selling vegetables (carrots, cassava root, eggplant, etc) and fish. Profits from the store are used to support her husband in taking care of their family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her retail activity

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona  es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” del distrito de Azángaro de la Región Puno; tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 04 hijos y estudio hasta el 5to año de secundaria.
La socia viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue S/. 300.00 (nuevos soles) el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para la compra de leche y de esta manera producir Quesos en mayor cantidad.
En la actualidad requiere de un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 (nuevos soles), el cual le permitirá incrementar su capital de trabajo para la compra de leche y producción de Quesos. 
Su mayor deseo es exportar quesos de paria hacia el Brasil mediante cadenas productivas, para  lo cual viene organizando una asociación de productores de Queso.
Referente a su banco comunal, ella manifiesta que le gustan los ahorros y utilidades producto del ahorro, además las charlas de orientación que se dan en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Simona is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi Communal Bank in the Azángaro district, Puno region. She is 36, in a common law marriage, and has four children. She went to school until the fifth year of high school. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which allowed her to buy milk to make larger quantities of cheese. She currently needs a loan for 2,000 PEN, which will allow her to increase her working capital to buy milk for her cheese production. Her biggest wish is to export cheese from Paria to Brazil through productive chains. To do so she is organizing an association of cheese producers. Regarding her communal bank, she says that she likes the savings and the profits from saving. She also likes the training talks that are given at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy milk to make cheese

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is 31 years old and a resident of Kyotera County in Mutukula Kirankole Local Council One (LC1) Rakai District. She is married with four children. She owns a business selling food items in Kikubo Industrial Zone of Kyotera, and she has been in business for over eight years. She is using the loan to expand and extend her business by purchasing items in large quantities for sale to her customers. Her future plan is to have a big shop in Kikubo Industrial Zone in order to complete with the big shops in the area and make more profits.

loans.use: To purchase items such as maize and maize flour, in large quantities to expand her business

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos Luis C. S. es un señor de 62  años de edad quien vive con su esposo y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Canalete localizada en Upala en la provincia de Alajuela, es un lugar semimontañoso y sus actividades económicas se centran en la agricultura y mayormente en la ganadería. Es una comunidad con una gran oportunidad de desarrollo y establecimiento de microempresas, tanto de agroindustria como  comercio

Don Carlos tiene más de 15 años de dedicarse al transporte. Su labor es viajar alrededor de su comunidad entregando mercadería con su camión, sus jornadas de trabajos son muy largas y cansadas, pero dice que gracias a el puede salir a delante y mantener a su familia.

Debido a tanto desplazamiento en su camión, este ha sufrido diferentes daños y no está en muy buenas condiciones, por lo cual don Carlos requiere un préstamo de ¢675,000 (seiscientos setenta y cinco mil colones) para la reparación y compra de repuestos para su vehículo, ya que si no esta en condiciones apropiadas no puede realizar de forma efectiva su trabajo.

Don Carlos es soci  de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Carlos Luis C. S. is a 62 year-old man who lives with his wife and his son in a community called Canalete, which is located in Upala in the Alajuela province. It is a semi-mountainous area where the economic activities are centered on agriculture, primarily in livestock. It is a community with a great potential for development and the establishment of small businesses, as much in agribusiness as in trade. Carlos has worked in the transportation sector for more than 15 years. He drives around the community delivering merchandise with his truck. His working days are long and tiring, but he says that he is thankful that he can continue to advance and to support his family. Owing to the many miles he has put on his truck, it has suffered different damages and is not in very good condition. Carlos needs a loan of ¢675,000 (six hundred seventy-five thousand colones) to repair the truck and to buy the parts for his vehicle, since he cannot work effectively with the truck in its current condition. Carlos is a member of the Canalete communal bank, which is one of the 100 organizations that are part of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to continue to grow both personally and economically and, in addition, to participate actively in the credit organization in his community.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Etelvina

texts.es:
la sra. Etelvina M. tiene un puesto de abarroteria en el mercado de nacaome, tiene 57 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos a su cargo. vive en la aldea el chorro, Goascoran, Valle.
Etelvina esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas productos como ser refrescos, manteca, aceite, condimentos, baterias, sopas, etc.
Etelvina necesita surtir su negocio para poder darse abasto con todas las exigencias dde sus clientes.
dice estar muy contenta ya que todo le esta saliendo bien y que su negocio esta creciendo cada dia mas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Etelvina M. has a grocery store in the Nacaome market. She is 57 years old and has 5 children for whom she cares. She lives in the village of El Chorro, Goascoran, Valle. Currently, she is requesting a loan to purchase more products such as soft drinks, butter, oil, condiments, batteries, soups, etc. She needs to stock her business in order to be able to cope with all of her clients' demands. She tells us that she is very content, since everything is going well for her and her business is growing more each day.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soap, toilet paper, pasta, soft drinks, soup, condiments, batteries, butter, margarine, and oil

loans.name: Tita Linda

texts.en:
Tita Linda J., 40 years old, is a hardworking mother. She lives in Calahan, Cardona, Rizal, Philippines with her husband and five children. She and her husband, Ronald, have only high school level educations. They come from poor families. They realize that their lack of education has led to their poverty, and they want a better life for their children. Tita Linda and Ronald hope their children will complete their studies in college.

They decided to join the Kiva field partner, ASHI, to obtain capital for their business, which is fishing. They have requested a loan of 15,000 PHP. The loan will be used to pay for fishnets, bamboo, rope and other materials for their fishing business.

In the future, the couple hopes to invest in their own pump boat. Tita Linda also dreams that soon she will have a larger area to store her fishing materials.

loans.use: to buy fishnets, bamboo, rope and other materials for their fishing business.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  en la Compañía Espartillar distante a 7 km de la oficina de Carapeguá unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para recibir una información sobre el mencionado programa . 

Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las  actividades de tejido de artesanía como sobrecamas, fundas para almohadas, sobre mesas entre otros.Ellas buscando un poco mas de apoyo para fomentar a través del crédito sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida .

Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual.
Todas de dedican a la actividad del tejido:
1
Natividad O.
TEJEDORA
2
Eva S.
 TEJEDORA
3
Ma- Calendaria P.
TEJEDORA
4

texts.en:
A group of low-income women, who reside in Compañía Espartillar, Carapeguá, which is 7km away from the office in Carapeguá, heard about Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras’ program and decided to unite to get some information about the program. These women are active and very hard-working. They are weavers who make, among other items, bedspreads, pillow cases and tablecloths. They seek, through loans, to provide a bit more support for their households and to improve their quality of life. They require this credit transaction to invest in their various lines of work so that they can reach a level of growth that is sustainable and will help them grow both individually and as a group. They are all weavers: 1 Natividad O. WEAVER 2 Eva S. WEAVER 3 Ma- Calendaria P. WEAVER 4 Cecilia S. WEAVER 5 Leonora L. WEAVER 6 Ramona G. WEAVER 7 WEAVER 8 Cristina A. WEAVER 9 Luisa G. WEAVER 10 Benicia G. WEAVER 11 Catalina B. WEAVER 12 Matea C. WEAVER 13 WEAVER 14 Lucia S. WEAVER 15 Venancia G. WEAVER 16 Nilsa Guzmán WEAVER 17 Insolina F. WEAVER 18 Lilian Ramírez WEAVER 19 Tomasa S. WEAVER 20 María-Evangelista Espinoza WEAVER 21 Sara B. WEAVER

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various colored threads and fabric.

loans.name: Ariatou

texts.fr:
cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de bananes et d'oranges, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et s'approvisonne à l'intérieur du pays et parfois à lomé, son stock est en baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 15 sacs de charbons de bois, des bananes, des oranges et divers.
