elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants
texts.en:
This lady has an income-generating activity trading in charcoal. At the same time she also sells bananas and oranges. She has been doing this business since 2005 and gets her supplies inland and sometimes at Lomé. Since her stock is declining, she would like to get fresh supplies, and it is for this reason she is applying for a loan from WAGES in order to buy 15 bags of charcoal, bananas, oranges and other items. She is married with two children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal, bananas, oranges and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to use as a taxi

loans.name: Oshilawathi

texts.en:
Oshilawathi is a 58-year-old widow living in Kekanadura, Matara, with her son, who is a doctor. Since her husband died, Oshilawathi has been managing her business by herself, which consists of cultivating a cinnamon garden. She devotes her full effort towards cultivating her cinnamon garden, step by step, and uses the income to help support herself. She has managed her business for two or three years by herself. In her business, she works hard and enjoys the benefits of favorable weather for cinnamon gardening and high quality land for cultivation.

Oshilawathi has asked for a 20,000 Sri Lankan rupee loan from BRAC Sri Lanka in order to to pay labor costs and to purchase chemicals for her cinnamon garden. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy chemicals for a cinnamon garden

loans.name: Leposo

texts.en:
Leposo K. is a 40-year-old gentleman who is married to Nataana K., and they have three children. Leposo owns a piece of land upon which he has farmed for the past nine years. He also keeps livestock which he fattens and then sells at a profit.

Leposo learned about KADET from other members who had already registered as clients. This will be his second loan with which he is planning to develop large-scale farming for wheat, which does very well in this area, and also buy more beef cattle. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease additional land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is to become the best farmer in his area both in wheat production and livestock keeping. Leposo believes he is hard working and he only needs the resources to attain his goals.

loans.use: To plant more acres of wheat and buy beef cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Amistad De Palmira Group

texts.es:
Banco de Emprendimiento:  AMISTAD DE PALMIRA  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Palmira, ubicado en la calle Las Ameritas, el B.E. esta en su 3er ciclo, compuesto por 10 personas, Se fundo el  12 de Mayo  del 2009, a iniciativa de un grupo de señoras.

Como PRESIDENTA esta la Sra. JULIA, tenemos a la señora, CONSUELO como TESORERA  y la  Sra. MARIA es la SECRETARIA, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la  venta de  panadería ,jugos  de frutas ,abarrotes,ropa, dulces asaditos ,empanadas y comida. Las reuniones se llevan acabo los días jueves a horas   11:30 PM en la casa de la señora Maria. Los nuevos clientes que ingresaron al grupo están contentos de trabajar con Emprender debido a que dentro de la capacitación del  B.E.  AMISTAD DE PALMIRA, se les estableció una proyección de sus ahorros a la finalización  del ciclo  en la cual  aprenderán a ahorrar  y compartir con sus amigas cada 14 días.

La Sra. JULIA (Presidenta) vende ropa de manera ambulante  en diferentes mercados populares, a parte de esta actividad se dedica a cuidar a sus nietos en sus tiempos libres y  le va bien el negocio. En el banco comunal ha aprendido a ahorrar, a quererse y valorarse como persona, siente útil con lo que le enseñan en las capacitaciones. El sueño de la señora  Julia es tener su propia tienda, y asi poder aportar en  los estudios  de sus nietos  y progresar en la vida con su negocio, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia ropa de temporada y asi poder incrementar su capital de trabajo.

Todas las socias son personas responsables y trabajadoras que desean mejorar la calidad de vida y de toda su familia, estan muy agradecidas con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The community bank AMISTAD DE PALMIRA is located in Barrio Palmira on Las Ameritas street. The bank is in its 3rd cycle and is made up of 10 people. It was formed on May 12 of 2009 by a group of women. The president is JULIA, CONSUELO is the treasurer, and MARIA is the secretary. In the group there are women sho sell bread, fruit juice, groceries, clothes, candy, roasted meat, empanadas and food. The meetings are held on Thursdays at 11:30 p.m. at Maria's house. The new clients that entered the group are happy to work with Emprender because the communal bank AMISTAD DE PALMIRA has a training that established a savings projection at the end of the cycle in which they will learn to save and share with their friends every 14 days. JULIA ( the president) sells clothes as a street vendor in different popular markets. With this activity she takes care of her grandchildren in her free time and business is going well. In the communal bank she has learned to save, to love herself and to value herself as a person. Julia's dream is to have her own store and thus be able to pay for her grandchildrens' education and progress in life with her business. With the money from the loan she will purchase merchandise, such as seasonal clothing, an in this way increase her working capital. All of the members are responsible and hardworking people who want to improve their and their whole families' quality of life. They are very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust they have put in them by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Olimpio

texts.pt:
Olimpio A. J. nasceu em quelimane a 47 anos onde frequentou o seu Encino primario em Quelimane ate a 5 classe e nos tempos livres ajudava os seus pais nos deveres de casa e ajudava a cuidar tambem dos irmaos mais novos enquantos os pais trabalhavam.
 porque o pais na altura so lencionava ate 5 classe e teve de ir  a  Cuba para prosseguir com os estudos gracas a bolsa que ele ganhou onde frequentou da 6 ate 10 classe e de la foi chamado para cumprir com o servico militar obrigatorio ainda em cuba onde fez os treinos desde 1982 a1985 e volta  a Mocambique em 1985 e esteve afecto na Beira, anos depois foi transferido para Pemba,Mentagula e definitivamnete veio a Maputo onde encontra se a trabalhar a te hoje na MARINHA DE GUERRA DE MOCAMBIQUE  onde desempenha as funcoes  de ARTIlHEIRO que  aprendera  em Cuba a 28 anos,’e funcionario permanente no Estado onde vem desempenhando essas funcoes a 28 anos e o seu horario de trabalho das 7:30 as 15:30 e aufere um salario de 13.268.00 e consegue fazer poupancas no final de mes.casou se 1992 onde teve 2 filhos um de 16 anos e um de 14 e anos depois   a esposa veio a falecer e voltou a casar se no ano de 2003 e teve mais dois filhos um de 7 e um de 5 todos frequentam a escola.
Conheceu a hluvuku atraves de colegas seus e ja se benefeciou  de 5 emprestimo  este sendo o sexto emprestimo dentre eles 9.000.00, 16.000.00 20.000.00, 22.000.00, 10.000.00 e  agora 25.000.00.este emprestimo  ‘e para dar continuidade a sua obra  ja teve outros  emprestimos no BIM  no valor de 40.000.00 e 80.000.00.
Projectos pessoais para o future ‘e concluir a sua casa e um dia poder construir uma loja no seu bairro onde podera vender um pouco de tudo desde os produtos alimentares ate  materias de construcao porque todos tem de depender  da cidade de maputo para poder adiquir tudo o que as pessoas precisam e para tal vou precisar de novos emprestimos para poder concretizar o seu sonho.
texts.en:
Olimpio A. J. was born in Quelimane 47 years ago. He studied until 5th grade and in his free time helped his parents in house chores, and also helped raised his two younger brothers while his parents were at work. Back then, 5th grade was the highest level of education in Mozambique and Olimpio had to go to Cuba to continue his studies, thanks to a scholarship he received. He studied until 10th grade and from there was drafted into the army and did his training from 1982 to 1985. He came back to Mozambique in 1985 and still works as a Marine in the Marinha de Guerra de Mozambique. He's been working for the army for the past 28 years from 7:30AM to 3:30PM and makes around U$385 per month, which he uses to support his family and save. He's was married in 1992 and had two children, a 16 and a 14 year old. His first wife passed away and he later remarried, and had two more children, a 7 and a 5 year old. All his children are going to school. Olimpio heard of Hluvuku from friends and has already taken 5 loans, this one being his 6th. He wants to finish building his house and also build a small business nearby, where he'll sell a little bit of everything, from food products to building supplies. He thinks he has chances to succeed because right now everyone has to go to the neighbor city of Maputo to get basic things, and starting his business will be like a dream coming true.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, doors, windows, construction supplies

loans.name: Sokmali

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokmali C., aged 37 (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Soktry Khut, aged 37, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1999 and have two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. Besides of her children, she also has her elderly mother living with her.     
 
Sokmali has been a tailor since 1993. She operates the business out of her home. Her husband is a security guard. She is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to fill up the land in front of her house and add an addition to her house.

loans.use: To fill up the land in front of her house and add an addition to her house.

loans.name: Djilang

texts.fr:
Djiilang B. est une femme de 31 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DIARIFA depuis le 12 décembre 2003 et y a reçu 14 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien géré et remboursé sans difficulté. Elle a commencé son activité par la vente du thé, sucre, cigarette, allumettes etc. Au bout de sept ans, elle a construit un local où elle vend divers produits et denrées de consommation. Les profits qu'elle en tire lui permettent d'aider son mari dans les charges familiales (nourriture et éducation des enfants)
Avec elle souhaite renforcer le capital de sa boutique. Elle souhaiterait générer plus de revenus afin de pouvoir prendre de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Djiilang B. is a 31-year-old woman who is married and the mother of six children to support. She has been a member the Banc Villageois of DIARIFA since December 12, 2003 and has received from it fourteen loans, which she has always managed and repaid without a problem. She started her business by selling tea, sugar, cigarettes, matches, etc. After seven years, she built a place where she sells various products and grocery items. The profits that she derives from it will allow her to help her husband to support the family (food and education for the children). With this loan, Djiilang wishes to boost her capital for her store. She would like to generate more revenue in order to be able to take part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her investment capital

loans.name: Charisse

texts.en:
Charisse D. C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Looc, Argao, Cebu City. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: selling cellphone accessories and selling ready-to-wear clothes. Her 24-year-old husband, James D. C., works as a technician to earn a living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have one child who is seven years old. 

Charisse joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her eight previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Charisse has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 8,000 PHP helped her earn a profit of 32,000 PHP, raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital so that she can continue to save up for the future, to improve her business and pay for her daughter's education. Charisse D. C. is a 'Dungganon' woman who is following an honorable path toward achieving her dreams. 

 About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additonal working capital

loans.name: Dominic Ole

texts.en:
Dominic Ole Y. is 28 years old. He is a farmer and supports three people in his family. His spouse is Jennifer Y. and they have three children aged 15 years, 10 years and 5 years. Jennifer is a housewife and she helps Dominic in his farming activity.

Dominic does potato farming, which he has been doing successfully for the last nine years. This will be his fourth loan. He is planning to buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his potatoes.

He is planning to use the anticipated profit from his farming to expand his farming activity by hiring a bigger piece of land to increase his potato production. His hope and dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer who owns a bigger piece of land so he can be financially stable to support his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals to spray his potatoes

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción tiene 58 años, tiene 8 hijos con 8 hijos ninguno de sus hijos depende de ella.  Por lo que no es la primera vez que tiene financiamientos, ella nos dice que han sido muy importantes. Su actividad económica es la venta de nacatamales, venta de leche, y carne de cerdo hace más de 14 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus inicios fueron capital propio por lo que tenía que buscar una fuente de ingresos que le ayudara a sufragar los gastos de su familia. Actualmente con este crédito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, maíz y cerdos.
texts.en:
Concepción is 58 years old. She has eight children, none of whom are dependent on her. This is not the first time she has had a loan, and she tells us they have been very important. She has made a living selling tamales, milk and pork for more than 14 years. She started the business with her own money, because she had to find a source of income that would help her cover family expenses. She plans to use this current loan to purchase firewood, corn and pork.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood, corn and pork

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran lives with her family in Lahore which is famous for its history and culture. Lahore is the capital of Punjab province and the second largest city in Pakistan. Sughran lives in a four-room brick house with her family. She is 52 years old and has given birth to three daughters and three sons. Her three youngest children have got their education till 10th standard. The remaining three couldn’t get their education due to poor financial conditions in their family. So they started working at a young age and currently have their own businesses. Her two elder sons have a business selling spare parts and her elder daughter has opened a beauty salon at her home. 

Sughran does sewing from her house. She has contracts with different boutiques and stores selling women's ready-made garments. She finishes their orders on time and earns good profit on them. Her husband is a motor mechanic. He earns a reasonable income from his technical work. His workshop is located in the nearby market and it always remains busy because people trust him so much and come to him to repair their vehicles. 
 
Sughran has applied for a loan for the sixth time from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount he will buy the latest repair tools for his motor workshop and increase his income.  She is a very responsible member of Asasah and has always paid installments on time.

loans.use: Purchase latest repair tools for motor workshop

loans.name: El Sol De Cupiche Group

texts.es:
ALCOM: EL SOL D. CUPICHE

Alcancía Comunal creada, el 07 D. septiembre del presente año, integrada por 07 personas hacendosas,  dedicadas al comercio y servicio D. transporte, ofreciendo diversos productos y servicios  al mercado. 

Yolanda C. A., 50 años, casada con dos hijos independientes, actualmente asume L. responsabilidad como presidenta D. EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, D. L. Alcancía Comunal: EL SOL D. CUPICHE.

Yolanda se dedica a L. venta D. gaseosas, galletas, frutas y otros abarrotes, y los fines D. semana viaja a Huachipa para vender frutas y queso; empezó este negocio con L. idea D. mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. su familia, y ofrecerles lo necesario a sus hijos, sus estudios y otras comodidades;  Como también Yolanda con el apoyo D. Briccio su esposo quien en L. actualidad es pensionista , han logrado comprar un modulo D. vivienda prefabricado, para el bienestar y L. permanencia D. su familia, Para el futuro ello sueñan salir a una zona más movida y comercial, para vivir y situar su puesto D. negocios, así aperturar una bodega; con el préstamo que se le ofreció lo invertirá para implementar su kiosko D. ventas,  y comprar mas abarrotes.




Foto: observamos a los siete integrantes, D. L. ALCOM: Sol D. Cupiche, situada en el Distrito D. Huarochirí- Anexo ( Cupiche), una zona aledaña a L. ciudad, donD. desempeñan sus labores dichas personas. Ellos agradecen a  Edaprospo- Prosperidad por ayudar a las personas microempresarios D. bajos recursos, y darles L. oportunidad D. crecer, se comprometen también  a ser puntuales en sus pagos y no fallar a L. institución.
texts.en:
ALCOM: EL SOL D. CUPICHE The communal bank started, on September 7 of this year and is maD. up of seven hardworking members, each dedicated to business and transportation services, and offering various products and services to the marketplace. Yolanda C. Alancia is 50 years old, and currently serves as the group’s president. The group is part of EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, and the EL SOL D. CUPICHE communal bank. She is married and has two adult children on their own. Yolanda sells soft drinks, cookies, fruit, and other groceries and she travels to Huachipa to sell fruit and cheese on the weekends. She started this business with the intent of improving the quality of life for her family, and offering her children their necessities, education, and other comforts. Yolanda and her husband Briccio, who is now retired, have managed to buy a prefabricated modular home, for the wellbeing and permanence of their family. In the future they hope to move to a more developed and commercialized zone, where they will be able to live, establish their small business, and eventually set up a store. They will use the money from this loan to set up a kiosk and invest in more grocery items. The picture features the seven members of the ALCOM:Sol D. Cupiche group from the Huarochirí- Anexo (Cupiche) district, a zone located next to the city, where people go to work. They appreciate the help and the opportunity to grow that EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD has given small business people of limited means. They are each committed to making all of their payments on time and not to fail the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Set up a grocery kiosk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more sugar, milk, soap, coffee, sardines, body cream etc., for resale

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a 56-year-old pepper producer who lives in the region of Upala, in the northern region of Costa Rica, minutes from the Nicaraguan border. Modesto is a dedicated farmer. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvest of cayenne and habanero peppers. He works in cooperation with his family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land he works is his own. In addition to his agricultural activity, Modesto feels it is important to be an active member of his community. As a result, he dedicates a significant portion of his time to community meetings, groups and events. The rural zone where Modesto and his family live is sparsely populated with infrequent bus service and a general lack of infrastructure. Modesto is working hard towards the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labour. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Modesto and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbours help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Upala community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of cayenne and habanero peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labour and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Modesto with the help of his family members in the region of Upala. The productive cycle (from planting to harvest) for these types of peppers is roughly one year. Modesto planted his peppers 4 months ago and will expect to harvest in the next 8 months. Typically, he dedicates the hours from 7:00 AM to 4:30 PM everyday to his agricultural activities. 

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Upala, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The main obstacle Modesto and other producers in the Upala community face is a lack of access to working capital funds. The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Modesto, his family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, there is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Modesto wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented – he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his home and neighbourhood.

loans.use: For the purchase of agricultural chemicals and nutrients

loans.name: Shameem's Group

texts.en:
Shameem is a resident of Jaranwala, a small city located in Punjab Province of Pakistan. A 28-year-old childless widow who lost her husband at a very early age, Shameen moved to her parents' home and started a grocery shop business, dedicating a room in her home for that purpose. She has three brothers, all of whom are pursuing different livelihoods.

Shameem is now requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy additional groceries to sell. She is hopeful that she will earn extra profits from this loan investment and be able to save money for a secure future.

This is Shameem's second loan from Asasah. In the previous loan year, she built a good credit record and attended all meetings.

Note: In this photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Shameem.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Vincent Makokha

texts.en:
Vincent O., 39 years old and married to Nancy Okema, is the father of three children aged 15, 10 and 6 years. They live in Khwisero in Kakamega.

Vincent has a transport business, using a motorcycle to transport people and goods to and from town to their respective homes. He has been in this business for the past year and is now applying for his first loan from KADET LTD. to purchase motorcycle spare parts for his motorbike.

His desire is to open up a motorcycle spare parts shop and sell to all the other motorbike operators in the town.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Joel Adolfo

texts.es:
Joel de 55 años, tiene una carnicería. Vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 
 	 
Obtuvo experiencia en una carnicería cuando trabajo hace años atrás para poder tener una situación económica estable. Con algunos ahorros y perseverancia pudo comprar carne suficiente para tener su propio negocio. En la actualidad alquila un local vende la libra de carne a $ 1.80, la liba de chancho a $ 3.00. Con el préstamo quiere comprar carnes para tener más variedad en las ventas. En el futuro quiere abrir distintas sucursales para asegurar la vejez de él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Joel, 55, owns a butcher's shop. He lives in a a periurban area outside of Guayaquil called Duran, which is known for its deteriorating ecosystem.

He gained experinece at a butcher's years ago, when was working towards a stable economic situation. With some savings and perseverance he was able to buy enough meat to set up his own business. He is currently renting premises, where he sells meat at $ 1.80 per pound and pork at $ 3.00 per pound.

With the loan he wants to buy meat so as to sell more variety. In future he wants to open several branches to ensure his old age and his wife's.

loans.use: Meat

loans.name: Kibande

texts.en:
V. Kibande is a young single man of 22 years old. He has no children and lives alone in Lumakanda in the outskirts of Eldoret. He has a retail shop as a primary business and also has a cereals shop in the same area. He has been in business for two years now and he earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This will be V.'s first loan from KADET LTD and he will use it to add stock to his shop. He will buy perishable commodities such as bread and milk as well as cereals such as maize and beans. In the future, he hopes to go back to school and attain a degree certificate and also expand his retail business.

loans.use: to add stock such as bread, eggs and milk and to buy cereals

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk S., 29 years old, owns a small shop located along the street where she sells soft drinks and food. She typically makes around US$ 3.33 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. Her husband is an internal staff member of the Honda Company and has a proper salary every month. Uk S. now has two school-aged kids, both of whom attend school. Uk S. runs her business smoothly because she has skills in public relations, which she uses with her customers. Uk S. hopes to enlarge her business and is applying for a US$1,100 loan to be used to accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger number of necessary grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is a 34-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent on her sister’s plot of land, which is near her business place. They don’t have any kids yet. Bolormaa operates a grocery store, selling items like meat and vegetables. She has been running this business for over three years and has a loyal customer base. Her husband helps her in the business and this is the only income for the family. She is planning to purchase her own plot of land and a wooden house with her savings. 

Bolormaa is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase cheaper meat and vegetables to sell for a profit.

loans.use: to purchase cheaper meat and vegetables to sell for a profit.

loans.name: Michel

texts.en:
Michel, 26, is single. He takes care of two relatives, aged 11 and 14. Michel is a self-employed businessman selling cosmetics such as body lotions and toothpaste, as well as foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil. His shop is open from 6am until 5.30pm daily.

Michel has requested a loan through Vision Finance in order to expand his shop by purchasing a large quantity of sugar and rice. With this large quantity, he will also start wholesaling. In doing so, he hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow him to renovate his house, continue paying school fees for his two relatives and build a secure future.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of sugar and rice.

loans.name: Kloud

texts.ar:
كلود في عمر 35 سنة تعمل في فرن لبيع المناقيش وغيره لها في عملها 10 سنوات تحب عائلتها فهي متزوجه تريد ان تتقدم في العمل
تسعى دائما الى زيادة مدخولها وتحسين عملها تعاني من منافسة قوية من محيطها تريد زيادة راس المال تريد من خلال
طلب قرض لها من المجموعة أن تفتتح فرن اكبر حتى يصبح بإمكانها صنع الخبز والكعك
texts.en: Kloud, 35, is a baker. She has been working at a bakery selling manakeesh (pizza-like Levantine dough topped with thyme, cheese or ground meat) for 10 years. Kloud is married and loves her family. She always works hard to increase her income and develop her business. She faces fierce competition at work. She wants to get a loan from Al Majmoua to open a bigger bakery so that she can bake bread and cookies as well.

loans.use: To open a bigger bakery for making bread and cookies.

loans.name: Johanna Lizbeth

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

Aquí conocimos a Johanna, tiene 22 años de edad,  está soltera y  estudian en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí donde cursa el decimo semestre de medicina. Ella vive en casa de sus padres, tiene cuatro hermanos. Lleva en el Banco Comunal ya por cuatro   ciclos y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.

Se dedica a la cría de pollos, tiene una pequeña granja en la cual mete hasta 100 pollos por temporada la misma que es de dos a tres meses, los entrega a los comerciantes de la localidad o también a las tiendas de la zona, sus padres le ayudan en su labor ya que es a través de esto ella se puede financiar su carrera  que  es muy costosa. Los pollos los compra pequeños en una incubadora en Tosagua.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para estos. Sus sueños son graduarse de doctora e irse a especializar a otro pais.
texts.en:
The communal bank Esperanza Nueva (New Hope) meets in the city of Tosagua every fifteen days. This area is known for being very dynamic, with the majority of its residents working in agriculture and in raising animals, and for being a region with grand vegetation.

Here we meet Johanna, who is 22 years old. She is single and studies at the Technical University of Manabi, where she is in the tenth semester of medical studies. She lives in her parents' house and has four brothers and sisters. She has already been in the communal bank for four cycles, and she likes it because of the ease of obtaining loans.

Johanna raises chickens. She has a small farm in which she raises up to 100 chickens at a time for two to three months. Then she turns them over to local business people or to the stores in the area. Her parents help her with the work since it is through her work that she is able to finance her studies, which are very expensive. She buys the chickens at an incubator in Tosagua when they are small.

This loan will be used to buy chickens, feed, and medicine for them. Johanna's dream is to graduate as a doctor and go to another country to study a specialty.

loans.use: Buy chickens and feed and medicine for them.

loans.name: Biibaatar

texts.en:
Biibaatar is a 34-year-old bright man. He is married and has a two-year-old son who attends kindergarten. His family lives in a small house in a suburb of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working in clothing sales for over 10 years. His wife helps support the family by running the business together at Narantuul, the largest outdoor market of Mongolia. 

He started the business in 2001 with two stalls at Narantuul, with working capital of 500,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks). He sells children’s clothing imported from Ereen, a border city of China. As a result of his hard work, he managed to acquire two more stalls in 2005, which he had been renting over the past few years. Meanwhile his wife was raising their child; two stalls were operated by him and the other two by a salesperson. Today, his working capital is around 9,000,000 MNT. Moreover, he managed to build a new small house in 2008 with the business profits. 

Biibaatar is requesting a loan of 3,700,000 MNT to purchase more merchandise to increase the business. He also wants to expand the business in another indoor market called Dunjingaraw. He wishes to move into an apartment where his family can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for spring

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina C. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 31 years old and married, with 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Carina runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells products for daily use such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack food, detergent and beverages. Carina has been engaged in her business for more than 9 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Carina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Carina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack foods. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Carina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell such as canned goods and snack food

loans.name: Edna Antonio's Group

texts.en:
Edna A. is from the village of Baybayog, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 42 years old. Edna is the group leader of an eight-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Edna A.'s group.

Edna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Edna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Edna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en:
Saira got an education up to 10th standard, but couldn’t get higher education due to her parents' poor financial conditions. She got married 10 years ago to K. A. who operates a detergent-sales business. He used to wash clothes.
 
Saira has given birth to four children. Three of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education while her youngest one is only two years old. She herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is also a very caring mother and takes care of her children very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. Using the loan, her husband will buy washing powder in bulk quantity to sell and to increase his profits. He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Saira is hopeful that after investing the loan into his business, her husband will be able to improve the financial condition of his business further. 

She comes from an industrial city of Pakistan known as Faisalabad. She lives there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Daood Nagar. She  moved here after her marriage 10 years ago. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Saira.

loans.use: To buy detergent for resale.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en: 39-year-old Sherly is a married woman with children. She lives in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur with her family. She tills a plot of land where she grows rice crops. Sherly has been engaged in rice farming for 20 years. She has requested a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Sherly hopes to expand her farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Nan (pictured with her loom) is a weaver. Her husband is a farmer and does construction work when he is not at the farm. Nan is asking for a loan of  $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

The couple has two sons and one daughter. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: 041017 - Giang Son - Hoang Truong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hong operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. Hong has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Hong is 23 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of an eight-member group, the 041017 - Giang Son - Hoang Truong solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2010, Hong joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profits, Hong hopes to maintain a successful business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: Chị Nguyễn Thị Hồng làm nghề đánh cá từ năm 2008, trưởng nhóm kiếm được 2.000.000 đồng trên tháng từ hoạt động kinh doanh của mình.

loans.name: Thembalethu Group

texts.en:
Zanele, on the left, is 35 years old and single with five children between the ages of 2 and 18. Four of her children attend school. She sells food in Kwa zulu Natal, Empangeni in South Africa. She been in the business for 15 years selling cold drinks, fruits, vegetables and sweets from her home. She also receives income from the goverment's child support program. She says that the main challenge to her business are customers who buy on credit and fail to pay on time. Zanele requested this loan throgh WDB Kiva to buy cold drinks, fruits, vegetables and sweets. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her life and pay for her children's school. In future she would like to see her business grow and end up owning a room to sell her products.

She explained that she started borrowing from WBB last year and it has helped her a lot.  She hopes that the partnership with Kiva will make the friendship even better.

loans.use: To buy drinks, fruits, vegetables and sweets

loans.name: Malinche Group

texts.es:
El grupo Malinche lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Rosa Amanda de 66 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, gaseosa y chiverías. Ella tiene 9 hijos de los cuales solos tres menores de 16, 14 y 10 años de edad dependen de ella.
El crédito lo invertirá en arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y gaseosas…etc.
Los otros integrantes son Nester Antonio de 43 años él trabaja de a domicilio en la reparación de aires acondicionados y con el crédito desea instalar su taller de refrigeración; y María Virginia de 31 años se dedica al comercio de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The Malinche Group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people. One of them is Mrs. Rosa Amanda, who is 66 years old and sells basic supplies such as grains, sodas and dairy products. She has nine children of which three are minors (16, 14, and 10 years old) and dependent on her.
This loan she will use to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, sodas, etc.
Another member is Nester Antonio who is 43 years old and works from his home repairing air conditioners. He would like this loan in order to build a refrigeration workshop. Maria Virginia is the other applicant. She is 31 years old and sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years. She is 56 years old and married to Paul. They have three children who are in school.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer and pay her casual workers to help her in planting.

In the future, she hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Milena Yasmina

texts.es: La señora Milena se dedica a vender mercadería en general. Ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo, sus esfuerzos de sacar a sus hijos adelante es su prioridad  por lo que fue su motivación con este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante y su vivienda. Ella inicio este negocio debido a la necesidad de mantenerse porque buscaba trabajo y no encontraba, y con mucho sacrificio tenía que encontrar la forma de mejorar su condición. Por lo que así logro dedicarse obteniendo muy buenos resultados. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercaderías tales como cremas, perfumes, ropa interior, pantalones, camisas, bolsas y ropa en general. Ella posee el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Mrs Milena sells general merchandise. She has three children under her care. Her efforts to get her children ahead are her priority, which was her motivation for this business. She sells from her home and on the street. She started this business out of the need to make an income, as she was looking for a job and could not find one. With a great deal of sacrifice, she had to find a way to improve her conditions. She has had very good results with this business. This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as creams, perfumes, underwear, pants, shirts, purses and general clothing items. Her dream is to improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase creams, perfumes, underwear, pants, shirts, purses and general clothing items.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.fr:
Client de 49 ans, marié et père de 6  enfants dont l’âge varie entre 7 et 23 ans.
A la fin de ses études universitaires, étant un diplôme sans emploi, il se lance dans la vente des vivres frais en 2002.
Il achète des saucissons, cartons de poulet, cartons de cuisses et ailes de poulets qu’il vend chez lui à domicile.
A l’octroi de son prêt, il veut renforcer le stock de son stock en achetant 10 cartons de saucissons, 5 cartons de cuisses de poulets, 5 cartons de ailes de poulets, 2 cartons de queue de bœuf et queue de porcs.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut épargner pour qu’a la longue il achète un groupe électrogène pour palier aux problèmes d’électricité et a la longue construire une chambre froide et devenir grossiste en vivres frais.
texts.en:
This client is 49, married and the father of six children whose ages vary between seven and 23. At the end of his university studies, having a diploma but no job, he got into selling frozen foods in 2002.

He buys sausages, cartons of chicken thighs and wings that he sells at his home. When he receives the loan, he wants to buy 10 cartons of sausages, five cartons of chicken thighs, five cartons of chicken wings, and two cartons of beef and pork tails. 

With his profits he wants to put aside savings so that in the long run he can buy a generator to ease his electricity problems. In the very long run he hopes to build a cold storage room and become a wholesaler for frozen foods.

loans.use: to buy cartons of chicken thighs and wings and of sausages.

loans.name: Edwin Eladio De Jesus

texts.es:
Edwin es un señor de 42 años de edad, vecino de una comunidad rural de Costa Rica situada 45 kilómetros al sur de San José llamada San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal es una zona un poco montañosa donde se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, agricultura de hortalizas, café y otros, artesanía, ganadería y muchas otras actividades. Don Edwin vive con su esposa e hijos.

Desde hace varios años don Edwin es reconocido en la zona por ser un hombre muy trabajador y emprendedor. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente, sin embargo su salario no es suficiente para realizar este proyecto. Dice que el poder brindar un buen servicio a las personas y cumplir con sus exigencias, son la base de motivación para continuar.

Actualmente don Edwin requiere un préstamo de ¢300.000 (trescientos mil colones) para la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su vivienda. Con esta espera darle un techo digno a su familia.
Don Edwin es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN), una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Edwin is 42 years old and lives in a rural community in Costa Rica located 45 kilometers south of San José called San Cristóbal Norte. San Cristóbal is an area that is a little mountainous where economic activities such as trade, vegetable farming, coffee cultivation, handicrafts and cattle raising, among many others, are carried out. Edwin lives with his wife and children.

For many years Edwin has been known in the area as a very hardworking and enterprising man. His small business has helped to improve his family’s living conditions considerably, nevertheless his income is insufficient to carry out this project. He says his ability to provide good service to people and meet their demands is his basis for continuing.

At present, Edwin needs a loan of 300 colones to buy construction materials to improve his house. With this he hopes to provide a decent roof over his family.

Edwin is a member of the San Cristóbal Norte (SACRIN) communal bank, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to improve his house.

loans.name: Jose Valentin

texts.es:
Jose Valentin, tiene 41 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos entre las edades de 17 y 14 años, y junto a su familia reside en la Aldea Casa Blanca en el Departamento de Francisco Morazan. 

Jose se dedica a la venta de golosinas y refrescos. El inicio este negocio porque en su lugar de residencia no existia ningun lugar donde ir a comprar refrescos y/o golosinas, y para hacerlo tenian que caminar una larga distancia. Asi que Jose hablo con su esposa de la idea de poner un pequeño puesto de golosinas y ella acepto. Y poco a poco han ido surtiendo su negocio de otros productos. Su horario de atencion inicia desde las 5:00 pm hasta las 11:00 pm, asi que Jose luego de su jornada laboral, llega a su casa e inicia a ayudar en el puesto de golosinas como mesero, ya que su esposa cocina y el sirve a los clientes. 

El prestamo que Jose esta solicitando lo necesita para comprar refrescos, verduras, carnes, harina, aceite, minimos verdes, salsas, condimentos, entre otros productos como ser galletas, churros, dulces. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su negocio estara mejor surtido y sus ventas incrementaran. Su meta es llegar a tener un restaurante de comida buffet grande y prospero para sostener su hogar y ayudar a sus hijos a que terminen sus estudios.

Este es el segundo ciclo de Jose en FAMA y gracias a los prestamos recibidos tiene una fuente de ingresos y confia que hara sus pagos de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Jose Valentin is 41 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 14 and 17. He and his family reside in the neighborhood of Casa Blanca in the Department of Francisco Morazan.

Jose sells snacks and soft drinks. He started this business because there was no other place in town where one could buy soft drinks and snacks without having to walk a long distance. Jose talked with his wife about his idea of opening a small snack stand and she agreed. Little by little, he restocked his business with other products. His schedule of operation is from 5pm to 11pm. When Jose gets home after completing his work day, he starts helping out at the snack stand as a waiter. His wife takes care of the cooking while he attends to the customers.

The loan Jose is requesting will be used to buy soft drinks, vegetables, meats, flour, oil, miniature greens, sauces, condiments, and other products such as cookies, donuts, and candy. With the support of this loan, his business will be well-stocked and his sales will increase. His goal is to open a restaurant with a large buffet so that he can sustain his household and help his children finish their studies.

This is Jose’s second loan cycle with FAMA and he expresses his gratitude for the loans he has received because they provide a source of income. He is confident that he will complete his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, vegetables, meats, flour, oil, miniature greens, sauces, condiments, cookies, donuts, and candy.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, a 42-year-old married mother of five children, four of whom are currently in school, lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala South region of Uganda. For the past year, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clinic, which offers health services.

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more medicine, which will help Sarah generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to open a retail shop in the future.

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), a program primarily serving small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Sandra Margarita tiene 58 años de edad, es casada y madre de cuatros hijos, reside en el Barrio La Hoya en el municipio de Juticalpa y se dedica a la venta de rosquillas y quesadillas.

Doña Sandra aprendió a elaborar las rosquillas y quesadillas desde hace mas de 30 años y se formó trabajando con una vecina que se dedicaba a esa actividad. Su producto es muy preferido por la población Juticalpense y también por las personas que viven en el extranjero, ya que la mayor cantidad de su producto se le compran para enviarlo a familiares o amigos viven en los Estados Unidos. Trabaja en conjunto con su hijo menor, su jornada laboral inicia a las 4:00 am lo cual es muy sacrificado pero una vez que el producto sale del horno ella puede descansar y su hijo despacha a los clientes. 

El préstamo que Doña Sandra esta solicitando lo necesita para comprar leche, maíz, azúcar, leña, huevos, entre otros productos para la elaboración de las rosquillas y quesadillas. Con el apoyo del préstamo Doña Sandra podrá sacar unos pedidos que tiene pendientes de entrega y eso le generara ganancias para cubrir algunos gastos del hogar como ser el pago de alquiler. 

Su sueño es tener una casa propia y que sea muy grande porque quiere instalar un pequeño taller y enseñar a las personas a elaborar rosquillas y quesadillas.

Doña Sandra se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo de los prestamos obtenidos porque le han ayudado a mantenerse activa económicamente. Ella es una clienta muy puntual con sus pagos y ya tiene cuatro ciclos en FAMA.
texts.en:
Sandra Margarita is 58, married, and the mother of four children. She lives in Barrio La Hoya in the Juticalpa municipality, and sells rosquillas (a traditional treat similar to doughnuts) and quesadillas. 

Sandra learned to make rosquillas and quesadillas more than 30 years ago. She trained by working with a neighbor who did this for a living. Her products are a great favorite of the residents of Juticalpa, and also of people who live in other countries; since the greatest amount of her production is bought to be sent to family members and friends who live in the United States. 

She works together with her youngest son. Her working day begins at 4:00am, which is very demanding. But once the product leaves the oven, she can rest, and her son sends it out to the customers.  

The loan that Sandra is applying for is needed to buy milk, corn, sugar, firewood, eggs, and other products for making rosquillas and quesadillas. With the help of the loan Sandra, will be able to fill some orders that she hasn't yet delivered, and that will generate profits to cover some household expenses such as rent.

Her dream is to have her own house; a very large one, because she wants to set up a small work area and teach people to make rosquillas and quesadillas. 

Sandra feels very thankful for the loan support she has received, because this has helped her keep herself going financially. She is a client who is very punctual with her payments, and has already had four loans with FAMA.

loans.use: To buy corn, sugar, firewood, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is a determined businesswoman aged 49 who is blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. She has been a green grocer for the last seventeen years, earning money to help raise her children. Previously, she was a tailor. Julia has found success in business because of her good reputation with her customers.  With this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she plans to buy tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. Thanks to Kiva field partner Faulu Kenya, she has a bank account and has been able learn more about the culture of saving.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes and potatoes

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en: Gaudencia is 43 years old. She is married with three children. Gaudencia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 32,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages and to extend her mini grocery store into a bigger one. Gaudencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Gaudencia hopes to improve her business as well as her family's way of life.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like snacks, beverages, and more

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 32 años, es una mujer muy alegre, dinámica y muy responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 13, 5 años y el ultimo de 8 meses; ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su pareja y sus tres menores hijos. EL trabajo de Rosa, consiste en la costura, se dedica a la confección de sus propios diseños y a la costura de otras personas, ella se adapta a la temporada, y a lo que desean los clientes, ya que vende ropa para niños, lencería para señoritas, ropa de mujer, etc. tiene un taller en su casa y lleva realizando este trabajo sola por 10 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene independencia con su tiempo además que tiene buenas ganancia y le considera muy rentable, le esta yendo bien ya que gana muy bien además de tener ingresos a diaR.; desea mas adelante poder tener un taller mas grande con maquinas industriales poder dar trabajo a otras mujeres que necesitan. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera que los del banco comunal le den un buen trato y así puedan seguir siendo fuertes como hasta ahora, tiene muchas expectativas ya que sabe que estar en este grupo es de mucha responsabilidad y no quisiera fallar a sus integrantes. Con el monto solicitado 700 soles, comprará materiales para seguir con su trabajo, además ella tiene en su poder un ahorro de 500 soles y mas los 700 que le están prestando, podrá comprar una recubridora para darle mejor acabado a sus prendas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old. She is a very happy, dynamic and responsible woman. She lives with her partner. They have three children who are 13 years old, 5 years old and 8 months. She has her own home and she lives with her partner and their three young children. Rosa works in dressmaking. She creates clothing with her own designs and sewing for other people. She adapts to the season and to what her customers want. She now sells children’s clothing, lingerie, women’s clothing, etc. She has a studio in her home. She has been doing this work for ten years. What she likes about her work is that she has independence with her time. In addition, she likes that she earns good profits. She considers her business to be profitable. The business is doing very well and she is earning income every day. In the future, she wants to have a bigger shop with industrial machines in order to offer work to other women who need to work. 
This will be he her first loan with the MFP organization. She hopes that the communal bank will give her a good deal and that it will continue doing well like now. She has lots of expectations since she now knows that the group has a lot of responsibility and does not want its members to fail. With the requested loan of 700 soles, she will purchase materials in order to continue with her work. In addition, she already has 500 soles in saving. With the additional 700 soles, she will be able to purchase a sewing machine to better finish her garments.

loans.use: purchase dressmaking materials and a machine to better finish her garments.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 47 years old, married, and has seven children, four of whom attend school.  She is a farmer in Kitale, Kenya, which she has been doing for over 10 years. Her farm produces maize and beans, which she sells to the local market. Her family relies fully on farming for their upkeep.

Agnes is requesting a loan for 90,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase and insure a dairy cow for 52,000 KES and purchase poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming for 38,000 KES. She hopes that the boost in her farming income will help her feed her family as well as educate her children.  Agnes states that diseases are the major limitation in the farming business.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Canastitos Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Canastitos está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Rosa Adela quien vende frituras (papas, yuquitas, enchiladas, platanitos). Este negocio lo inicio hace 8 años en el mercado más gran de Nicaragua. Ella invertirá en materia prima plátanos, aceite, bolsas…etc.
Las otras integrantes son Maribel del Socorro quien se dedica a la elaboración de canastos de bambú y Kenia Máyela quien vende pan (bonetes, francés, picos, de queso, molde) en un mercado de Managua.
texts.en: The Canastitos Group is comprised of three hardworking and enterprising people.  One of the group members is Rosa Adela who sells fried foods (potatoes, yucca balls, enchiladas, plantains).  She started this business 8 years ago in Nicaragua's biggest market.  She will invest in basic materials such as plantains, oil, bags...etc.  The other group member are Maribel del Socorro who makes a living making bamboo baskets and Kenia Máyela who sells bread (French bread, cheese bread, and various sweet dessert breads) in a market in Managua.

loans.use: to buy basic materials such as plantains, oil and bags.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 39 years old, married and has 3 children.  She lives in Hioma, Uganda.  Juliet sells rice, beans and groundnut and has been in this business for 15 years.  She is faced with challenges in price fluctuations, inflation and seasonal weather.  Her business goal is to diversify the business and venture into farming, and her personal goal is to educate her children.

Juliet needs a loan to buy beans, rice and groundnut for resale.

loans.use: buy beans, rice and groundnut

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es: La Sra. Filomena, es dueña de una tienda de barrio en la zona de San Antonio,  la casa donde tiene la venta es propia la señora vive con el esposo el cual es chofer propietario de un vehículo taxi,  la clienta es antigua ya que esta en su decima tercera secuencia,  el crédito que solicita es para la compra de mercadería para la temporada de navidad y año nuevo (refrescos, productos enlatados,  panetones y otros) la clienta es muy buena generalmente los créditos que tubo en la institución los cancelo con normalidad y puntualidad, el deseo de la Sra. Filomena es el de tener su propio almacén donde ofrezca variedad de productos a sus clientes y así ellos de vayan satisfechos y felices, la Sra. Filomena es una persona muy amable y trabajadora, se siente muy feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan ya que gracias al apoyo de la institución la Sra. Salió adelante e hizo crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Filomena is the owner of a neighborhood store in the San Antonio area. She owns the home where she has the shop. She lives with her spouse who is an owner-driver of a taxi.  She is an old client since this is her 13th loan cycle. The loan she’s asking for is for the purchase of merchandise for the Christmas and New Year’s season (drinks, canned goods, Christmas pastries, etc.). She is generally a very good client. The loans she’s had with the lending institution have been repaid as expected and on time. Filomena’s wish is to have her own store where she sells a wide variety of products to her customers so that they are satisfied and happy. Filomena is a very friendly and hardworking person. She feels very happy for the opportunity she’s been given since, thanks to the support from the lending institution, she’s gotten ahead and has grown her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (drinks, canned good, Christmas pastries, etc.)

loans.name: Angel Miguel

texts.es:
Ángel Miguel tiene 53 años de edad es casado tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 29, 23, 21, 19 y 13 años de edad en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Ángel se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura para mantener a mi familia lo que más produce es el maíz y el trigo.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en San Miguel y el choclo en la comunidad.

Solicita el crédito para la agricultura y comprar semillas, abonos, urea, líquidos para la maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito ha podido comprar lo necesario para poder sembrar como las semillas, abonos agrícolas.
El sueño es poder comprar terreno y que los hijos culminen los estudios y sean profesionales.
El desafío que se le ha presentado es la lancha y los fuertes vientos que dañan el cultivo de maíz.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir de paseo con la familia las festividades del Divino Niño.
texts.en:
Ángel Miguel is 53 years old, married with five children, and lives with his wife and children in  San Miguel in the Province of Bolívar. His children are twenty-nine, twenty-three, twenty-one, nineteen, and thirteen years old.

The VRC [Ventanillas Rurales Crédito, or Window to the Countryside Loan] is called Yagui Chico, after the community which is twenty minutes from the Canton of San Miguel, and whose members work in agriculture to provide their families with a source of income.

Ángel works as a farmer to provide for his family. He grows mostly corn and wheat.

His purchases and sales occur mostly in San Miguel, while he raises the corn in his community.

He is requesting the loan for agricultural purposes – to purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea [a nitrogen-rich additive], and liquid herbicides.

With the help of the loan, he has been able to purchase the seeds and fertilizers necessary to be able to plant his crops.
His dream is to be able to purchase land, and that his children complete their studies and have professions.
The frost and strong winds that damage his corn crops are the challenges he faces.
In his free time he likes to take walks with his family during the Christmas festivities.

loans.use: for agricultural purposes – to purchase seeds, fertilizers, urea [a nitrogen-rich additive], and liquid herbicides.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married to a driver and has four children. operates a grocery shop. The family lives together in Nkrontrodo, near Elmina.

Efua has been running a grocery shop for some years now. She uses her income to help her husband in paying their children’s school fees.

Efua needs this loan of 600 GHS to enable her to stock a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With all additional profits, she will grow her business.

loans.use: to stock a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Akeer

texts.en:
Akeer is a 28 year old married woman who has four children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in a stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Akeer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase beans and onions to sell.

loans.name: Wangninan 1 Group

texts.fr: WANGNINAN 1 est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Angèle (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 31 ans. Angèle  n'a pas fréquenté l'école.Angèle est mariée à un certain Benoît. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Angèle vend des colliers, des plastiques et des assiettes par la méthode de distribution depuis cinq ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Angèle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Angèle  sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe WANGNINAN 1, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des plastiques.

loans.name: Marie Odette Mathilde

texts.fr:
Marie Odette est une femme courageuse et travailleuse de 69ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 1 enfant. Son fils, coursier et encore célibataire habite toujours avec elle. Leur objectif est de pouvoir s’acheter un terrain afin d’y bâtir une maison, ainsi, ils n’auront plus à payer le loyer qu’ils trouvent assez chargé. Elle est très déterminée pour son travail car elle s’occupe seul de son activité sans aucune aide.
Elle a commencé à exercer l'activité en 2011, mais avant ça elle était baby-sitter. C’est grâce à sa dernière activité qu’elle a pu financer l’ouverture du magasin général. Son activité peut être défini comme florissante car son chiffre d’affaires a augmenté. Son seul souci est l’impact de l’instabilité politique qui aurait un effet néfaste pour sa vente, comme les grèves.

loans.use: acheter des produits de première nécessités et des marchandises générales

loans.name: Ablossi

texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Tsévié (Zio prefecture), Ablossi A. is married to a shoe-maker and is the mother of two. She also takes care of two other children. She spent her entire childhood in her father’s chicken coop. She helps her mother to sell poultry at the marketplace. After getting married, she got involved in this business -- which is booming especially during holidays -- in order to help with family expenses. Faced with the increase in market demand, she obtained two loans successively that she has repaid in good standing.

A very energetic and ambitious woman, she has decided to build up a substantial inventory by buying chickens and other poultry from her village and from surrounding areas. In this way, she can limit her travel expenses each week. Ms. A. is requesting a loan of $800 to expand her business and to augment her income, in order to raise her family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1970 à Tsévié (P/Zio), Madame A. Ablossi est mariée à un cordonnier et mère de deux enfants et à sa charge deux (02) autres enfants. Elle a passé toute son enfance dans le poulailler de son père et aide sa mère à vendre les volailles au marché. Une fois mariée, elle se lance dans ce commerce très florissant surtout en période de fête pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille. Ainsi, face à la croissance de la demande sur le marché, elle obtient successivement deux crédits qu’elle a très bien remboursés.

Très dynamique et ambitieuse, elle décide d’aller acheter les poulets et autres volailles dans son village et ses alentours et en faire un stock consistant afin de limiter les frais de déplacement chaque semaine. Madame A. Ablossi sollicite un crédit de $800 qui va lui permettre d’accroître et d’augmenter son revenu afin d’élever le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire poultry to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Florence would like to buy fruits and 7 sacks of cereal and food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add stock and build a stall

loans.name: Shabani Ally

texts.en:
Shabani is a 33-year-old resident of the Kinondoni area in Central Dar Es Salaam. He has been a technician for aluminum frames for the past five years and has been contracted to design aluminum frames in various offices in Dar es Salaam.

His work is seasonal, so if the contracted work terminates, he looks for another contract immediately. To sustain a living, he has a restaurant at his place where he prepares chips, fried eggs and chicken each evening.

He is in need of US Dollars 1,200 to help him acquire more equipment for his aluminum cutting business so that he can favorably compete and satisfy all his clients.

loans.use: Buying the Aluminium cutting Equipments

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is requesting $1,500 USD from Esperanza and her house is her guarantee. She is the sole recipient of her loan; she does not have a group. She is a new client. Previously she had taken out a loan from a bank in town, but the interest was enormous. The loan was $2,125 USD but with interest, she had to pay back $3,850 (so the interest was more than 80%).

Marie has a small clothing store next to her house which she runs with her husband, Jonas Fontaine. She wants to expand her business by putting a small restaurant in front of her shop. Her son sells hot dogs on the street and she wants to buy a machine so they can make them themselves and sell them in the restaurant.

Marie is 53 and has six children. Her youngest is 16 years old and they are all going to school (Marie only has a basic education). She’s from Haiti which borders the Dominican Republic to the west but has lived in the DR for 14 years. She speaks Creole and Spanish.

loans.use: Purchase building materials, food and equipment to create a restaurant

loans.name: Berta Antonio Joao

texts.pt:
Berta is single but she lives with a man with whom she has 2 children. Berta's husband is not employed, and makes his living from small jobs. Berta entered the loan program in 2006. Berta lives with her family in a location called Nzucuane in the Homine district. It's an essentially rural area, so Berta also has a small field for subsistence farming for her family. With her earnings, she helps her partner with the household expenses. In the future, she wants to help her partner also fix up the house. Berta's children are studying in elementary school.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Berta e solteira mas vive com um homem com quem tem 2 filhos. O marido de Berta nao esta empregado vive de pequenos expedientes.Berta entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. Berta vive com sua familia numa localidade chamada Nzucuane no distrito de Homine. E uma zona essencilamente rural. por isso Berta tambem faz machamba para a subsistencia de sua familia. Com os rendimentos ela ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa. No futuro ela quer ajudar o marido tambem a reabilitar a casa. Os filhos de Berta estao a estudar no nivel primario basico.

loans.use: Berta wants to use the money to buy products for her store

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Don Victor is a very honorable person with a large sense of responsibility in his life. Since he was very small he has worked in agricultural activities. His parents left him their lands in an inheritance, as well as their knowledge of such things. Today he is a responsible father that assumes his role as the provider for his family. He is the boss of his home but he is not authoritarian. His leadership abilities help him to be able to organize any type of committee to benefit his community. Victor has worked in agriculture for around twenty years. Recently the harvests were jeopardized by inclement weather but even with that he continued persevering with the sowing of potato, beans and oats. He is motivated by his wife and 4 children. He seeks to intensify his activities in raising animals so that they can become another way of maintaining his home. To do this he will buy a cow to fatten it up and sell it later. All his efforts are so that his children can have an education. He has a desire to see them succeed. Help this father to fight for the improvement of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Víctor, es una persona honorable con mucho sentido de responsabilidad en su vida, desde muy pequeño ha trabajado en las actividades agrícolas, ya que sus padres le dejaron como herencia sus tierras y también sus conocimientos en estos temas. Hoy es un padre responsable que asume a cabalidad sus roles en el sostenimiento de su familia, él es jefe de su hogar pero no por ello es autoritario y sus habilidades para el liderazgo le ayudan a poder organizar cualquier comité a favor de su comunidad.Víctor lleva trabajando en la agricultura alrededor de veinte años, últimamente las cosechas fueron perjudicadas por la inclemente fuerza del invierno pero aún así seguirá perseverando en la siembra de papa, olluco, habas y avena. Su fuerza es motivada por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.Desea intensificar sus actividades en la crianza de animales para que este se convierta en un sostén más en la economía de su hogar, para ello comprará una vaca para engordarla y luego venderla, todos los esfuerzos los realiza a favor de la educación de sus hijos que albergan muchos deseos de superación.Apoya a este padre de familia a luchar por la superación de su familia.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of small animals and the food to feed them

loans.name: Alphajor

texts.en:
Alphajor S. has a very creative enterprise. He has two bikes that he rents to those wishing to transport themselves or goods to various locations in Koinadugu village. He said there is a high demand for the service, especially on market days, and is requesting a loan so he may purchase another motorbike.

With the income he feels capable of providing his family needs, and is grateful for SMT's loan activity. Married with 4 children, he said he has a foundation for his children’s education.

loans.use: He would like to purchase another motorbike to meet the demand for transportation on market days.

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru:
Sadriddin D. is married and is the father of three children. Several years ago his brother opened a general store where only groceries are sold. Now that Sadriddin has married and bought an apartment, he also has decided to open his own business, since his brother and parents can no longer support him. Sadriddin is going to to sell alcoholic beverages as well as select food items, so as not to compete with his brother. He is planning to open a store near his brother's business.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Садриддин имеет троих детей. Несколько лет назад его брат открыл магазин и продавал только продукты питания. И Садриддин решил также заняться бизнесом, так как он женился и купил квартиру, брат и родители уже не могли ему помогать. Его товар алкогольные напитки , а также некоторые продукты питания. Он планирует отделить свой товар и открыть свой магазин недалеко от магазина брата.

loans.use: Food Market

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es:
Ariel lives in the Rio Seco zone of the city of El Alto. Ariel is 20 years old, and just completed secondary school.

He lives with his mother, who he helps with the needs of the business given she is a merchant. Ariel receives Bs. 600 monthly from his father, who lives overseas.

The loan would be utilized for legalizing his bachelor’s degree to be ready to enroll in the university.

It is the first loan with IMPRO, and the financial evaluation indicates he qualifies for the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ariel vive en el Manzano N, patio 10 de la zona Rio Seco, ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Ariel tiene 20 años de edad y acaba de terminar la Secundaria.
