Vive junto a su madre a la cual ayuda en los quehaceres del negocio, ya que ella es comerciante. Ariel recibe una mensualidad de Bs. 600 de parte de su padre, quien vive en el exterior. El crédito lo destinara en el trámite para la legalización de su titulo de bachiller y así estar listo para ingresar a la Universidad. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Pay the cost for legalizing bachelor's degree (finished high school).

loans.name: Sumangul.

texts.ru: Давлатова Сумангул  Абдуллоевна проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 43 года, замужем, имеет  3 детей.Образование среднее. Сумангул уже 9 лет занимается купле продажей одежды. На рынке города Вахдат она имеет торговую точку. От прибыли , которую приносит ее небольшой бизнес Сумангул может воспитывать и растить своих детей. В данное время клиентка хочет закупить сезонную одежду и поэтому решила взять кредит . Увеличив ассортимент товара Сумангул может получить хорошую прибыль.Тем самым предоставит  жителям  Вахдата качественную и не дорогую продукцию. Сумангул планирует погасить кредит в течении 6 месяцев.

loans.use: увеличить ассортимент товара

loans.name: Esohe

texts.en: Esohe O. is 28 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, where she earns income running a hairdressing business. Esohe O. was trained for 3 years and started her business this year. She is now requesting a loan of US$525 to be able to buy beauty salon materials like hair attachments, creams, and relaxers. Esohe is thankful to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty salon materials for sale

loans.name: Tainutsu Group

texts.en:
The Tainutsu group is composed of three members and Isatu C. is the group leader. All the three members sell African print materials in the market of Makeni in Sierra Leone. Isatu is 38 years old and married with 6 children. With the profit from the business she is able to provide for her children's education.

The members would like to expand their business to earn more income for their families. A loan of Le.2,400,000 will enable them meet their dreams.

loans.use: Purchase more stock of African print cotton materials

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Frola S.. She is married and has two children, aged 1 and 6. She has two dependents, who live with her because they are orphans. In 2001, Frola established her genge business. Working seven days a week, and thirteen to sixteen hours a day, she earns about US $430 every month from this business. Frola requires a loan in order to buy more goods in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy more goods in bulk.

loans.name: Sakhiba

texts.en: Sakhiba (her husband is pictured) lives in the Khachmaz region. She is 45 and has three children. Her and her husband have been running a farming business for ten years. They would like a loan of $1200 to buy more seeds for fruits and vegetables to help improve and increase their farming business.

loans.use: to buy seeds (fruits and vegetables)

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. sells groceries such as biscuits, oats, milk, and other canned products at the Elmina market. Veronica has received no formal education. She is a widow and has one child. Veronica has been selling groceries since 2000. She is responsible for paying the school fees for her child, and housekeeping expenses. She plans to use the loan to buy bags of sugar, boxes of milk, and other items for resale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: Buy bags of sugar, boxes of milk, and other items for resale

loans.name: Mumtaz's Group

texts.en:
Mumtaz baji is a wife of M. and lives in the Bund Road area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has lived there for the last 15 years. She is the mother of two sons. Mumtaz baji's husband is a driver by profession and operates an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has been in this line of work for the last 20 years. Mumtaz baji is a housewife and also makes clothing for her neighbors. She is applying for a loan to make payments on her husband's auto-rickshaw.

She is joined in her loan group by several other people. Meeran baji wants a loan to buy coconuts to resell. Sobia baji wants a loan to buy wood to resell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy material (such as beads and colored thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Seema baji wants a loan to buy goats for her meat business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To pay installments on an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Con 6 años D. puesta su tienda en el barrio donD. expenD. cervezas y gaseosas, la señora Margarita, con sus 52 años, ya no tiene que velar por sus hijos, ya todos mayores y bien emprendidos, por lo que se ha abocado D. fondo en su negocio y, más aún, debido a la fuerte competencia interna D. las cervezas preponderante en el país. Siendo así la situación, los sueños D. la señora Margarita van tomando forma en la medida en que adquiera cierta estabilidad en aras D. implementar un local donD. pueda vender comida china (chifa) y poder contrarrestar la decreciente venta D. cervezas.

Es por ello que la señora Margarita necesita D. 1000 soles, para poder solventar sus gastos, propios D. una señora digna D. pasar su adultez bajo una óptima calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
After 6 six years in her store in the neighborhood where she sells beer and soft drinks, Margarita, who is 52 years old, no longer has to lose sleep over her children. They are grown up and have their start in life. Margarita has dedicated herself to her business, even more so because of the strong competition for beer sales in the country. Because of this situation, Margarita dreams of having a certain level of stability so that she can open a small restaurant where she could sell Chinese food and therefore be able to counteract the effects of the falling beer sales. This is why Margarita needs 1000 soles, to be able to settle her expenses, as a lady deserving of passing her later years with an optimum quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have more capital, with the purpose of purchasing beers and supplies necessary for her store and to take advantage of such as a fruitful season as the upcoming holiday celebrations.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 50 años, vive sola. Toda su vida ha estado dedicada a las tareas agrícolas y a la crianza de animales, cada día se levanta muy temprano para ver sus tierras de cultivo, eso es lo que le mantiene vital y llena de energías para poder seguir adelante. Juana siembra papa, maíz, trigo y otros productos que se produce en sus tierras de cultivo. Además, tiene ovejas y pollos que ocasionalmente cría. Su motivación diaria es seguir adelante por ella misma. Es la primera vez que Juana solicita un préstamo en MFP por que se promete ser  cumplidora y puntual de sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado podrá invertir en la siembra, comprando sacos de fertilizantes, además, comprará más ovejas para criar.
texts.en:
Juana is 50 years old and lives alone. She has worked in agriculture and the raising of animals her whole life. Every day she gets up very early to see her farm fields, this is what keeps her full of life and energy to be able to move ahead. Juana plants potatoes, corn, wheat and other products that grow in her fields. She also has sheep and chickens that she oftentimes raises. Her daily motivation is to get herself ahead. This is the first time that Juana is requesting a loan at MFP and she promises to be compliant and punctual with her payments. With the proceeds she will be able to invest in planting, buying sacks of fertilizers, and also she will purchase more sheep to raise.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Penda D., 27 ans, mariée, 01 enfant et 04 autres en charge est membre du banc villageois de Sankagne  depuis 1 an et demi. Elle veut acheter du fumier, des herbes et feuilles séchés, des  engrais, payer les frais d’arrosage et de raccordement pour renforcer  son activité de culture et vente de bananes qui marche bien dans sa localité. Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Penda D., age 27, is married and has one child. She also has four other children to support. She's been a member of the Sankagne village bank for one year and a half. She wants to buy manure, herbs and dried leaves, fertilizers, and pay for the water expenses, in order to bolster her business. The latter consists in cultivating and selling bananas, and is doing well in her city. The loan she's seeking will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizers, etc, for her banana plantation

loans.name: Sarvaroy

texts.ru: Гулова Сарварой жительница города Яван. Живет со своей семьей очень далеко от центра . Она занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота , а так же торговлей молока. Имеет хорошую породистую корову , коорая дает окола 10 литров молока. Но для того, чтбы увеличить объем получаемой продукции , а так же увеличить прибыль хочет получить кредит и купить еще одну дойную корову. Это поможет ей снизить цену на молоко и таким образом помочь населению покупать дешевле продукт первой необходимости. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sarvaroy G. resides in the town of Yavan. She lives with her family quite far from the center of town, where she raises cattle, and sells dairy products. Sarvaroy has an excellent breed of cow that gives approximately ten liters of milk; however, in order to increase production volume, as well as profit, she would like a loan to purchase an additional milk cow. This will help her reduce the cost of milk, assisting people in purchasing this staple at a lower price. She will be able to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milk cow

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a village store owner in Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela.  She started her general store business so she could help her husband, a farmer, better provide for their family and their children's education.  She is requesting a loan so she can purchase more stock to improve her store and to buy two piglets to begin a hog-raising business.   

Their four children are all studying in the primary level of education.  Her family is happily living in the agricultural village where corn and tobacco are the main products.  Most of the people are thankful that their village is rich in livelihood resources. They have a wide farm lots and a river where residents can fish.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for general store and two piglets for hog-raising

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been a local alcohol cooker and seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for two years, working at her business for 10 hours everyday and earning an average monthly profit of $125. She belongs to the Majengo "A" street group loan (Group code 2001).

Grace is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for alcohol preparation. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Grace is 25 years old, single, and has two children, ages 7 and 2. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more items for alcohol preparation.

loans.name: Naimat Atta Ullah Group

texts.en:
Naimat baji is a citizen of a mid-size city named Vehari, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Naimat baji is a very hardworking lady; she performs her duties as a mother and as a wife very effectively. She is not an educated lady but she knows the value of education. She keeps herself involved in a clothes-sewing business because she wants to give her children a better education.

Naimat baji’s husband's name is A. U. and he has an animal-selling business. He has been doing this work for the past 6 years. He sells animals to the butcher shops and animal markets also. Naimat baji is applying for a loan to buy goats for her husband’s animal-selling business.

Naimat baji is the group leader for three other women from her locality. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Rubina Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes to sell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy goats to re-sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda B. is a 40-year-old mother of four. Her husband Jimmy is a laborer. The family lives in the village along the beaches of San Jose, the capital town of the province. Her children collect empty bottles, cans, and plastics in the beaches to sell to help support the needs of the family; however, years ago some beaches prohibited children from collecting the garbage in their backyard.  

Imelda and her husband decided to get capital to buy and sell the items. She joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) to start the business, but their small initial capital is not enough to continue the operation. She applied for this loan to buy assorted empty cans, bottles, and plastics. They are privileged to get this bigger loan for them to stock some of the items in order to dispose of them at a good price. The family dreams of having their own junk shop in the future, and of being able to send their children to college.

loans.use: To buy empty cans, bottles, and plastics.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos R. ha tenido ya un crédito con FVP el cual pago puntual mente, nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para terminar la mejora que está realizando, le falta terminar de colocar el vitropiso en las recamaras de sus hijas. Solicita el crédito para comprar el material y pagar a la persona que realizara la mejora ya que en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario.
Las personas que aparecen en la foto sin su esposa la señora Sandra Guadalupe Alvarado y una hija, don Carlos se encontraba en su empleo como gerente de un óptica en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Carlos R. is requesting a loan to install floor tiles in his daughters' rooms. Since he does not currently have the money to finish this project, he will use the loan to purchase materials and to pay the person who will do the work. This is his second loan from FVP, and he repaid the first loan on time.

The photograph shows Carlos's wife, Sandra Guadalupe Alvarado, and one of his daughters, as Carlos was working at his job managing an optical store in the city center when the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Complete the installation of tile floors in his home

loans.name: Oltinoy

texts.ru: Сохибова Олтиной- женщина 44 лет. Замужем мать 4-х детей. Олтиной занимает торговлей женских тканей. Олтиной закупает товар на рынках «Гули Сурх» города Истаравшана и Атушбазара Б. Гафуровского района. Олтиной второй год как кредитуется у нас. В свободное время она занимается переработкой пряжи. Олтиной имеет 10-летный стаж в сфере торговли. Олтиной торгует на рынках Оппон и Мархамата Аштского района.
texts.en:
Oltinoy S. is 44 years old, married and has 4 children. She is involved in sales of women’s fabrics. Oltinoy buys her goods at the Guli Surh markets in the cities of Istaravshan and Atushbazar in the B. Gafurov district. This is Oltinoy’s second year of working with our organization. During her free time, she processes yarn. Oltinoy has 10 years of experience in the sales field. She sells at the Oppon and Marhamata markets in the Asht district.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of women's fabrics

loans.name: Elsa Gioconda

texts.es: Elsa Gioconda R. Pérez es una señora de 55 años de edad. ella esta casada y tiene 4 hijos los cuales viven por cuenta propia. ellos están agradecidos con ella y su esposo pues se esforzaron dándoles el sustento y la educación. Elsa inicio su negocio cuando una situación muy difícil le forzó a dejar su trabajo fijo. desde muy joven Elsa era profesora de la escuela primaria, pero el uso de las tizas descuido su garganta haciendo que le brotaran nódulos de inflamación a causa de la tiza y el esfuerzo que hacia para hablarle a sus alumnos, esta fue la causa por la que sus empleadores decidieron despedirla, pero Elsa no se dio por vencida y con su insignificante indemnización estableció una pequeña pulpería. la cual desde entonces ha sido su fuente de ingresos tanto para ella como para su familia. por lo que su esposo es simplemente un técnico de electricidad y trabaja de manera ambulante y sus ganancias no son muchas, la señora Elsa desea este préstamo para surtir su negocio  y de esa forma recopilar un mayor porcentaje de ingresos.
texts.en:
Elsa Gioconda R. Pérez is a 55 year old woman. She is married and she has 4 children, who live on their own. They are grateful to Elsa and her husband due to the efforts they made for sustenance and education. Elsa began her business when a very difficult situation forced her to leave her fixed job. From a very young age, Elsa was a primary school teacher, but using the chalk disagreed with her throat, and the chalk and the effort that she made for her students caused nodes of inflammation. This was the reason why her bosses decided to lay her off, but Elsa was not vanquished and with her small severance she started a small grocery store. This is what has been a source of income for her and her family since them. Because her husband was an electrical technician and works without a fixed location, they don’t earn much. Señora Elsa wants this loan to stock her business and in this manner gather together a bigger portion of income.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en:
Julio is 36 years old and lives with Juana, who is 31.  The couple has two children, 7 and 5 years old, who attend elementary school. 

Julio started working in construction with his father at a very young age, which he still does to this day.  Also, thanks to the effort and help of his wife, the couple has been able to start a small, well-stocked grocery store based out of their home.  The store has produced excellent economic results.  The store sells milk, which Julio and Juana obtain from from their four cows, which produce a substantial amount of milk.  

Julio is applying for this loan in order to purchase merchandise such as flour, rice, noodles, oil, etc., to better stock their small grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase flour, rice, noodles, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Mansur

texts.en:
S. Mansur is 47 years old. He is married and has 2 children. Mansur is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children. He has a great experience in cattle breeding because he has been observing it for more than 10 years. His eldest son, who appears in the picture, helps him with his business. With time, he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance in investing in his business. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow. Mansur has applied for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy young cattle. He and his family thank you very much for the support that you offer them to continue this business and help them give their children a better quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchasing cattle in order to expand the business and to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.name: Taj Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
Taj baji has lived in Borewala, Pakistan for 20 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Taj baji is a very talented lady. She makes and sells parandas, an ornament that women use to tie back their hair. Her husband, M. R. helps Taj baji by selling her parandas in the market. They each have 6 years of experience in this business. Now she is applying for a loan to buy thread and beads to expand their paranda business. 

This loan group consists of four additional people. Anwar baji wants a loan to buy vehicle tires to sell. Shamim baji wants a loan to repair her truck. Nazia baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Taj baji is seated second from the right in this photo.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith G. is from the village of Garang in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Judith is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells daily-use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Judith from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition and to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jhaqueline Victoria

texts.es: La Sra. Jhaqueline H. trabajo como Banco de Emprendimiento "Perlas de Bella Vista" dos secuencias el año 2007 al 2008, ahora solicita un credito individual para invertir en su negocio que tiene un año de antigüedad. Tiene una hija en edad escolar y el esposo es transportista de la la linea de radio taxis, en el dia tambien se dedica a la venta de articulos para el hogar como electrodomesticos y su negocio principal lo realiza en horas de la noche, venta pollo frito. Por su historial y referencias de sus vecinos la señora es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Jhaqueline Haunca has worked with Perlas de Bella Vista Communal Bank for two years in a row -- 2007, through 2008 -- and now is requesting an individual loan to invest in her business which is one year old. She has a school-age daughter, and a husband who works at a taxi transportation business and, during the day, also sells things like household appliances. Her primary business, which she does in the evening, is selling fried chicken. Her history and references from neighbors describe a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing things to make fried chicken

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Be Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which consists of eleven people and they all live in Tboung Damrei village in province. Mrs. Sokha B. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a pig breeder. Since her pigs are bigger and bigger, they need many foods. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for her breeding pigs business. Her husband, Mr. Heng Sovath, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a construction worker. Mrs. Sokha B. is 44 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is construction worker while the others are attending the local school. 
   
Eight members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy pig food for her breeding pigs business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, animales que atiende todos los días en su establo, con alimento especializado y la alfalfa que ella misma cultiva. También siembra otros productos como papa, maíz, arveja, cebolla, entre otros. Yolanda obtiene la leche de sus vacas diariamente, la cual vende a sus vecinos y amistades. Los años de intenso trabajo le han permitido mantener la economía de su hogar estable, aun en momentos difíciles, razón por la cual está planeando su futuro adquiriendo más animales y extensiones de terreno para incrementar su producción agrícola.
Esta es la primera vez que Yolanda tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que está muy entusiasmada por trabajar con su banco comunal y se compromete a ser puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Compra de abono

loans.name: Lili

texts.es: Lili es una socia trabajadora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 48 años, es madre de seis hijos, de los cuales cuatros son mayores de edad, ella es madre soltera, que se esfuerza por salir adelante y brindar un futuro mejor a sus hijos. Lili se dedica a la venta de bebidas y golosinas, actividad que lo realiza en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Solteritas” desde hace cinco años. El primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de golosinas para vender en su casa, ahora Lili necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar mercadería como prendas de vestir y zapatos para vender en su casa. La meta de Lili es  tener una tienda de todo tipo de artículos  para el hogar.
texts.en:
Lili is a hard-working and active member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the region of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and is mother to six children, of whom four are adults. She is a single mother who works hard to get ahead and provide a better future for her children. Lili is dedicated to selling drinks and candy, an activity that she conducts from her home. She has been a member of "Las Solteritas" (The Single Ladies) Community Bank for five years. The first loan that she obtained was for 300 soles which she used for the purchase of candy to sell in her home. Now, Lili needs a loan of 1,500 soles which will be used to purchase merchandise such as clothing and shoes to sell from her home. Lili's goal is to have a shop selling all types of items for the home.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a 50-year-old married woman with three children. She works as a farmer to provide for, along with her husband, the living conditions of her family. She has been involved in the agriculture sector for more than thirteen years.

Today, Mirna is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase agricultural tools.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural tools

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazaret”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años, está casada y tiene 03 hijos de los cuales 01 es mujer y 02 varones quienes están estudiando; tiene  estudios de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace 3 años, se dedica a  la compra y venta de kerosene desde hace 02 meses; pero desde mucho antes se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.
Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 con el que compró 02 ovinos porque no alcanzaba para comprar ganado vacuno. Por ello actualmente se dedica a la  compra y venta de Kerosene y  a la  crianza de ganado, animales menores, agricultura para autoconsumo.

Ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2000.00 Nuevos Soles, con ello comprará 02 toretes para engordarlo en 03 meses y luego venderlo en la feria de ganado.

Indica que en su  Banco Comunal hay socias alegres y eso le gusta porque se relaja.

Su anhelo es que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales y su negocio de kerosén prospere.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Jesús de Nazaret Communal Bank in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 30, married, and has three children. She has one girl and two boys, who go to school. She has a high school education. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for three years. She has been buying and selling kerosene for two months. But, she has been buying and selling livestock for many years. With her first loan for 300 PEN she bought two sheep because it was not enough to buy cattle. She currently buys and sells kerosene, raises cattle and small animals, and farms for her own consumption. She needs a loan for 2,000 to buy two young bulls to fatten in three months. She will then sell them at the livestock fair.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two young bulls

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane S. is thirty-two years old and a hard-working businesswoman. She is blessed with six children who are all in school. She owns a shop that she has been operating for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase more jewelry, waves, braids, and cosmetics for ladies. Her dream is to obtain a nice salon and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry, waves, braids, and cosmetics for ladies.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Ahorro está formado por un grupo de mujeres alegres y  carismáticas  que buscan la manera de salir adelante siempre con una sonrisa y siendo visionA. de un mejor futuro para ellas y su familia saliendo avante ante las dificultades que la vida les presenta en su día a día, todas  viven en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca,  localidad que se caracteriza  por ser la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, proclamada también como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por su belleza natural, la incomparable  arquitectura de  su centro histórico.

Diana L. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro hace 8 ciclos durante este tiempo se ha beneficiado de los prestamos que la Fundación entrega  invirtiendo  en su negocio, en su casa y para los gastos de su hija, nuestra socia tiene 24 años es madre soltera de una niña de 4  años que estudia en pre básica  y es ella la que  corre con todos los gastos ya que la niña no es reconocida por su padre.

Nuestra socia trabaja como comerciante vende varios  productos como juguetes, plásticos y muchos artículos más, nos manifiesta que desde sus cinco años acompañaba a su mamá al  negocio que tenia y a partir de  los 14  ya maneja su propia mercadería y clientes, tiene su puesto en el  mercado 9 de Octubre  teniendo mucha dificultad con la policía municipal   que no les dejan trabajar por no tener un puesto propio. Tampoco tiene casa propia vive aún  arrendando  con su hija.

Con el nuevo préstamo solicitado a  la Fundación va a invertir en la compra de muñecas, pelotas, juegos de té, ollas, juego de luces, y más  juguetes de plástico para la época Navideña. 

Su mayor sueño tener un puesto propio para trabajar tranquila y construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
El Ahorro (Savings) community bank is composed by a group of happy, charismatic women looking for a way to succeed, always with a smile, envisioning a better future for them and their families, going through the hardships of every day like. All of them live in the city of Cuenca, the third biggest city in Ecuador, declared Cultural Patrimony of Humanity due to its natural beauty, and unique architecture of its historical center. Diana L. has been a member of El Ahorro for 8 seasons. During that time, she has taken advantage of the loans she received, investing in her business, her home and covering her 4-year-old daughter’s pre-school expenses. Diana is 24 years old. She's the only income of the house, as the father is not involved in their lives. Diana is a sales person. She sells toys, plastic-based items and others. She started helping her mother when she was 5 and by the time she was 14, she was handling her own products and had her own clients. She has a stand in the '9 de Octubre' local market, always having problems with police, who's constantly picking her up because she doesn’t own her stand. She doesn’t own a home, either and she’s still renting a home with her daughter. This new loan will be used to purchase dolls, soccer balls, tea sets, lights and more plastic-based toys to sell during the Christmas season. Her greatest dream is to have her own stand to work more comfortably and to build her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dolls, soccer balls, tea sets, lights and others

loans.name: Alberto Cayetano

texts.es:
Desde hace 8 años, en el municipio de Somotillo en el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Alberto F. se dedica a la venta de queso comercializado por él mismo y ofreciéndolo a sus clientes que le visitan para comprar el productos que es de mucha calidad.

Él se ha destacado por ser muy trabajador y esforzado y por atender a las necesidades de su familia. El crédito lo está solicitando porque requiere invertir en la compra del queso y es por esta razón que espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado y así logrará obtener el queso para comercializarlo y obtener sus ingresos.
texts.en:
For the last eight years Sr. Alberto F. has been selling cheese in the municipality of Somotillo in the department of Chinandega. He sells the cheese himself and also has customers come to him for the high-quality products. He is well known for being very hard-working, for putting in a lot of effort, and for paying attention to the needs of his family. Alberto is asking for a loan because he needs money to buy cheese, and for this reason he hopes that his request will be granted. Then he will be able to obtain cheese to sell and earn money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cheese

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza B. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. Liza is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Liza sells "ukay-ukay" or used clothes, in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her children's education. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Edis

texts.es:
Edis es una mujer emprendedora D. 49 años, está casada con Serafín, D. 59 años; ambos viven junto a sus 2 hijos: Herman D. 27 y Luis D. 26 en su casa propia, la cual heredó D. sus suegros.
Cuando empezó a dedicarse a la repostería notó que con esas ganancias podía solventar los gastos familiares, comprar los alimentos diarios y cubrir la educación D. sus hijos, es por eso que se que esmero aún más en esa labor.
DesD. hace 3 años reparte empanadas D. carne (masa D. harina horneada con relleno D. carne) a las diferente fuentes D. soda y restaurantes, también decora tortas y pasteles que lleva a las ceremonias y eventos especiales.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es elaborar las empanadas y distribuirlas con alegría, ya que considera que cuando sonríe venD. más. Por otro lado le disgusta tener que picar abundante cebolla – entre risas dice “son gajes del oficio, que se hace, salir adelante no más”.
Edis siempre busca progresar, por eso ansía instalar un puesto D. comida para no caminar mucho y vender los productos que prepara.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y conoce muy bien la metodología D. trabajo por eso le gusta compartir sus experiencias con las integrantes D. su banco comunal. Con los mil nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará todos los insumos necesarios para preparar sus postres y bocadillos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
At 49 years of age, Edis is an enterprising woman who is married to Serafin (age 59). They both live with their two children, Herman (age 27) and Luis (age 26), in their own home which they inherited from her in-laws.

When she began making pastries, Edis used her earnings to meet the family’s expenses, pay for the food they consumed on a daily basis, and cover her children’s education. For this reason, she took great care in performing her work.

For the past three years, Edis has been making empanadas (pastries filled with meat) and selling them to different soda fountains and restaurants. She also decorates cakes and desserts for ceremonies and special events. What she enjoys most about her job is preparing her empanadas and selling them with great joy. She believes she generates more sales when she has a smile on her face. On the other hand, the thing she hates most is having to chop onions. Laughingly she says, “it is part of the job, but I would rather not do it.” Edis always looks to progress in her business, so she plans to open a food stand so that she can sell her products without having to walk great distances.

This is her third loan with MFP. Edis knows the lending methodology very well and enjoys sharing her experiences with the other members of the Communal Bank. With her loan of 1000 soles, she plans to buy all the ingredients and supplies needed to prepare pastries and snacks in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing pastries & snacks

loans.name: Lethy Dodania

texts.es:
Lethy Gómez de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo es guardia privado con el tiene 2 hijos. 

Lethy empezó vendiendo ropa en casi todos los sectores de Guayaquil. Después que ahorro lo suficiente decidio tener en su casa una pequeña tienda. 

Ella ya tiene 15 años con la tienda trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días. Vende arroz, aceite, enlatados, bebidas, etc. También ha implementado artículos para papelería. Una de las dificultades para atender la tienda es su salud.
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, enlatados para su negocio y algunas medicinas para ella. En el futuro quiere surtir mas el negocio y terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Lethy Gómez is 36 years old, and lives in a semi-urban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made from cement but she only has light as a basic service. Her husband is a private guard and she has 2 children with him. Lethy began selling clothes in almost all the sectors of Guayaquil. After she had saved sufficient money she decided to open a small shop in her house. She has had this shop for 15 years and works from 7am to 10pm every day. She sells rice, oil, canned goods, drinks etc. She has also implemented stationery items. One of the difficulties about attending the store is her health. With the loan she is seeking to purchase rice, drinks, and canned goods for her business and some medicines for her. In the future she wants to stock her business more and finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans and canned goods

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
To make a living in Ughelli, Cicilia sells onions at retail prices to her customers. She is doing well in her business. Her major challenge is funds and she hopes to overcome the challenge. She loves this business because of the opportunity to interact with her customers. She is married to a commercial driver and they have 5 children. 

Cicilia is 52 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more onions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more onions to sell

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 50  años, es casada y es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Su esposo trabaja como albañil así de esta manera apoya al ingreso económico de la familia.    

Isabel alterna sus actividades del hogar con su pequeño negocio de venta de leña, ella también brinda servicios domésticos para los hermanos de la congregación “La Salle” de Urubamba. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Isabel pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar leña. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years old, is married, and is a responsible mother who in every moment seeks opportunities to get ahead and through her daily efforts to give her children a better future. Her husband works as a builder to support the family financially. Isabel alternates her household activities with her small business selling firewood. She also works as a housekeeper for the brothers of the La Salle congregation of Urubamba. She has been in business for several years now, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Isabel belongs to the "Tercer Milenio" (Third Milennium) communal bank of Asociación Arariwa. Her first loan was for $100, which she invested in her business. She needs this loan to buy firewood. Isabel is grateful for this opportunity and promises to pay off the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Isabel needs this loan to buy firewood.

loans.name: Shangilieni Group

texts.fr:
Chikwanine C. C.  est présidente du groupe de crédit  Shangilieni, elle lève sa main sur la photo, cliente au 15e cycle, âgée de 45 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants et tous étudient dans des écoles  normales . Il ya 5 ans que son mari est décedé (en 2005) suite à une courte maladie. Pendant ces 5 ans, elle supporte seule la charge de ses enfants orphelins. Cette charge pèse lourdement  sur croissance rapide de son business.  
Son business est une minu Quincaillèrie  exposée sur étallage public du marché secteur de Himbi Alanine . Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de muni Quincaillerie.
Elle  a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari avant qu’il décède. son capital initial était de 200$, mais avec la mort de son mari, elle a connu une perturbation totale, et ses activites ont grandement chuté. 
Avec  le crédit de  l’IMF Hekima,  Chikwanine C. C.  souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achétant 10 roulot des fils électriques de valeur de 500$,  6 dizaines des  Scies de valeur de  200$.
 Chikwanine C. C. vend également des Fanta, bièrres Primus  à son domicile pour accroitre son revenu et repondre aux petites urgences et nécessités de menage.
Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de chercher un dépôt d’exposition de ses produits de quincaillèrie sur le boulevard  principal de l’axe  Katindo, enfin d’etre plus competitive dans ce business et se créer des bonnes relations d’affaires avec les constructeurs et grands commerçants de la ville. 
Et plus tard construire une petite boutique pour encadrer ses enfants à la maison et maximiser des grands bénéfices  additionnels en dehors de ses activités de quincaillèrie. 
 Chikwanine C. C. rémércie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grace à ces crédits, elle a parvenu à construire une maison en planche de 10 chambres, qu’elle met à location. Les recettes de loyer de cette maison lui permet  de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
En plus, Chikwanine C. C.  a aisement retrouvé le soulagement et l’équilibre  économique grace aux crédits de Hekima, après la mort de son mari.Actuellement son business evolue positivement. Le groupe de crédit  Shangilieni  est  composé de 16 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Chikwanine C. C. is the president of the lending group Shangilieni.  (Her hand is raised in the photo.)  She is a 15th cycle client and is 45 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children, who are all studying in écoles normales (post-secondary colleges).  Five years ago (in 2005), her husband died after a brief illness.  During these five years, she alone has been supporting her orphaned children.  This responsibility weighs heavily upon the rapid growth of her business.  Her business is a mini hardware store displaying goods openly at the market in the Himbi Alanine sector.  She has been in this business for eight years.  She started her small business with her own funds received from her husband following his death.  The initial capital amounted to $200. But with her husband's death, she experienced such upheaval, and her work tumbled. C., with the loan from the micro-finance institution Hekima, wishes to increase her sales by buying ten rolls of electrical wire valued at $500 and six dozen saws valued at $200.  She also sells Fanta and Primus beers out of her home in order to increase her income, to respond to minor emergencies, and to cover household necessities.  In the future, C. plans to find an outlet for her hardware goods to display on the main boulevard of the Katindo line.  She can then be more competitive in this business and engender good business connections with the builders and major merchants of the city.  Later on, she wishes to construct a small shop at home to take care of her children and to maximize large profits in additional to those from the hardware store. C. thanks the IMF Hekima for the loans she receives without the need for any collateral at all.  Thanks to these loans, she managed to build a 10-room house made of boards that she rents out.  The rental income from this house enables her to meet the needs of her children. In addition, C. has found relief with ease and has gained financial stability, thanks to Hekima loans following her husband's death.  Currently, her business is advancing.  The Shangilieni lending group is composed of sixteen members, most of whom are women.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ten rolls of electrical wire and six dozen saws

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Rosa es conviviente, tiene 24 años y 2 hijos, Rosa vende salchipollos, actividad que realiza por las tardes en la puerta de su casa, además Rosa vende ropa variada de acuerdo a los pedidos de sus clientes.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosa, arroz y aceite.
Los sueños de Rosa son ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa, 24, is a member of the Triunfo (Triumph) communal bank. She lives with her life partner and their two children. Rosa sells salchipollos (fried potatoes and chicken) every evening at her doorstep. In addition, Rosa sells assorted clothing based on prior orders from her customers. Rosa needs an 800 sol loan to buy soft-drinks, rice and cooking oil. Rosa’s dreams are to enlarge her business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more food items, such as rice, oil and seasonings, for resale

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma C. is from the village of Marabulig 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 57 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Thelma owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling door mats and bedding supplies to local community members. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Thelma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This  will be the eighth loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Maguette Diouf

texts.fr: Monsieur  Maguette Diouf M. habite à  Bambilor. Il  est membre de la caisse de Bambilor depuis mars 2010. Il est marie et père  de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 16ans. Il est âgé de 39 ans. Monsieur  M. n’a jamais bénéficié  de crédit  au sein de l’institution. Pourtant il  évolue depuis 2 ans dans le secteur du commerce et plus particulièrement  dans l’achat et la vente de pièces détachées. Parallèlement  il est chauffeur de clando et conduit un véhicule  R 21. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de pièces  détachées  automobiles (courroix -moteur, joints, bidons d’huiles) pour renforcer le local qu’il gère  par le biais de ses frères  immigres qui lui envoient  des matériels  de transport a travers les containers. Par conséquent  le crédit  pourra lui permettre d’accroitre ses bénéfices  et pouvoir prendre en charge les dépenses  imprévues  comme par exemple l’achat de  médicaments en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Mr. Maguette Diouf M. lives in Bambilor. He has been a member of the Bambilor branch office since March 2010. He is married and the father of four children, varying in ages from 2 to 16. Mr. M., aged 39, has never obtained a loan within this institution. However, he has been in this line of business for two years, more specifically, in the buying and selling of spare parts. At the same time, he is an unofficial chauffeur and drives an R 21 vehicle. Mr. M. is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buying spare car parts (motor belts, joints, containers of oil) to bolster his premises, which he manages through his brothers abroad who send him transportation supplies and equipment via containers. As a result, the loan will allow him to grow his profits and to cover the cost of unplanned expenses, for example, buying medicines in case of illness.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing his capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en la  casa de su madre  junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos.Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la  preparación y venta  de salchipapas (platillo compuesto de papas y pedazos de pollo fritos), atiende todos los días, en la puerta de su casa. Tiene varios clientes fijos que gustan de su sazón, y también suelen comprarle seguido porque sus platillos tienen un precio accesible. Lo que más le gusta es que su trabajo es tranquilo porque no descuida las labores del hogar, y su mayor preocupación, es atender con higiene y cordialidad su negocio, por lo que le genera muy buenas utilidades. Los primeros días de la semana no termina de vender lo preparado, pero durante los fines de semana, sus ventas se revierten y obtiene mejores ganancias. Para mas adelante piensa ampliar su negocio, y para lograrlo seguirá administrando su negocio como siempre.Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso  para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por ello se compromete en pagar todas  sus cuotas a tiempo.Luz  tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de una vitrina y varios vidrios para las mesas, pues desea  ofrecer una buena atención a sus comensales, y  de esta manera desea continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Luz, 44, is a hard-working mother who lives with her husband and three children in her mother's house. For the past 4 years she has been making and selling “salchipapas” (a typical dish made of potatoes and pieces of fried chicken) every day in the doorway of her house. She has some regular customers who like the taste of her food, and also buy from her often since her prices are reasonable. What she likes most about her job is the peace of mind it gives her because she can keep up with her housework. Her biggest worry about her business is maintaining good hygiene, and the good will of her customers because it generates a better income. In the first few days of the week she doesn't finish selling all that she has prepared, but on the weekends her sales turn around and she has higher earnings. In the future she would like to expand her business, and to succeed, she will continue running it herself as she always has. This is her first loan with MFP, and she knows that the loan will be very helpful to increase her working capital. For this reason she promises to make all her repayments on time. Luz will use the money to buy a showcase and some glass for the tables so that she can offer more to her customers, and thus her business can continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a showcase and restock her business

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila P. is from the village of Cabisera 5. She is 45 years old. Mila is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Mila owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 27 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Mila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en:
Kamila K. is 33 and married with 4 children.  She owns a business venture selling BBQ (sausages, chicken, plantains).  Kamila has 4 years of experience in this business.  Kamila needs a loan of WST $2250 to buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 800 talas or US $333 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Kamila joined SPBD in the year 2004. This is her 6th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Kamila's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy BBQ meat, ketchup, plastic plates & utensils, and coal

loans.name: Dani

texts.en:
Dani was born in 1964 and has seven children who are between 8 months and 20 years old. All his children are in school and, together with his wife, he has been able to afford to pay for their medical insurance. His wife is a farmer; he assists her at times.
 
Dani sells cattle and has done this business for 16 years. He is requesting a loan in order to buy more cattle. With the profits, he plans to pay his children’s school fees, buy food for his family and save a small amount. He also hopes to invest in his business to increase his income.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PERLAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  Margot; tiene 26 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; ella  trabaja en el mercado de Ttio en la sección de granos, ella vende granos (maíz, habas, arvejas, porotos, pallares entre otros productos secos). La socia requiere el préstamo para hacer de este un capital de trabajo, ella invertirá en la compra de variados productos secos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de granos.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Margot is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Perlas” (The Pearls), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 26 years old, in a common law marriage, and has one child. Margot works at the Ttio Market in the grains section where she sells corn, broad beans, peas, kidney beans, lima beans, and other dried products. She needs a loan to use as operating capital for buying a variety of dry goods, such as grains.

Margot appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of dry goods

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa Ayudémonos en Quechua.
Vilma es soltera y tiene 1 hija estudiante, Vilma tiene una tienda en la casa de sus padres en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, negocio que inicio hace 2 años, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar y fideos.
Los sueños de Vilma son tener una tienda grande y surtida.
texts.en:
Vilma is a member of the Yanapanakusun communal bank. In Quechua, ‘yanapanakusun’ means ‘let’s help each other’.

Vilma is single and has a daughter who is a student. She has a store in her parents’ house which she opened 2 years ago where she works every day selling general groceries, vegetables, and meats.

Vilma needs a loan of 1000 PEN for the purchase of rice, sugar, and pasta. Vilma’s dream is to have a large, well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, and pasta.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 49 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Las Delicias del distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una zona ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar en labores agrícolas, el cuenta con una pequeña extensión de terreno agrícola en el cual suele sembrar arroz, este producto es el principal cultivo de la zona y sólo allí se siembra dos veces por año, ya que en el resto de lugares se siembra sólo una vez. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

José desea adquirir algunos fertilizantes y herbicidas con los cuales planea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

El es un padre bastante entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
José is the father of a family, 49 years of age, who resides with his wife and children in the Las Delicias sector of the agricultura district of Oyotún, a zone located a hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

Since he was very young, he has been dedicated to working in agriculture.  He relies on a small extension of agricultural landin which is used to raise rice. This product is the main crop of the zone, which only there is sown two times per year.  In the rest of the area rice is sown only once per year.  With the income that he earns from this activity he settles his personal expenses and helps with the support of the family economy.  

José would like to acquire some fertilizers and herbicides with which he plans to maintain his crop.  To carry out this action he has found it convenient to request his first loan from Edpyme Alternative; a loan of 500 new soles.  

He is a good father to his family.  His greatest wish is to offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and herbicides to continue growing his crop of rice.

loans.name: Siddiqan's Group

texts.en:
Siddiqan lives in Jaranwala, which is a small city located in Punjab and is known for its agriculture industry in Pakistan. She is 54 years old and is still very active at this age. She spends her time at home doing her household responsibilities. 

She is married to G. R. who works in the field and grows rice. She has 3 sons and a daughter. All of her children left their education at an early stage and started doing work to financially support the family. 

Her eldest son is 30 years old and has a grocery store business. The next eldest son is a driver by profession, and the youngest has a poultry business.  Siddiqan has applied for a loan from a Kiva partner, Asasah, for her eldest son’s grocery store. With the loan, he will put groceries in his grocery store to increase his sales. He started this business 4 years ago, and Siddiqan is very much hopeful that by investing loan money in his business, her son will successfully be able to make his income double in size.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Siddiqan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man living with his parents and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. He has owned a car repair shop for almost 10 years. He specializes in auto body repair. He shares in the family expenses with his father. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members, and at the same time run a business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He will invest in improving his business and purchase new tools. In the future, he is looking to continue expansion of his business and to further increase his productivity. He expects that his business will continue to be successful in the coming year. He is planning to open a car spare parts shop to supplement his business in the coming year.

loans.use: To invest in improving his business and purchase new tools needed

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor  es socia del  Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y tienen  tres hijos, solo puedo estudiar la primaria pero no la concluyó.
Leonor trabaja vendiendo artesanía y combustible. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado que fue de S/.300. 00 nuevo soles, lo invirtió en la compra de una red para la pesca, actividad que dejó de lado por motivos de cambio de domicilio.
Con éste préstamo de S/  1000.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en su negocio comprando combustible.
Su sueño  es seguir y crecer en su negocio.  Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Leonor is a member of the community bank "San Salvador", located in the Capachica district in the province of Puno and department of Puno.  She is 39 years old, married, and has three children.  She was only able to go to primary school, but she didn't finish.

Leonor sells crafts and fuel.  She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevo soles, which she invested in a fishing net.  She stopped this activity when she moved.  

She is asking for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of fuel.  

Her dream is to continue and grow her business.  The thing she likes best about her community bank is the ease of getting a loan.

loans.use: Purchase fuel.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mr. Sarin Y. (shown in the photo) is 30 years old and his wife, Mrs. Chanthy Un, is 27 years old. They live in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2005 and have three sons.

Mr. Sarin Y. is a barber. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is asking for his first loan of $200 to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Susan Atieno

texts.en:
Susan Atieno Ongango is 26 years old.  She is married to Alfayo and they have four children aged between one and five years old.

Susan has a business selling milk to the people in her neighbourhood and to shops. She has been in this business for the past two years and has seen her business grow. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to buy more gallon jugs for storing the milk, and also to invest back into her business. 

Her desire is to diversify into the fish business in the future.

loans.use: Buy gallons jugs for carrying milk

loans.name: Naume

texts.en:
Naume B. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana just outside of Kampala.  She is single and has no children. Naume has a business of selling fruits and vegetables, which she has had for 1 year.  She also has a second business of outside catering. 

To help expand her business, Naume has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase vegetables, Irish and cooking oil.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Naume hopes to generate greater profits and taking care of herself.  In the future, Naume hopes to study hair dressing.      Naume is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by knowing how to sing and dance.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and oil for resale

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia D., 47, is a woman with one simple dream in life. She does not even have a high school background, but that does not imply that her dream is not big. She is married to Jerlito, a vendor, and together they are raising four children in their home in Binondo, Manila.

Letecia runs her own sari-sari (variety) store, along with a water refilling station and the daily operation of a passenger motorcycle. All three are profitable and altogether yield earnings of about PHP 11,000 per month. Letecia focuses her attention on her variety store, which is situated at their home. Having been in business for around five years now, Letecia already knows the needs of her community and responds to them by filling her store with essential food items and other products. 

To further help her grow her business, Letecia has applied for a PHP 12,000 loan. She intends to use this loan to add more products to the array of items in her store to cater to the changing needs of her customers. Also, part of the money will be invested in her water refilling station. 

Letecia admits that competition in the area gives her a headache, but she is determined not to lose hope but to remain strong and overcome the challenge. She looks forward to earning more than enough in order to be able to have her own commercial space. She dreams of having her own house and lot,  where she can enjoy the evening rest with her family. One simple dream, but never a small dream.

As a CCT community partner, she is faithfully attending weekly fellowship* meetings where she can draw strength and inspiration as a mother, a wife, and as a micro entrepreneur.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the variety store

loans.name: La Segunda Rosa Group

texts.es: En esta foto se muestra al grupo llamado LA SEGUNDA ROSA, que está ubicado en el estado de Puebla, México. El grupo esta conformado por 11 integrantes, en la fotografia se muestran los bultos de alimento para la crianza de borregos, actividad comercial a la que se dedica la Señora Angela Del Carmen S., ella tiene 67 años y estudió hasta segundo grado de primaria, es casada, su esposo es campesino y tiene 8 hijos; 3 hombres y 5 mujeres, la señora comenta  que ya tiene varios años dedicandose a este negocio, que inicio con 4 animales, y hoy ya cuenta con aproxinadamente con 45 borregos, la venta la realiza regularmete en su domicilio pues ya es conocida dentro y fuera de la localidad. Las clientas que le han comprado dicen que los borregos son muy grandes y están bien alimentados, además los da a muy buen precio. Ella está contenta con el crédito que pidió ya que le ayuda a incrementar su negocio y a destinarlo a la compra de más alimento para sus animales.
texts.en: This is a photo of the group La Segunda Rosa, or The Second Rose, which is located in Puebla, Mexico.   The group is made up of 11 members.  In the photo you'll see bags of feed used for sheep.  This is the business of Mr. Angela Del Carmen, who is 67 years old and attended school up until the second year of primary school.  Mr. Del Carmen is married to a woman from the countryside, and they have 8 children together, 3 boys and 5 girls.  Mrs. Del Carmen says they started this business with just 4 animals, and now they have 45 sheep.  They are now known far and wide for their business.  Their customers say that their sheep are very big and well fed, and that the prices are fair.   Mrs. Del Carmen is content that the loan they are requesting will help them grow their business.  They will use the money to purchase more feel for their animals.

loans.use: The money will be used to buy feed for the sheep they raise and sell

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by buying and selling Nipa, a local light roofing material. She lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Nipa business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000. Brenda is borrowing PHP 19,500 to stock up on Nipa to resell as this is usually the time people repair their roofs before the rainy season. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Brenda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team - http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines -  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Nyale

texts.en:
Nyale is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. His wife operates a tailoring business.  He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

He has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past two years, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. Nyale faces a major challenge of theft in his business.  He hopes to be able to boost his wife’s business in the future.

With the Kshs15,000 he wants to purchase a sewing machine for his wife. He decided to join Yehu because of its loan efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for his wife.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en:
Janette is a 44-year old married woman. She has three children, the oldest of whom is 27 years old. Her husband is a farmer.

Janette is also a farmer. She and her husband own and till a farm land in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. They primarily plant rice crops, which they sell to the market once harvested.

Janette is requesting a loan that she will use to purchase farm fertilizers and other inputs. Janette works hard to sustain her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm fertilizers and other inputs.

loans.name: Twifatanye Group

texts.fr: Christine N. est agricultrice de mais, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Elle a 31 ans, elle est mariée, née au Rwanda, et elle a 5 enfants entre 3 ans et 16 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école, et Christine a fini 6 ans d’école primaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 kgs de mais, location du champ, et de la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter la quantité qu’elle produit.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande agricultrice dans le secteur de Rubavu, et payer les frais d’études pour ses enfants
texts.en: Christine N. is a farmer and grows corn. She is a client of the Microfinance Institution Amasezerano Community Banking S.A since 2008. She was born in Rwanda and is a 31 year-old mother of 5 children aged between 3 and 16. 4 of her children are going to school and Christine went to middle school during 6 years.
