This loan is her first loan cycle with ACB and she will use it to buy 20 kilos of corn, to rent a land and to pay for labor. To grow the business, her strategy is to produce more. She would like to become a well known farmer in the neighborhood of Rubavu and be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy 20kg of corn, to rent a land and to pay for labor

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO-YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Vicente; el tiene 53 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ganado y también tiene negocio de transporte, ella tiene una combi que hace servicio urbano en la ruta de yanahuara y Urubamba y por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de ganados y de transporte. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para el ganado y mantenimiento para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Señor Vincente is 53 years old, married and has 3 children.  He is a member of the communal bank San Isidro-Yanahuara located in the district of Urubamba in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.  He alternates his daily activities between his business of buying and selling livestock and his transport business.  He has a combi [micro van]  that he uses to provide urban transportation services on the Yanahuara and Urubamba route.  Through these businesses he is able to provide for his children.  He wants to improve his livestock sales business and his transport business.  He is requesting a loan to purchase livestock feed and to maintain his vehicle.  He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sugar and  cosmetics to sel

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and lives with six family members. Three of the family members work.

Nasir has had a food market since 2005. He has five years of experience, a good reputation and is well known in his local area.

He is requesting $3,000 to buy a split air conditioner and to make sliding doors for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a split air conditioner and to make sliding doors for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two seats  for the barber shop

loans.name: Phu

texts.en:
Phu is a 46-year-old married man with two children. He lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. 

He and his wife have had a business weaving fabric at their house for 10 years.

He would like to receive a loan to expand their business by purchasing raw materials. 

He hopes that this will enabL. them to have more capital for their work and enough money to bring up their children.

loans.use: To more weaving materials.

loans.name: Ramiro Arnulfo

texts.es: Ramiro trabajador, casado, hijos estudian, meta que sus hijos alcance prepararse, trabajo por cuenta propia, tiene un gran trayectoria en el medio del transporte. Lo inicio con fondo propio y tiene planes de mejorar la infraestructura de su casa también expandir su negocio con la compra de otro bien vehicular para obtener mayores utilidades. El préstamo solicitado será para darle mantenimiento al vehículo mediante reparaciones de algunos repuestos.
texts.en: Ramiro is a hardworking man who is married, and his children attend school. His goal is to see his children complete their schooling and for them to work for themselves. He has a great deal of experience in the field of transportation. He started out with his own funds. He has plans to improve the infrastructure of their house and to expand his business by purchasing another car to increase his income. The loan which he requested will be used to provide maintenance to his car, especially in the form of repairs and the purchase of some spare parts.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Brigitte Gisele

texts.fr:
Cliente de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 2 et 17 ans.
Ayant obtenu son bac, après une année d'étude a l'université par manque de soutien , elle arrête ses etudes et se lance dans le commerce des grillades , tous les soirs , elle sort son  barbecue et fait ses grillades, elle vend en moyenne 25.000 a 45.000 fr par soirée.

A l'octroi de son prêt , elle va acheter 2 cartons de cuisse de poulet, 2 cartons de cotes de porcs, 2 cartons d'ailes et 1 carton de poisson de mer.

Tres entreprenante , elle use de plusieurs stratégies, la présentation de son étalage de vente,les prix de vente de ses produits font que ses produits soient très appréciés par ses potentiels clients.

A l'avenir elle en entrain de penser d'ouvrir un restaurant et avec ses benefices  venir en aide de sa famille.
texts.en: Thhe client is a 36 year old married woman, with 4 children between the ages of 2 and 17.  Having received her diploma, she studied at university for a year, but a lack of funds forced her to leave school and start up in the sale of grilled foods.  Each night, she gets out her barbecue, grills her meats, and sells them for an average revenue of 25,000 to 45,000 frs per evening.  In managing her loan, she is going to buy two boxes of chicken thighs, two boxes of pork sides, two boxes of chicken wings and one box of seafood.  A very entrepreneurial woman, she uses several selling strategies, including how she presents her food for sale and the prices of her products, which make her products very well-appreciated by potential customers.  In the future, she is in the process of thinking of opening her own restaurant and with the profits, coming to the aid of her family.

loans.use: to purchase two boxes of chicken thighs, two boxes of pork sides, and two boxes of chicken wings.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 32 years old married woman, mother of four children. She has worked in an international call center since 2009. She provides people with international phone calls, since it’s cheaper to do it from her office. Mariam works hard to improve her business in order to help her husband in increasing their income and covering their expenses. 

Mariam has requested a loan, from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner, in order to buy a juice and fruit cocktail refrigerator. She believes the refrigerator is necessary in her center to benefit from the waiting customer’s needs, since most of her customers wait their turn to make their calls. This refrigerator is an additional source of income that will help in increasing their income and improving their social and financial situation.

loans.use: to buy a new juice and cocktail refrigerator.

loans.name: Philis

texts.en:
Philis is 32 years old and married to Dennis.  They are blessed with two children.  She sells clothes and bedding.  She has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES.3,500 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES10,000 from KADET LTD., with which she plans to buy clothes and bedding for sale.  She will use the anticipated profit to expand the business.  She hopes to boost her business and be able to open a shop.

loans.use: To buy stock like clothes and bedding for sale

loans.name: La Cantera Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “La Cantera” está conformado por 18 emprendedores que se dedican al rubro del comercio, específicamente venta de ropa, preparación y venta de comida rápida, además de restaurante. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Osorno.
Myrtha  quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el segundo puesto de derecha a izquierda, usa una chaqueta color café, polera color blanco y anteojos. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio, específicamente a la venta de ropa, desde hace 6 años. Su puesto lo ubica en ferias libres, los días domingos y miércoles. Su mercadería en ropa es diversa, ya que generalmente sus productos son para todas las edades y personas.
Su mercadería usualmente la compra por encargo a su hermana quien vive en la ciudad de Santiago, ella es quien compra ropa nueva en distribuidoras y se la envía por encomienda.
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva. 
Sus metas son continuar con el negocio, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Myrtha vive junto a su hija de 20 años de edad, quien estudia en la Universidad la carrera de pedagogía. Sus sueños son esperar a que su hija termine de estudiar y se titule, para ver su tarea cumplida.
Myrtha está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad. 
Osorno es una ciudad que se ubica en la zona sur de Chile, región de Los Lagos. Es un importante centro agropecuario que se identifica como "La Patria de la Leche y Tierra de la Carne" de Chile. Dentro de su actividad agropecuaria se destaca el cultivo de trigo y avena, la crianza de ganado, para el procesamiento de carnes y lácteos además de la fabricación de equipos agrarios.
Destaca en Osorno el único estadio de fútbol techado de Chile, el Estadio Municipal "Rubén Marcos”.
texts.en:
This Communal Bank is called “La Cantera” (The Quarry) and consists of 18 entrepreneurs who engage in the retail trade, specifically selling clothes, preparing and selling fast food, and managing a restaurant. All of the members are from the city of Osorno.

In the photograph, Myrtha is seated on the first row, second from the right. She is wearing a coffee-colored jacket, a white turtleneck sweater, and eyeglasses. Myrtha has been in the retail trade, specifically selling clothes, for the past six years. Her vending stall is located at the open fair, where she sells on Sundays and Wednesdays. The merchandise that she offers varies, but generally she carries clothes for all ages and sizes. The responsibility for buying the clothes is left to her sister who lives in the city of Santiago. She buys the new garments from the distributors and then ships them through the mail. With this loan, Myrtha will buy new clothing. Her goals are to continue with her business, generate more income, and achieve a better quality of life.

Myrtha lives with her 20-year-old daughter who is a university student studying for a degree in Education. Her dreams include seeing her daughter finish her studies and receive her degree. She would love to see this task completed.

Myrtha is very pleased with and appreciative of the loan and services provided by Fondo Esperanza. In addition, she says that she feels very comfortable in the meetings and with her Communal Bank group, which has displayed generosity and unity.

Osorno is a city located in southern Chile, in Los Lagos region. It is an important agricultural center and has been given the nickname of “The Homeland of Milk and Beef” for all of Chile. The agricultural activities that take place in the area include the cultivation of wheat and oats, livestock breeding, meat and milk processing, and the manufacture of farming equipment. Osorno is also the home of the only covered soccer stadium in Chile, the Rubén Marcos Municipal Stadium.

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dory

texts.en:
Dory, 50, is a single woman who lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines.  To make a living she owns and operates a general store in her community for subsistence and to enhance her business ability. She earns about PHP 8,000 a month. Over the past 12 years, Dory has maintained good relationships with her neighborhood customers because she stocks what they need and because she is a good person.

Dory has successfully repaid two previous loans and has been a member of GDMPC since 2010.  Dory is seeking a loan of PHP 30,000 to expand her business.  She hopes to sustain her livelihood and expand her store's range of products so that she can have on hand enough money as roll-up capital.

loans.use: to increase her store's inventory.

loans.name: Grettel Yadira

texts.es:
Grettel  es una señora de 40 años de edad que vive con su esposo y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, provincia de Cartago. Es una pequeña comunidad rural de aproximadamente dos mil habitantes. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche y la agricultura. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. Cimarrón se localiza aproximadamente a hora y media en bus de Turrialba, el centro de comercio más cercano. Sin embargo, varias veces al año el camino se vuelve intransitable por las lluvias.

Desde hace varios años que Grettel ha querido mejorar su lechería, ella cuenta en estos momentos con el local para la actividad a la que se dedica, pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y el proposito es vender sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad. El proyecto le es muy interesante.

Actualmente Grettel está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de una vaca. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Grettel es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Grettel is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and son in a community called Cimarrón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in Cartago province.  This is a small rural community of around 2,000 inhabitants.  The local people work in milk production and farming.  The area has an uneven terrain and much of the land remains a humid, tropical forest.  Cimarrón is located approximately one and a half hour's bus ride away from Turrialba, the nearest trade center.  However, sometimes during the year the road becomes impassable due to rain.  

For several years, Grettel has wanted to improve her dairy.  She has the premises she needs to carry out her business but she lacks the capital needed for her business to do well.  Her goal is to sell her products to the neighbors in her community.  This project is of great interest to her.

Grettel is requesting a micro loan for 500,000 colones to buy a cow.  She hopes that this will help her to grow her business and improve both her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

Grettel is a member of the 'Nuevas Esperanzas para Cimarrón' (New Hope for Cimarrón) Community Loan Company, one of 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be her first loan and, with it, she hopes to continue growing both on a personal and financial level.  She will also take an active part in her community's loan organization.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is married and her husband has a business of selling hosiery. He sells socks and panties to different garments shops of the market and earns income. He has been in this profession for many years and his customers have good level of trust in him due to his good quality work.

Safia is a housewife who stays at her home and does her household responsibilities. She has three sons, all of whom are young and support their father in his business.

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy hosiery items in bulk to be able to fulfill his clients' demand and increase his profits.

Safia is very confident that her husband’s business will grow and she will be able to pay for the wedding of her eldest son, who is now 26 years old.

Note: In the photo, Safia is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy hosiery (socks and panties) items for selling.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Doña Maura sigue creciendo y vendiendo en su pulperia, que gracias a la buena voluntad y esfuerzo, ha logrado la estabilidad del negocio, trata de mantener al cliente sastifecho mediante la variedad de producto. De sus dos hijos uno esta trabajando como docente y el menor sigue cursando sus estudios universitarios. 
Contando con el apoyo moral y economico de su esposo quien labora en una empresa estatal del estado en servicios publicos.
Con su credito anterior, compro productos para la pulperia, pues su proposito es aumentar cada dia, ya que los  costos de la universidad de su hijo es alto , y desea apoyarlo hasta lograr el objetivo,
Hoy con su nuevo financiamiento seguira invirtiendo varios quintales de arroz, frijoles, azucar, maiz, bidon de aceite, caja de jabon de lavar ropa, de lavar traste y de uso personal, ace, productos lacteos, asi como cosmetico en desoraunte, shampoo, gillet, entre otros productos que son
texts.en:
Doña Maura continues to grow and sell in her business. Thanks to her willingness and effort, she has been able to achieve a stable business. Maura tries to keep her customers satisfied by offering a variety of products. Of her two children, one is working as a teacher while the younger one continues to finish at the university. Maura has the moral and financial support of her husband, who works at a state-owned business that provides public services.

With her previous loan, Maura bought products for her store with the intent of increasing her business each day. The cost of her son’s university is already high, so she wants to support him in this objective. Today her new loan will be invested in several “quintales” (1 quintal = 46 kg) of rice, beans, sugar, corn, drums of oil, boxes of laundry soap, dishwashing soap, body soap, detergent, dairy products, cosmetics, deodorants, shampoos, razors, and other products.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lep

texts.en:
Mrs. Lep, 65, owns a coffee shop along the street Km09, Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh. She has three children, two of whom live together with her and help work in her coffee shop when they get free time from school. She has been involved in this business since 2005.  

Since her shop has good decorations and provides free TV watching, there are many customers who come to buy and drink coffee while relaxing there. Presently her business is running well and she can yield around $5 per day. 

Mrs. Lep is requesting a loan from Kiva’s lenders in the amount of $1,000 to invest in her business. She believes that this loan will help improve her business and make more profit. With the increase in income, she’ll fix her house partially and save for future growth of her business.

loans.use: to invest in her coffee selling business.

loans.name: María Libia

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas, vive por la parroquia San Joaquín (Cuenca), este lugar se caracteriza por sus verdes campos en los cuales muestran el trabajo de su gente  siendo este un lugar de grandes producciones agrícolas, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y al comercio, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña María tiene 30 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos  de 11, 9, 5 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en el colegio y dos en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora María se dedicaba al cuidado de su hogar pero hace un mes inició  el negocio de venta de animales domésticos, trabaja de domingo a domingo en esta actividad sin horario fijo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra en su cuarto crédito y  lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para mascotas y de animales domésticos.

Su meta es tener un almacén de mascotas de raza.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresistas” (Progressive Women). She lives in the parish of San Joaquín (Cuenca), a place known for its green fields. The people who live in this area have demonstrated in their work that they are capable of large-scale agricultural production. They spend their time raising animals, farming, and engaging in trade while maintaining the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Doña María is 30 years old, married, and has four children (ages 11, 9, 5, and 3). Her oldest child is in middle school and the next two attend an elementary school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They own the house in which they live.

Sra. María devotes her time to taking care of the home, but she started one month ago a business of selling domesticated animals. She works Sunday through Sunday in this activity, but she does not have a set schedule. María is receiving her fourth loan from the Communal Bank and will invest in the purchase of clothing for pets and domesticated animals. Her goal is to have a pet store.

loans.use: to buy clothing for pets and domesticated animals.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Maria Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Armandina tiene 57 años D. edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos que son independientes. Tiene 2 años con Edaprospo - Prosperidad y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes como azúcar, leche, arroz y otros; tiene 10 años en este negocio y comenzó con la venta D. pan que muy posteriormente se fue incrementando; también se dedica a la venta D. hielos desD. hace 8 años, hasta el momento ya ha logrado construir su casa y comprarse algunos artefactos. Los gastos que cubren sus ingresos están destinados a las necesidades del hogar y ahorros.

Su plan para el futuro es seguir trabajando en su bodega y comprarse electrodomésticos para su casa. Piensa usar el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería para su negocio; ella pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Las Rosas D. María” con el cual tiene 2 años y que esta conformado por 7 personas, que se formó tras un acuerdo entre sus vecinos que necesitaban D. un préstamo, el nombre lo pusieron debido a que la mayoría del grupo estaba conformada por mujeres. Ella lleva 1 años como presidenta.
texts.en:
Armandina is 57 years old. She is single and has two grown children. She has been with Edaprospo - Prosperidad for 2 years, and she sells groceries like sugar, milk, rice and other items. Armandina has been in this business for ten years; she began by selling bread and much later began expanding. She has also sold ice for eight years. Armandina has managed to build her house and buy some items for it. Her income covers her household needs and goes toward savings.

Her plan for the future is to keep working in her grocery store and buy some household appliances for her house. She is thinking of using the loan to buy merchandise for her business. She belongs to the “Las Rosas D. María” (Mary's Roses) communal bank, which has seven members, and she has been one of the members for two years. The communal bank was formed after Armandina's neighbors agreed that they needed a loan. They chose the group's name based on the fact that most of the group members were women. Armandina has been the president for one year.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise for her business.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso se unieron con ganas de salir adelante y con un gran espíritu de superación. Todas son muy sacrificadas, luchan para la estabilidad de sus familias, ya que son mujeres jefas de familia, que tienen a su cargo mantener su hogar.
Una de las miembros del grupo es la señora Honorina, quien se dedica a la manicura. Ella comenta que tiene mucho trabajo, pues tiene muchos clientes que siempre le solicitan sus servicios. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora, emprendedora y por sobre todo muy luchadora. Ella lucha diariamente por mantener a su familia y darles un mejor estilo de vida.
Ella solicita la ayuda de fundación paraguaya y de kiva para la compra de esmaltes para uñas, limas, y demás productos e insumos para su trabajo. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Fifteen women from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joined together with the desire to get ahead and with a great spirit of self improvement.  They are all very self-sacrificing; they strive for their families’ stability since they are women heads of household who are charged with supporting their homes.

One of the group members is Honorina who is a manicurist.  She comments that she has a lot of work because she has many customers who always seek out her services.  She defines herself as a very hardworking, enterprising and, above all, tenacious woman.  She strives daily to support her family and give them a better standard of living.

She is asking for help from Fundación Paraguaya and from Kiva to buy nail polish, emery boards and other products and supplies for her work.  She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to buy manicure supplies.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 29 years old and married with three children. She lives in Hioma, Uganda, where she runs a retail shop selling soap, sugar and salt. She has been in this business for three years.

She is faced with the challenge of price fluctuations and inflation. Her business goal is to expand her business into new markets, and her personal goal is to educate her children.

Judith wants a loan to buy soap, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, salt and sugar for sale

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar los materiales necesarios para su nueva siembra, comprara abono y fertilizantes, ya que tiene una milpa de riego por eso está interesado en los materiales para fortalecer la plantación. 
Estos préstamos le han ayudado para mejorar junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto needs another loan to buy necessary materials for his new planting. He will buy compost and fertilizers because he has an irrigated cornfield and he wants materials to strengthen his crop. 

These loans have helped him and his family to make improvements.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace cooks plain rice and serves it with tomato sauce, macaroni, fried fish and hot pepper sauce (shito) at Ayensudo, near Elmina, which she has done for 15 years. She is a widow. As a single parent, Grace is responsible for clothing, feeding and paying her children’s school fees and other household expenses. Grace will use the loan to purchase rice, tomatoes, cooking oil and so on. She anticipates reinvesting the new profit.

loans.use: to purchase rice, tomatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar de 22 años es un joven soltero. Vive en la casa de sus padres con sus hermanos en la comunidad nativa de Pucharini en el distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo. Edgar trabaja en las tierras de sus padres. A su edad demuestra destreza en las labores agrícolas. Siembra café, plátanos y algo de yuca para su consumo personal. De su esfuerzo recibe una parte de la producción para iniciar su independencia.
Desde los 18 años trabaja impulsado por sus intereses de autosuperación. “Empecé alquilando un carro, y hacia servicio de transporte de Pichanaki y La Merced”, comenta.
Ahora realiza la misma ruta y viceversa pero con su propio auto, que logró adquirir gracias a estos años de trabajo.  Esta actividad es rentable, los días buenos gana de 80 a 100 soles muy aparte de la inversión en combustibles. 
Ahora sus metas son mayores. Está ahorrando para construirse una casa propia y consolidar su independencia, por el momento apoya con trabajo y económicamente a sus padres y hermanos. Es un joven ejemplar. Éste sería su primer préstamo de MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Los Caciques de Menkoremón”, es el nombre de su reciente grupo comunal. Se siente contento de pertenecerlo.
De obtener el dinero, podrá pagar el servicio de los jornaleros que trabajarán en sus tierras, pagará el mantenimiento de su vehículo y comprará un poco de combustible.
texts.en:
Edgar, 22, is a single young man. He lives in his parents’ house with his siblings in his hometown Pucharini, in the Perené district, Chanchamayo province. Edgar works on his parents’ land. At his age, he demonstrates skill in farming work. He sows coffee, plantains and some yucca for his personal consumption. For his effort, he receives a portion of the crops to start his independence.

Since he was 18, he has worked driven by interest in self-improvement. “I started renting a car and doing transportation service from Pichanaki and La Merced,” he comments.

Now he drives the same routes, but he uses his own car, which he was able to purchase thanks to his years of work. This activity is profitable. On good days, he earns from 80 to 100 Peruvian soles, apart from the investment in fuel.

His goals are larger now. He is saving to build himself a house and become more independent. For the moment, he supports his parents and siblings financially and by working. He is an exemplary young man. This will be his first loan through MFP so he has taken the responsibility of being punctual in making his repayments. “Los Caciques de Menkoremón” is the name of his new communal bank. He feels pleased to belong to it.

When he gets the money, he will be able to pay the day laborers who will work in his fields, pay for maintenance for his vehicle and purchase some fuel.

loans.use: to hire day laborers, do maintenance on his vehicle and purchase fuel.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Nueva Esperanza" ha culminado el 2do ciclo sin ningún tipo de inconvenientes por lo que han decidido avanzar  al tercer ciclo, contando actualmente con quince  integrantes.  Al igual que los demás comités, las integrantes son mujeres muy sacrificadas, y de escasos recursos, con muy pocas oportunidades de trabajar, pero gracias al apoyo que le está brindando la Fundación, a través de las capacitaciones, han logrado aumentar sus ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las miembros es la señora Elvira, quien se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y es gracias a este trabajo que ella ha podido ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen en la casa. Ella nos dice que  su meta es seguir trabajando y de esa forma poder seguir manteniendo a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, y de esa forma poder estar abastecida para poder tener más stock para poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) committee has finished its second cycle problem-free so has decided to advance to the third cycle currently with 15 members.  Like the other committees, the members are very self-sacrificing women of scarce resources with few opportunities for work.  But thanks to support from the Fundación through the training they’ve managed to increase their income thus helping their families.

One of the group members is Elvira who sells pork.  Thanks to this work she’s been able to help her family cover expenses that arise daily at home.  She tells us that her goal is to continue working in order to continue to support her family.

She is asking for the loan to buy pork to have better stock to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy pork to resell.

loans.name: Sedekon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEDEKON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Agbalè Jeanne, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 48 ans est mariée à un maçon du nom de Casimir. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Agbalè Jeanne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Agbalè Jeanne et son mari. Agbalè Jeanne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Agbalè Jeanne vend des vivres depuis une trenaine d’années. Agbalè Jeanne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Agbalè Jeanne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEDEKON un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 54 years old, married, and has two children to provide for. To earn a living she works as a farmer, running a corn production business together with her husband.

She wants to improve their family living condition, so she must increase her income. Therefore, she borrowed a loan to buy fertilizer for the corn farm so that she can harvest plenty of corn and deliver it to the market that will generate more income.

Maria Fe's plan for the future is to save money for the education needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn farm.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 26 years old. She is married with 2 children. 

She has had a retail business for 4 years and it has been profitable. 

She has requested for a loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will be using the loan to purchase eggs and onions and hopes this will help him to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are expand her business to mini-supermarket.

loans.use: eggs and onions

loans.name: Emil

texts.en: Emil K. has been a military man for more than 20 years. After the reorganization of the Bulgarian army He was dismissed and the only way to look after his family was to start own business. Three years ago there was an auction for the old store building in Emil’s native village. So he got the contract and made this building a nice grocery store – the only one in the village. Now it is his business and he runs it with the support of his wife. Emil K. needs some financial help to supply some goods for his store. The amount is $ 120.

loans.use: To supply some goods for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beatrice Waiyego would like to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Chey

texts.en:
Mrs. Chey P. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and 7 children in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a small farm growing a variety of vegetables and rice crops and make around $4/day in revenue. 3 of her children work at a garment factory and help in financing the family with their salary. The others are students.
P. is requesting the loan to purchase more seeds, insecticide and fertilizer for her crop growing. In the future, if she has enough money, she would like to own a grocery store, from which she hopes to make additional income to send the children to a university.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds, insecticide and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina M., a divorced mother of two, is the treasurer of the Estrellas de Mar association, of Villa Adela and a street vendor who earns her living making pastries: pan dulces, masitas, cookies, cakes, etc. She makes the pastries herself and then sells them at sports centers, plazas and parks in the area so that she can try and help herself and her children get ahead.

Cristina used to work at a company that exported broad beans but after a gall bladder illness, she had to leave the job. She subsequently worked at making traditional vicuna blankets but because her health was fragile, she wasn’t able to continue. Back pains and some heart problems forced her to change her line of work so she taught herself the art of the pastry shop.

Cristina now needs capital so that she can buy an industrial oven that will allow her to increase her production, improve her earnings and get ahead with her two children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Cristina M., divorciada y madre de 2 hijos, es tesorera de la asociación Estrellas de Mar, de Villa Adela, se dedica a la repostería, pan dulce, masitas, galletas, queques, productos que ella misma prepara y que luego deambula por los centros deportivos, plazas y parques de la zona, con lo cual trata de salir adelante en compañía de sus hijos.

Anteriormente, Cristina trabajaba en una empresa de exportación de habas, pero a consecuencia de una complicación vesicular, tuvo que dejar el trabajo. Posteriormente se dedico a la confección artesanal de mantas de vicuña, pero la fragilidad de su salud no le permitió seguir, ya que los dolores de espalda y algunas dolencias pulmonares, la obligaron a cambiar de rubro y aprender autodidácticamente el arte de la repostería.

Actualmente Cristina necesita de capital para poder comprar un horno industrial que le permita incrementar su producción, de esta manera intentar mejorar sus ingresos y salir adelante con sus dos hijos.

loans.use: Cristina needs capital so that she can buy an industrial oven that will allow her to increase her production, improve her earnings and get ahead with her two children.

loans.name: Felisia

texts.en:
Felisia is 26 years old and has a three-year-old daughter who is just starting preschool. She lives with her husband and her baby in her husband´s mother´s house. -The name of her Colmado (convenience store) is ¨La Flor de Montecristi¨. At her store she sells products such as rice, cooking oil, salsa, soap, and detergent.

This is the second loan Felisia has requested from Esperanza. She successfully paid back the first loan of 5000 pesos (150 USD), using her profits to further invest in her business.

Felicia buys her items from the neighboring town of El Seybo and sells them to people in her community . With her small business earnings, she wants to continue to put her child through school and eventually have her own house with her family. She wants to be able to live comfortably.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her small convenience store

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Mrs. Iyabo A. is 38 years old, married and has 4 children; she is from the Mushin area in  Lagos State. She buys paper from printing presses which she then sells to other companies that are into tissue paper.  She has been doing this business since the year 2002 and she needs the loan of $400 to buy more paper for sale.

loans.use: To buy more tissue paper for sale

loans.name: Inon

texts.id:
Inon could see a good business prospect in Bali. The construction workers need to consume more drink. She saw many construction workers in her neighborhood in Bali. Since 2 years ago, she started selling soft drink and juice drinks. The selling place that she chose is quite strategic because many construction workers work near the area. The fruits (for the juice drinks) are bought in Badung market and Anyar Sari market. The bottled and canned drinks are ordered from a drink supplier. Her profit is Rp 50,000 (about $5.3) per day. Besides putting it into the saving, she also use the profit to add more merchandise and to cover her daily expenses which are the house/shop rent fee and living expenses of Rp 20,000 (about $2) per day.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Inon melihat prospek yang bagus di Bali. Pekerja proyek memerlukan lebih banyak cairan. Sedangkan pekerja proyek di Bali sudah menjadi pemandangan yang akrab. Sejak 2 tahun yang lalu dia menekuni Usaha Jual Minuman dan Aneka Juice. Tempat yang dia pilih cukup strategis, karena banyak pekerja proyek yang bekerja di sekitar tempat usahanyanya. Buah – buah untuk bahan membuat juice ia beli di Pasar Badung dan di Pasar Anyar Sari. Sedangkan minuman botol dan kaleng diantar oleh suplier minuman. Dari keuntungan Rp 50.000,00/hari yang diperoleh selain untuk ditabung juga dipakai untuk menambah barang dagangan dan biaya sehari – hari. Biaya kontrak ruko sebagai tempat tinggal sekaligus tempat usaha dan biaya hidup per hari sebesar Rp 20.000,00 termasuk dalam pengeluaran rutinnya.

loans.use: To add more merchandise

loans.name: Abu

texts.en:
Abu S. is 28 years old and married with 2 children.  He owns a shop in Kabala town; most of the goods are purchased on credit and repayments made to the merchant on a daily basis .  This does not yield good profits for S..  He supplements his income with tailoring, as he is a professional tailor.  

Using previous loans, S. is slowly building his own capital; he is now requesting another loan to enable him to continue building his capital because he will be able to make repayments on a monthly basis, allowing him to increase his income.

loans.use: To build capital to allow him to avoid purchasing on credit and start realizing a profit.

loans.name: Luzinga East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Lydia S.. She is currently in the business of operating a grocery store and is requesting a loan to add to the business. Lydia is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 2 children aged 3 and 5 and her children go to school. Each week, Lydia makes approximately UGX 15000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and build larger premises for her business. Lydia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Lydia is joined in her small group by Florence M., Margret B. and Zaituni W.. Florence M. has a business running a grocery store and wants to boost business. Margret B. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to add more stock. Zaituni W. operates a grocery store business and wants to boost business.

loans.use: To add stock to grocery store

loans.name: Espirita

texts.es:
Espirita has belonged to the Agua Viva communal bank for 2 years.

She is married, is 23-years-old, and has 2 children of 5 and 2 years. Espirita and her husband have a car, which they use to provide urban transportation in the city of Ayacucho. Espirita sometimes works as a collector. Espirita tells us that she used to sell vegetables as a street vendor.

Espirita needs a loan of 2000 soles, money which will be invested in the maintenance of her car.

She will using her savings to build her house and to pay for the education of her children.

Espirita's dreams are to have her own home, to buy another car, and to educate her children so they will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Espirita pertenece al Banco Comunal Agua Viva hace 2 años. Espirita es conviviente, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos de 5, 2 años, Espirita junto a su esposo tienen un carro que realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho, Espirita algunas veces es cobradora. Espirita cuenta que anteriormente vendía verduras de manera ambulante.

Espirita necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento mecánico de su carro.

Sus ahorros lo utilizará para construir su casa y para la educación de sus hijos.

Los sueños de Espirita son tener casa propia, comprar otro carro más, educar a sus hijos y sean profesionales.

loans.use: Espirita needs a loan of 2000 soles, which will be invested in the maintenance of her car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: EXPAND BUSINESS

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
Norma Isabel belongs to the Las Almendras community bank, located at Jirón 29 D. Mayo, Mz. 200G, Lt. 25 in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 61 years old and the mother of 4 children. Her husband is a fisherman, but since his income is not enough to support the family, Norma, with the first loan she received from Manuel Ramos, decided to invest in land mollusks and vegetables for resale.

She currently has a stand in the La Hoyada market, where she goes early every day to sell mollusks to clients who anxiously wait to have breakfast and to buy her vegetables, which are in demand for preparing the area´s regional dishes. With another loan which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy: corn, peanuts, fish fillets, paiche (a local freshwater fish) and vegetables.

Norma is happy with the loans she has received as they have allowed her to solve her financial needs and to give a better standard of living to her family, which is the most important thing for her.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Norma Isabel pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Almendras, ubicado en el, Jr. 29 D. Mayo Mz. 200G Lt. 25, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 61 años, es madre D. 4 hijos, su esposo es pescador, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuenta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Norma con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en la venta D. hupe y verduras.

En la actualidad tiene un puesto D. venta en el mercado D. la Hoyada donD. acuD. todos los días muy temprano para poder vender su hupe a sus caseritos que esperan con ansias para tomar su desayuno y comprar sus verduras que tiene mucha demanda en nuestra comida regional. Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará: maíz, maní, hoja D. pescado, paiche y verduras.

Norma con los préstamos recibidos se siente feliz por que tiene como solucionar sus necesidades económicas, dar mejor calidad D. vida para su familia, que son lo mas importante para ella.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare her food products

loans.name: Believe In God Group

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is the Believe In God group leader. She has been with SMT for three years and is one its honest and hard working clients. Mariatu is 30 years old and married with 4 children. Her children's upkeep depends mainly on her business income. Mariatu's husband is a teacher whose salary is insufficient to meet all the family needs. Mariatu's business supplements the family income.

Adamsay and Wulamatu also sell clothes. Alhaji H T. sells cooking utensils. The goup is requesting a loan of Le.4000000 to increase their inventory stock.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of clothes and cooking utensils

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir owns a successful car repair business in Novomoskovsk, Central Ukraine. He has a small repair shop in a good, visible location where each day he works on vehicles fixing different problems. Vladimir is married and has 4 kids. His business provides an important source of income for him. He currently makes around $1000 in a typical month.

Vladimir has been in this business for 15 years. He has requested a short term express loan of 1000 Ukrainian Grivnas to add to his working business capital and help purchase new car parts. He hopes to increase his client base and profitability. Vladimir is hoping to expand his business and generate additional income to invest in his younger son’s medical treatment. The boy was paralyzed following a stroke and needs special treatment and expensive medication.

Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid in one month.

loans.use: To purchase new car parts and expand repair business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. sells fish alongside ladies' wear. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Mary and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih A. D. is 33 years old, single, and lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. For a living, Rabih owns a store where he sells drinking water for the neighborhood. In Lebanon, tap water is not potable so generally people choose to purchase large containers of bottled water from their locA. markets and refill them at locA. shops.

Due to consistent electricity troubles, there are usually at least 3 hours each day without power, and Rabih has requested a loan of US$ 500 to buy a small generator. This will allow him to continuously run the pump system which fills customers' large water containers. This is the third time Rabih will be working with A. Majmoua. His previous two loans were each repaid on time.

loans.use: To purchase a small generator for power outages

loans.name: Nazir

texts.en:
Nazir T. is 26 years old. Nazir began earning income selling seasonal vegetables when he was 17 years old by helping his dad. After a while, he began working at other jobs, but realized that his work wasn't bringing in enough income to cover the expenses of his family. Therefore, Nazir decided to independently re-engage in the seasonal vegetable sales business. Gradually, he is becoming known in the area, however, he still needs additional capital to purchase vegetables for sale, given the high demand during the current season. 

Nazir is asking for a loan of US$1200 to buy additional vegetables for sale and thus earn more profit. Nazir plans to use the additional income to help his children move forward in completing their studies. He is thankful to everyone for their support.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Balimaya (Convivialité) Group

texts.fr:
Avec une activité très diversifiée (vente d’huile d’arachide, de cigarettes, de pagne wax tissus très prisés en Afrique de l’ouest, de condiments alimentaires et de produits de beauté) les cinq femmes du groupe Balimaya ont une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans, 03 enfants et vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe) et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 5 sacs d’oignons, 14 pièces de pagne Wax, 50 habits pour enfants, 2 cartons de pommade pour le corps, 5 caisses tomate,  2 bidons d’huile d’arachide, 10 paquets de cigarette de qualités différentes, 10 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquets de chiw-gum, 20 paquets d’allumette, etc. La ville de Sikasso et les localités environnantes sont leurs principales sources d’approvisionnement .
Les marchandises sont vendues au grand marché et à domicile en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et des jeunes.
texts.en:
Having a very diversified business selling peanut oil, cigarettes, Wax pagnes (highly-prized cloth in West Africa), condiments, and beauty products, the five women of the group Balimaya average 24 years of age and three children. They live in large, traditional, extended families in the Médine district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).

The group members are on their sixth solidarity loan (group loan), and all the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy: 5 sacks of onions, 14 lengths of 'Wax' pagnes, 50 outfits for children, 2 boxes of body ointment, 5 cases of tomatoes, 2 drums of peanut oil, 10 packets of cigarettes of different grades, 10 packets of candy, 10 packets of chewing gum, 20 packets of matches, etc. The city of Sikasso and the surrounding towns are their principal sources of supplies. The merchandise is sold retail, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed generally of women and youngsters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different goods for small-scale commerce, such as peanut oil, cigarettes, Wax pagnes, condiments, and beauty products

loans.name: Stefany Paola

texts.es:
Stefany es secretaria en una empresa de seguridad física, vive con sus padres en alquiler
Es soltera y requiere el crédito para la compra de una computadora Pentium IV ya que le servirá de gran manera para realizar sus practicas ya que al siguiente año ingresará a la universidad.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, las ganas de superarse a nivel laboral y académico le dan la oportunidad para que pueda acceder a este crédito
texts.en:
Stefany is a secretary in a physical security company and living with her parents in a rental. She is single and needs a loan to buy a Pentium IV computer which will help her in a big way to finish her work placement so that she can enter the university. This is the first time she has requested credit, her desire to improve her work and academic level giving her the opportunity to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer

loans.name: Oscar Ruperto

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Oscar Ruperto M. se dedica a su actividad de agricultura dedicándose al cultivo de plátanos los cuales son vendidos en su casa de habitación en el municipio de El Viejo siendo visitado por varios clientes que le compran los plátanos y en ocasiones hasta clientes que no son del municipio.

Ceprodel le ha apoyado grandemente porque le ha beneficiado con créditos que los ha utilizado en la compra de insumos para la ganadería y hoy en día solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de una bomba para riego de la siembra. Con este crédito se beneficiara porque comprará una bomba de riego para el cultivo de plátano.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Viejo, of the city of Chinandega, Oscar Ruperto M. cultivates plantains, which are sold in his house in the municipality of El Viejo. Many customers buy his plantains, sometimes even people who are not from the municipality. Ceprodel has helped him a lot because he has benefited from loans that he has used to buy supplies for cattle, and now he is requesting a new loan to buy a sprayer tank for plants. With this loan he will benefit because he will buy a sprayer tank for cultivating plantains.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sprayer tank

loans.name: Quvat

texts.ru: Адинаев Куват житель одного из отдаленных кишлаков города Яван.Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Работает в средней школе -учителем начальных классов. Кроме того , занимается животноводством. Каждую неделю в четверг и в воскресенье ходит на рынок , где покупает и перепродает бычков. Кредит запрашивает для того. чтобы увеличить товарооборот и таким образом получить большую прибыль. Это улучшит его финансовое положение . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Quvat O. lives in a village on the outskirts of Yavan. He is married and has six children. He works as a elementary school teacher, and raises cattle as a sideline. Every week on Thursday and Sunday he goes to market where he buys and sells cattle. He is requesting a loan in order to increase turnover and, as a result, profits. This will improve his financial position. He will be able to repay the loan within 18 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
“I hope to give my children their desired education someday”, Mercedes said. An industrious wife and mother to her three children, Mercedes is into the poultry business. She came up with this kind as her way of helping her husband in providing the daily needs of their family.

Mercedes is 38-years-old and always has always hoped that despite their poor living conditions, they may able to send all her children to school so they have the opportunity to become successful. Her husband, Nicholas, is working as a part-time carpenter. Their children are: Micheal Nick, 5, who is already in kindergarten; Beverly, 13, is a sophomore in high school; and Shane Janeth,16, is a senior in high school.

Mercedes is requesting a loan for $100 (PHP 4,000.00). This is the simplest way for Mercedes to raise additional capital for her small business. She will use the amount to purchase additional chicks and some products like “balot” and vegetables to sell in their village. This amount will greatly help her in maintaining her vending business and in assisting her husband generate income for their family. Her goal in life is to work hard and be patient despite the difficulties that life may bring. She believes that in the end, something good will happen.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Edina has been a retail woman in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 12 years. She belongs to Tushikamane group loan (Group code 2006).Every day she works at her business. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more commodities for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Edina is 42 years old, married, and has four children: ages 22, 18, 13 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business

loans.name: Abdoulaye Dioume

texts.fr: Abdoulaye Dioume M. est un forgeron depuis dix ans qui fabrique des marmites pour les vendre.  Il habite au quartier cité Keur Dago de Thiès, et il est marie.  Ce prêt lui permet d’avoir un fond de roulement pour pouvoir faire face à la forte demande de ses clients.  Monsieur M. a déjà reçu deux crédits auprès de l’IMCEC et il les a bien remboursée.  Les revenus de son entreprise lui permettent d’entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye Dioume M. has been a blacksmith for ten years, making and selling saucepots. He lives in the Keur Dago neighborhood in Thiès, and he is married. This loan will enable him to have a working capital, in order to meet strong customer demand. Mr. M. already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner IMCEC, which were repaid without problems. The profits of his business enables him to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have a working capital for his business

loans.name: Tahmena Group

texts.en:
Tahmena is the group leader of Tahmena group. There are five members in this group. Each of them would like to take a loan for their own business. The total of their group loan is 50000Af.

Tahmena and Mastora want to take a loan for their business of bead working, to purchase more materials for their business. Bibi Layla and Zynab want to take a loan for their business of knitting, to buy necessary materials for their business. Ghallam Sarwer wants to take a loan for his business, a general store, because he wants to make his shop larger.           

With this loan they can enlarge their businesses, support their families and make a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: They want to buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a woman who tries her best to give her family a better life. She sells different items and commodities that she buys in the market. She roams house to house and even visits different agencies and institutions just to sell her products. She is requesting a loan of PHP10,000.00 as additional working capital for her business, so that she can buy products to sell and increase her income. She believes that if she has more products she can earn more profit.

Her family lives peacefully in Barangay Minanga Sur Iguig, Cagayan. She is already a widow and strives hard to support her family's immediate needs. Her children are Carlota, 44 years old and Rodrigo, 41 years old, and they are both married and have their own families. Estelita works patiently to support the needs of her children and to provide a good education for her grandchildren. She hopes that her loan request will be granted to further expand her selling business.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Barbara's Group

texts.en:
Barbara S. is the leader of the Kisimba group in Lugazi. She is 29 years old and married with three children, aged between five and ten years. She also cares for five more dependents.

Barbara is a determined and hard-working lady with a grocery business. She has sold farm produce for five years in the Najja trading centre. This is her third loan with the group and she is happy that the loans have helped her increase her stock and maintain it, even in instances where she has to repay her loan. She plans to own a well-stocked grocery with nothing missing. With her determination, she believes she will achieve it.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce for her store.

loans.name: Juana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Con mucho entusiasmo y dedicación en su negocio, la señora Juana C. se dedica a su negocio de venta de verduras como tomates, chiltomas, cebollas, entre otros vendidas en el mercado Central de Chinandega.

Ella hoy en día ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las verduras y así salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo para su desarrollo en el mercado. Con el crédito que reciba la señora Juana, se beneficiará grandemente junto con su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana C. makes a living selling vegetables such as tomatoes, peppers, and onions in the central market of Chinandega. She is very dedicated and enthusiastic about her business. Juana is now seeking support from Kiva partner Ceprodel in the form of a loan, which she will use to purchase vegetables so that she can get ahead in her business. Both Juana and her business would benefit greatly from the loan she is requesting, and she asks for your support to develop her business in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables for her business

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es: Jesús tiene 40 años, es un hombre responsable que trabaja muy duro, hace 15 años vive con su pareja y madre de sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 22 años se dedica al cultivo de plátanos, café y frutos cítricos, pero lo que más le agrada es el café, por serle más rentable; aunque demora de 2 a 3 años y requiere de mucha inversión hasta lograr que fructifique de manera uniforme para recién iniciar la recolección. Cada vez que su chacra de café está a punto de cosechar se llena de regocijo, puesto que es el momento de acumular ganancias con las que cubre los gastos de comestibles y prendas de vestir para todos sus hijos. Jesús también trabaja en otras chacras como jornalero y muchos de sus vecinos prefieren darle el trabajo a él, por ser muy eficiente, dejando los terrenos muy limpios, por lo que le pagan entre 15 a 17 soles diarios; y esto es de mucha valía en su economía durante el tiempo que no tiene cosechas. Mediante su trabajo, Jesús espera adquirir otros terrenos cultivables en aras de mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su 5to crédito con MFP, durante los cuatro ciclos anteriores ha demostrado cumplir puntualmente cada uno de sus pagos. En su banco comunal no tiene ningún cargo, pero algunas veces se encarga de pasar los comunicados de su asesor de crédito al resto de los integrantes. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de 10 sacos de fertilizantes para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Jesus is 40 years old. He is a responsible, hard-working man. For fifteen years he has lived with his partner and the mother of his five children in their own house. For 22 years he has been growing bananas and citrus fruit, but what he prefers to grow is coffee, as it is more profitable, even though it takes 2 to 3 years to mature and requires a lot of effort to ensure that it grows uniformly, in order to start harvesting it. Every time his coffee crop is ready to be harvested he is very happy because this is the time to earn money, which covers food and clothing expenses for all his children. Jesus also works on other farms as a day laborer, and many of his neighbors prefer to give him work because he is very efficient, leaving the fields very clean. For this reason they pay him between 15 and 17 soles a day. This is very valuable to him at the times when he has nothing to harvest. Through his work, Jesus hopes to acquire additional arable land in order to improve his quality of life. This is his fifth loan from MFP. During the four previous cycles he has made his payments on time. He does not have a position in his communal bank, but sometimes he is responsible for passing messages from the lender on to the other members. The money he is requesting will be used to purchase 10 bags of fertilizer for his coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.en:
T. Abdullojon has been working on cattle raising business since 1999. He has been able to support his family and his 4 grown children. Almost all of his children are married and have their own family. Abdullojon is requesting this loan in order to purchase cows to increase his cattle inventory. He is supported by his younger son who works with him taking care of the cattle. His dream is to increase his current inventory and, that way, to improve his family's living standards. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle.

loans.name: Olushola

texts.en: Olushola is 42 years old and married with four children. He sells engine oil. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more engine oil to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil to sell

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
L. Oyun is a 37-year-old businesswoman who lives with her husband and three children in Arkhangai Province in Central Mongolia. Her oldest son and daughter both attend a local secondary school, but her youngest son has not yet reached school age. 

Oyun operates a small butcher shop in her town where she sells meat to local residents from a stall at the local market. Her husband, who works as a stoker, helps in his free time. Oyun started her business in 2000 with capital of 300,000 tugrugs (approx. $207 USD). Because of her hard work and strong customer service skills, her business has been successful and her current business capital exceeds 1,300,000 tugrugs (approx. $898 USD).  In the future, she hopes to open a second stall in the market to expand her business.  

She says, "I would like to have my own workplace and fund my children's education."  She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 tugrugs to purchase more meat.

loans.use: To purchase more whole animal meats

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 36 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive con sus hijos; Fernando de 11 y Alexander de 12 años de edad. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en el taller que tiene en su casa. Ella vive sola con sus hijos y esto le demandad mucho tiempo, ya que están en edad escolar y necesitan mucho de su apoyo y consejo. Es por ello que un trabajo en su casa le pareció mucho más adecuado, pero no significa que sea más fácil, pues necesita de gran precisión a la hora de elaborar los pedidos, que son en gran cantidad y muchas veces no puede abastecerse sola para acaparar con todo, es por ello que tiene que pedir ayuda. Pero Inés ha sabido sobrellevar este tipo de obstáculos porque sabe que si sigue trabajando con mucho empeño podrá tener en el futuro un taller más grande y así brindarle un futuro mejor a su familia. Es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, ella es muy puntual y responsable con todos sus pagos, al igual que lo fue en su grupo, ahora solicita un préstamo individual. Con este dinero comprará mayor cantidad de tela, entre otros materiales, para elaborar mayor cantidad de prenda, según sus últimos pedidos.
texts.en:
Inés is 36 years old. She is a hard worker and lives with her children, 11 year old Fernando and 12 year old Alexander. Six years ago she started manufacturing clothing in work space located in her home. She lives alone with her children, who take up a lot of her time since they are school age and need a lot of support and advice. They are the reason why she works at home as she felt this was best. However, it is not easy to work at home as she needs to dedicate a lot of time to make the clothing her customers order. Since she has a large volume of orders there are times when she cannot fulfill them and has to ask for help. Inés has been able to overcome these challenges because she realizes that through her hard work and dedication she will eventually have a larger manufacturing shop and will therefore be able to build a brighter future for her family. This is her fourth loan from MFP. She is very responsible with her payments and makes them on time, just as she did when she participated in group loans. She has asked for an individual loan this time. The money will go toward buying material in larger quantities, in addition to other items. This will allow her to make more clothing and fulfill the most recent orders from her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing material

loans.name: So

texts.en: Sở Thị Đỗ was born in 1964. ( id: 010103060031). She lives in Ly Nhan, Duc Tu, Dong Anh, Ha Noi with her husband and two children. Her children are students in the university. Her husband is a soldier in army. He retired. Mr Sở takes part in social activities in her village. She raises chicken and pigs. Her family has a monthly income of about 4.000.000 VND. She wants to borrow 4.142.000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha J. is currently in the business of selling maize  and shorgum  and is requesting a loan to purchase rice and pulses.  Asha is 32 years old and is Married with a husband that is a business man. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase rice and pulses to sell

loans.name: Elga

texts.es:
Elga es una persona muy alegre, tiene 38 años y comparte su vida con su esposo y sus dos hijos en su acogedora casa, la cual gracias a sus esfuerzos es propia. Ella ha sido educada en un hogar lleno de amor, lo cual ha trascendido actualmente, ya que ahora al conformar su propia familia les brinda todo lo que sus padres le enseñaron y dieron; es así que llena de cariño a sus hijos y esposo, quienes son su adoración. Ella se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de productos de belleza, ya que tiene grandes cualidades para convencer a la gente, pues es muy carismática. Además de ello, vende lencería fina, la cual ofrece a sus amigas y parientes obteniendo buenos ingresos gracias a su vitalidad, pues cuando realiza su trabajo piensa que debe realizarlo de la mejor manera como todo lo que emprende.

En un futuro, Elga quiere mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio, ya que éste le permite dedicarse a su hogar y a sus hijos, además de estar cerca de su madre, de la cual siempre está pendiente ya que es su fuente de inspiración.

Este en su primer préstamo con MFP y nos dice que al igual que su madre, ella piensa que la responsabilidad es lo más importante así que no tiene problemas con la puntualidad en los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita mejorará su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de productos de belleza y lencería para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Elga is a cheerful person who is 38 years old and spends her life with her husband and their two children. Thanks to their efforts, her family owns their cozy home. Elga grew up in a household filled with love, which now transcends to her own family in which she tries to share everything her parents taught her. As a result, she adores her children and her husband and showers them with full affection.

Elga has been selling beauty products for the past 2 years. Due to her charismatic personality, she has become good in convincing people to buy her merchandise. In addition, she sells lingerie and offers her products to friends and relatives. Thanks to her vitality and attitude to strive for the best in everything she does, Elga has been able to generate good earnings. In the future, she would like to improve and expand her business. This would allows her to spend more time at home being a mother to her children, who serve as her inspiration.

This is Elga’s first loan with MFP. She tells us that, like her mother, she believes that responsibility is the most important quality. Therefore, she should not have any problems making payments on time. With the money she is requesting, she will improve her business by purchasing a large quantity of beauty products and lingerie so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of beauty products & lingerie

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está ubicado  en la parroquia el Valle al  suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur del país, esta región  es conocida por su mayor  producción de maíz, fréjol, papas, etc., también por los atractivos turísticos como son los sitios arqueológicos de Gullanzhapa y Pedernales, su gente es muy cordial y amable con el turista nacional y extranjero.

La señora Luz  María C. es una de las socias activas del  banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive en la parroquia el Valle en la comunidad Corazón de Jesús, tiene 56 años de edad, enviudó  hace quince  años ya que su esposo tenia  problemas de alcohol, es madre de cinco hijos de 35, 30, 28, 25, 12 años, sus cuatro hijos mayores ya son casados y tienen su hogar independiente, sólo le acompaña  su último hijo  que aún es estudiante de secundaria en el  colegio Benigno Malo de la localidad, no tiene casa propia vive en una casa prestada por su sobrino.

 Luz nos cuenta que antes trabajaba elaborando estucos pero por problemas en su columna dejo de hacerlo ahora se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y a la crianza de pollos y cuyes tanto para el consumo en casa como para la venta a sus vecinos de la comunidad o en los mercados de la localidad.

Nuestra socia  lleva dos años trabajando con los prestamos que la institución le ha hecho entrega  y éstos ha invertido en la  compra de pollos y cuyes para montar su criadero,  con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue va a comprar el alimento y vitaminas para sus pollos y cuyes, así como para cubrir unas necesidades de su hogar

Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia
texts.en:
The Heart of Jesus Communal Bank is located in El Valle Parrish, which is southwest of the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. This region is primarily known for its production of corn, beans, potatoes, and other crops. It also has tourist attractions, such as the archeological sites in Gullanzhapa and Pedernales. The people are very friendly and kind to domestic and foreign tourists.

Sra. Luz María C. is a member of the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Corazón de Jesús in El Valle Parrish. She is 56 years old and has been widowed for 15 years as a result of her husband’s alcoholism. Her five children range in age from 12 to 35. The four oldest children are married and have their own families. The youngest child is a student at Benigno Malo High School, but he does not live at home. Instead, he stays at the home of her nephew.

Luz told us that she previously worked preparing stucco but she started developing spinal problems. This forced her to spend her time doing housework and raising chickens and guinea pigs. Some of the animals are reserved for personal consumption, but most of them are sold to neighbors in the community or at the local markets.

Luz has been working with the Institution for two years and used her previous loans to buy chickens and guinea pigs for breeding. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy feed and vitamins for her animals. A portion of the loan will be used to pay for some household expenses. Luz dreams of owning a home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed & vitamins for her animals

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: El señor Arturo A. Rodríguez, es un productor de la zona rural del municipio de Ticuantepe, desde hace  treinta años se dedica a la agricultura, el inicio gracias al apoyo que recibió de sus padres los cuales le enseñaron a trabajar diferentes cultivos, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta que no cuenta suficiente recursos para darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus cultivo ya que estos son diversificados, estos productos carecen de fertilizantes e insumos para la mejora del mismo , don Arturo tiene siete hijos ya todos independientes y dos de ellos trabajan con el , la esposa trabaja como comerciante en el mercado Oriental de la capital de Managua para poder cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar como: agua, luz entre otros. Comprara abono para mejorar la producción.
texts.en:
Señor Arturo A. Rodríguez is a farmer in the rural area of the municipality of Ticuantepe. For 30 years he has worked in agriculture; he began this work thanks to the support that he received from his parents, who taught him to cultivate various crops. The main difficulty that he faces is that he does not have enough resources to adequately maintain his various crops; he lacks fertilizers and supplies to improve his crops. Don Arturo has 7 children; they are all independent and 2 of them work with him. His wife works as a trader in the Oriental market in the capital city of Managua in order to cover the basic household expenses such as water and light, among others. He will buy fertilizer to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to be applied in the cultivation of pineapples

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia JUSTINA pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

Nuestra socia es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente y tienen tres hijos.
