Los mayores estudian en el colegio, Rouice tiene 7 años y Luz Ángela tiene 6 años y el menor Luguino tiene 2 años. Ellos viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. La socia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza que ofrece a sus amigas y vecinos llevándoles un catalogo de los productos y después hace pedido a la empresa mayorista. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio de venta de producto de belleza adquiriendo más productos como perfumes, aretes y collares.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Member Justina belongs to the "Virgen de Chapi" Community Bank. Our member is a humble mother. She is 43 years old, lives with her partner and has three children. The older ones study at school. Rouice is 7 years old and Luz Ángela is 6 years old and the yougest, Luguino is two. They live in the district of Santiago in the province of Cusco. The member has a small business selling beauty products which she offers to her friends and neighbors taking them a catalog of the products and later submitting orders to the wholesaler. She has already worked in this business for various years and it has gone well thanks to all the hard work she puts in. Our member is a hard-working and entrepreneurial mother who is getting her family ahead. She requires a loan to increase her beauty products business' capital acquiring more products such as perfumes, earrings and necklaces. Justina is thankful for the opportunity provided in this manner and also promises to pay according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her beauty products business' capital acquiring more products such as perfumes, earrings and necklaces

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Este cliente tiene a su cargo cinco hijos, cuatros de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante Seis años, en ese lapso ha invertido  8 créditos en la mejora de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales para la remodelación del Techo de su  vivienda y el pago de la mano obra, para darles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client is married and has five children, four of whom are still in school. He has been receiving loans from CEPRODEL for six years, in which time he's invested eight CEPRODEL loans in improving his home. He is an excellent client. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase construction materials and hire someone to replace his home's roof, so that he can offer his children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Kork

texts.en: Kork S., 26, is married and lives with her two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. S. makes a living selling palm juice, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover family expenses. She has been in this business since 2008. Her husband is a construction worker, and earns $5 per day. S. and her husband work hard, help each other to ensure a good standard of living for their family, and are seeking to improve their businesses as well. To make this improvement possible, S. is requesting $1,000 from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner, and will use the loan to buy animals to help plow her rice fields. This is her first loan from CREDIT.

loans.use: To buy animals to help plow the field

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie tends 2.5 hectares of rice field. She is 46 years old, married and has three children. Aside from farming, she also has a hog-raising business. She  joined CEVI, an MFI, to help her business financially. She chose this MFI because of its low interest rate. She is now requesting 7,000 Philippine pesos. She will use this loan for farm supplies and pig feed.

loans.use: Farm supplies and pig feed

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Carlos García, labora como agente de seguridad en una universidad en Managua donde se esfuerza para llevar el sustento a sus cuatro  hijos a su que se encuentran en edad escolar.

El crédito está solicitándolo para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, hierro y cemento para la construcción de un muro en su casa de habitación ya que es de mucha necesidad para así brindarle mayor seguridad a sus hijos y contribuir al mejoramiento de su vivienda que tanto necesita de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mr Carlos Garcia works as a security agent at the University of Managua. He works very hard to be able to support his four children that are currently enrolled in school. He is requesting this loan to be able to buy construction materials like rocks, sand, tools and cement so that he can build a wall in his home. This wall is needed to give increased security to his children and contribute to the improvement of his home for which he need your help.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora M. es trabajadora active del Banco popular (BANCENTRO). Ella quiere el crédito para comprar cemento y repellar su casa de habitación y así mejorar su condición de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora M. is an active worker of the popular bank BANCENTRO. She is seeking a loan to buy cement and repair her house to be able to improve the living conditions for her and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement

loans.name: Saidu Rahim

texts.en: Saidu Rahim B. is 38 years old and owns a drug store at the centre part of town. He is married with one child and three dependents who are his wife's sisters. He started his business with a small table in which he sells his drugs and has now rented a store. His wife usually helps in the store when he is not around hence Saidu is seeking for a loan to purchase more drugs for his store and eventually use proceeds from his business to care for his family.

loans.use: To purchase drugs

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1,2,3 Group

texts.en:
Shely is the coordinator of her group Muejres Valientes (Valiant Women). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally. Many of Esperanza's Dominican Republic clients recently emigrated from Haiti. Shely's group is located in Puerto Plata, a coastal town where the economy is based around tourism, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and seven children.

Shely is excited to be taking her seventh loan from Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. Shely sells used clothing, and she plans to use this loan to purchase large packages of used clothing from sources such as the Salvation Army in the United States.  She will then resell the clothes, using the profits to support her family by providing basic necessities for her children and finishing the construction of her home. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy packages of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Asuntina

texts.es:
Asuntina es socia del Banco Comunal Belen.

Asuntina es soltera, tiene 27 años y 1 hija, Asuntina compra panes del horno, producto que reparte a tiendas y también lo vende en un terminal terrestre. Además Asuntina se dedica a la siembra de verduras que vende en el mercado de abastos.

Asuntina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semillas. Los sueños de Asuntina son comprar un terreno para construir su casa y brindar buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Asuntina is a member of the Belen Communal Bank. She is single, 27 years old, and has a daughter. She buys bread for distribution to stores, and she also sells bread in a terminal. In addition, Asuntina grows vegetables, which she sells in the marketplace. She needs a loan of 600 soles, to purchase seeds. Her dream is to buy land to build her house and offer a good education to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Marilly

texts.es: Marilly, de  23 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de su suegra.Desde hace 6 meses atiende su propia botica. Antes atendía una botica  de otra persona y de esa manera gano experiencia, luego  arrendó un local en una de las principales calles de su ciudad y empezó con el negocio. Es así que en la actualidad  atiende todos los días  en su local  y administra las ganancias que recibe, Marilly disfruta cada día de su trabajo porque le gusta atender a sus clientes, paralelamente a este negocio se dedica junto a su esposo a ofrecer el servicio de transporte, es por eso que para más adelante tiene pensado  incrementar su capital de trabajo.Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser  muy responsable con sus pagos, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron  posible el  préstamo que le será  de mucha utilidad  en el progreso de su negocio.Tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de  medicamentos permitidos, para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera ofrecer lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marilly, 23, lives with her husband and two children in her mother-in-law’s house. She has had her own drug store for the past 6 months. She used to work in someone else’s drug store and that’s how she got experience. Later, she rented a space on one of the city’s main streets and opened her business; it’s open every day and she manages her own profits. Marilly enjoys her work daily because she likes to take care of her customers. She also has a second occupation with her husband: public transportation services. This is why she plans to increase her working capital in the future. This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. She is very grateful to all the people who made the loan possible for it will be very useful for her business’ progress. She plans to use the funds to buy permitted medicines to stock her store thereby offering her customers the best.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo D. L. is from the village of Centro 2. He is 44 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ronaldo owns and operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services. Ronaldo has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ronaldo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. As with his previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was successfully repaid, the new loan of 3,000 PHP will be used to repair his existing vehicle to improve the service. This will be the seventh loan he has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle to improve the service

loans.name: Astrid

texts.es: Astrid tiene 39 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 4 años se dedica a vender artículos para el hogar como frazadas, colchas manteles entre otros artículos más. Su modo D. trabajo lo realiza dentro D. su domicilio, en donD. lleva a sus clientes para ofrecerle la mercadería que tiene, dejándolo a crédito, y el tiempo D. pago dependerá del acuerdo que tenga con cada uno D. sus compradores. Este negocio le ha sido muy rentable, ya que pueD. aumentar sus ganancias, es por ello que desea aumentar su capital D. trabajo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por tal motivo será muy responsable con sus pago, puesto que desea volver a contar con nuevos aportes futuro. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más artículos para el hogar como frazadas y colchas.
texts.en:
Astrid is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four children in her own home. For more than four years, she has been selling household items such as blankets, bedspreads, tablecloths, and other articles. Her method of working is by having her customers come to her home to purchase the merchandise she offers. She extends credit and is paid according to the agreement she reaches with each of her customers. This business is very profitable and has allowed her to increase her earnings. For this reason, she wants to increase her operating capital.

This is her second loan with MFP. Astrid has been very responsible with her payments because she wants to be eligible for new loans in the future. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more household items such as blankets and bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase blankets & bedspreads

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Mary Luz, de 22 años es una joven entusiasta con muchos ánimos de salir adelante, convive con su pareja Powel, de 24 años y su pequeño hijo, en casa sus suegros. Tanto el café y plátano que produce Mary Luz, son los mejores de esta zona de la selva central, y esto se debe a los cuidados adecuados y a la dedicación que emplean ella y su pareja. Todos los días, luego de preparar los alimentos, se dirigen a sus terrenos para limpiarlos y mantenerlos libres de maleza, y evitar que las plagas ataquen sus plantaciones o frutos. Lleva 3 años dedicados a la agricultura, disfruta mucho esta actividad, asegura además que le es muy rentable, ya que le permite contar siempre con algo de dinero para seguir invirtiendo en ello, con tal de tener una mejor productividad, por eso no descansará hasta lograr ser una de las mejores y más reconocidas productoras de su localidad. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y se muestra muy animada de pertenecer a su grupo comunal, donde trabajará de manera activa y respetando la decisión que adopte la mayoría para bien del grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico que esparcirá sobre sus diversas plantaciones, para que se desarrollen con rapidez.
texts.en:
Mary Luz, 22, is an enthusiastic youth who has a strong desire to succeed. She lives with her partner, Powel, who is 24, and their small son in the home of her in-laws. Both the coffee and the bananas that Mary Luz produces are the best in this area of the central rainforest, and this is due to the appropriate care that she gives her crops, and the dedication of Mary Luz and her partner. Each day after preparing the food, they go to their land to clear it and maintain it free of brush, so that they can avoid the pests that attack their crops and fruit. She has worked in agriculture for 3 years, and she enjoys this activity very much. In addition, she has found that it is very profitable, since it allows her to always have some extra money that she can keep investing in it, thus increasing her productivity. That's why she will not rest until she has become one of the best and most well-known producers in her area. This is the first time that she has taken a loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic about belonging to a communal group where she will work in an active manner, respecting the decisions that are made by the majority for the good of the group. With the loan she requests, she will buy a number of bags of organic fertilizer that she will scatter amongst her various crops, so that they will grow more rapidly.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Akbarjon

texts.ru: Кобилов Акбарчон проживает в районе Вахдат. Возраст, 38 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Арендует пекарню, где реализует лепешки. В этом ему помогает жена. Клиент имеет богатый опыт в этой сфере. Целью кредита является закуп муки. Так как сейчас мука не дорогая он хочет запастись. Кредит планирует погасить в течении 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Akbarjon K. lives in Vahdat. He is 38 years old, married, and has one child. He has a high school education. He rents a bakery where he bakes flat bread. His wife helps him. The client has vast experience in this. The loan is for buying flour. Presently, flour is not expensive. Therefore, he would like to buy some to keep in reserve. He plans to pay off the loan in six months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour

loans.name: Eldina

texts.en:
Eldina Z. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Eldina is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Eldina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies like steam-cake in the local community. Eldina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eldina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eldina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eldina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es: Maria Alicia de 49 años, Comenzó hace años con el negocio de nintendo, mas tarde cuando los aparatos se dañaron, decide empezar a vender verduras y carne de pollo el cual lo destazaba y lo vendía a un precio mas cómodo poco a poco con esfuerzo realizo establecer su pulpería. En su negocio asisten diferentes personas sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda trabaja sola desde muy temprano hasta las 10 de la noche todos los días. Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo golosinas, detergentes, pan, jugos y desinfectantes para tener más ingresos. En el futuro quiere surtir más su negocio y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
María Alicia, 49, started a few years ago with a Nintendo business. However, when the equipment was damaged she began to sell vegetables and chicken that she’d butcher and sell for a fair price. Gradually, she set up a grocery store. Various neighbors, friends and relatives are her customers. Her store is located in her home and she tends to it by herself from very early until 10pm every day. She wants to use the loan to buy sweets, detergent, bread, juices and disinfectants to increase income. In the future she’d like to stock the store even more and finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es: Faustino, de 32 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos, tienen cuatro hijos. Juntos residen en el poblado de Machente, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de adobe. Faustino es una persona que toma decisiones con mucha cautela, ya que eso es la clave por el cual obtiene buenos resultados económicos. Recuerda que su primer negocio fue la actividad agrícola, en donde sigue produciendo y comercializando café, cuyos ahorros que hizo lo esta derivando para instalar una tienda de abarrotes, con el fin de que su esposa se haga cargo de dicho negocio. En un inicio la ventas fueron muy bajas, pero la constancia de salir adelante, pudo al final establecerse, hoy las ventas son considerables y su tienda de abarrotes está tomando mucha presencia en su poblado, debido a la cantidad de clientes que acuden a su establecimiento. Normalmente trabaja en su chacra por cuenta propia, pero cuando es temporada de cosecha, contrata peones para que le ayuden en la extracción del café, producto que es vendido en los centros de acopio de su localidad. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar la producción de café en otras zonas estratégicas, con la finalidad de minimizar costo. Este es su decimocuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando de manera oportuna, además  está satisfecho con su banco comunal, ya que todos son responsables y puntuales con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono para cuidar sus plantaciones de café.
texts.en:
Faustino is 32 years old and lives with his wife and four children in the village of Machete, located in the box of the Peruvian jungle, where they have their own home. Faustino is one who makes decisions with much consideration. This is why he gets good financial results. He recalls that his first business was an agricultural one. He continues to produce and sell coffee, and is using his earnings to set up a grocery store that his wife will run. At first the sales were low, but his desire to get ahead allowed his to become well established. Now grocery sales are very good and he is well known in his town because of the good service that he gives his customers. He usually works in the fields on his own, but hires field hands at harvest time and he sells his coffee in the distribution centers in his area. His future plans include increasing his coffee production in other nearby zones so that he can minimize his costs. This will be his 14th loan through MFP and be promises to make his payments on time. He is happy with his communal bank because its members are all responsible and punctual. He will use the money from this loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for his coffee plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Hannia Mayela

texts.en:
Hannia is a 39-year-old mother of two who lives with her family in Desamparados, located in the Central Valley of Costa Rica. Hannia has a business producing and selling decorations for parties and special events. She makes piñatas and other types of festive pieces. She has applied for the current loan in order to purchase materials necessary for the creation of her various decorations. Hannia is currently behind on her orders and is seeking working capital in order to satisfy the demands of her clients. 

Hannia wakes up early every day and prepares breakfast for her family. Sometime between breakfast and lunch, she spends time creating her decorations; however, the majority of her production takes place during the afternoon and at night. Hannia dedicates one day per week to collect orders. Hannia's long-term goal is to expand her business, increase revenue and improve living conditions in her home.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed for the production of decorations

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita A. is from the village of San Pedro, San Pablo. She is 53 years old. Lolita is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid her previous loan of 20,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be Lolita's seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation.  Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template to help its Field Partners continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to sell

location.town: San Pedro San Pablo, Aurora, Isabela

loans.name: Adriana Jessenia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Corrales se reúne cada 15 días en una localidad llamada Los Corrales a pocos minutos de Montecristi, en este sitio la mayoría de los habitantes tiene diferentes actividades, tales como: artesanía y comercio en general.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Adriana tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos de 9-6 y dos años, los mayores están en la escuela lo cual representa muchos gastos, el marido es chofer y con esto muchas veces no le alcanza para los gastos de la familia.

Por esta razón ella decidió dedicarse al comercio, vende ropa puerta a puerta. Además los sábados y domingos vende comida en su casa donde ella en estos días pone un pequeño comedor,  nos cuenta que la situación esta dura pero con trabajo y esfuerzo ellos la han sabido llevar. Lo que es ropa la deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, viaja a Guayaquil una vez al mes a traer mercadería.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar mercadería y cuatro sillas plásticas para el negocio de comida. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio y le  gusta porque gracias a esto ha podido incrementar sus ventas. Sus sueños son darles una buena educación a sus hijos y tener su casa bien arreglada.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Los Corrales" meets every two weeks in the community of Los Corrales, a few minutes from the city of Montecristi. It is a community made up of individuals of various occupations, such as: artisans and merchants.

Adriana is 24 years old, she is married and she has three children, aged 9, 6 and 2 years. The two eldest are attending school and it is very expensive. Her husband is a driver and his income is often not enough to cover the family's expenses. 

For this reason she decided to sell clothing from door to door. On Saturdays and Sundays she also sells foods from a small restaurant in her home. She says that her situation is very difficult but with their hard work and effort they have managed to pull through. She sells her clothing items on credit, collecting weekly payments. She travels to Guayaquil one a month to purchase merchandise. 

This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise and four plastic chairs for her restaurant business. She has been a member of this community bank since the beginning and she enjoys it because she has seen an improvement in her sales. Her dream is to give her children and education and a well conditioned house.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale and four plastic chairs.

loans.name: Tsogzolmaa

texts.en:
Tsogzolmaa E. is 23 years old and lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.

Tsogzolmaa operates a grocery store next to her home. She began her business by renting a grocery shop. Since then she has been able to build a small house in which she sells a variety of food products. She hopes to continue to grow her shop and to improve her family's standard of living. In the future she hopes to establish her own big supermarket. She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of groceries to sell and to resolve heating problems in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of groceries for her store

loans.name: Socorro Del Pilar

texts.es:
Socorro tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo ya independizado, vive junto a su madre y hermanas en el caserío Tejedores del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir, ella confecciona estas prendas junto con sus hermanas en un taller ubicado en su vivienda, las prendas que confeccionan los vende en los caserío aledaños y en el puerto de Paita (donde trabaja su hijo). El negocio le ayuda para solventar sus gastos y apoyar a la economía de su familia.

Socorro desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas materiales para seguir confeccionando prendas de vestir y aumentar sus ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Socorro is 44-years-old.  She is a single mother and has a son who is now independent.  She lives with her mother and sisters in the village of Tejedores in the Tambogrande agricultural district, a zone in the Piura province in the region with the same name a little more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  
She works making and selling items of clothing.  She makes these clothes along with her sisters in a workshop located in their home.  The clothing that they make is sold in a nearby village and in the port of Paita (where her son works).  The business helps to pay her expenses and support the family.
Socorro would like to expand her business with the purchase of more materials to continue making clothing and increase her sales.  This is why she has found it convenient to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa that she plans to use to achieve her goal. 
She is a very calm and responsible woman.  Her main goal is to continue growing as an entrepreneur in order to gradually improve her quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to expand business making and selling clothing items.

loans.name: Kabul Nawin Group

texts.en:
Raziya is a member of Kabul Nawin group. She is married and lives in a big family.

Raziya’s husband has a vehicle repair workshop and he can repair all kinds of vehicles in his workshop.  Nevertheless, his monthly income is too small and not enough for the necessities of his family.  That is why he requested a loan to build up his business and increase his monthly income.  He hopes that after the loan, he will have a comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: To build up vehicle repair business

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita S. is from the village called Barangay 25, in Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Rita is separated from her spouse and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and treats like ice candy, popcorn and peanut butter in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. 

Rita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase the raw ingredients she needs to make the products she sells. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He is the only financiA. support for his family. He has 10 years of experience in car maintenance and painting and opened his own garage in 2005. Through the years, he has built a good business reputation.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase extra products for his garage to provide better service for his clients so he can make more profit.

loans.use: To purchase extra products for his garage

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang A., 42, is married and resides with her six children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. A. is a housewife while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 70 on food and USD 35 on other necessary expenses. A. is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use the additional income for repairing her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Manesa es una de los miembros del grupo Mujeres Valientes. Su familia está compuesta por 3 hijos y sus padres, ambos (padre y madre) han educado y criado a sus hijos. Nos dice que sus retos o desafíos más difíciles ha sido dedicarse como madre para darle un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 

Manesa está muy emocionada de recibir su tercer préstamo en Esperanza Internacional.  Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 10 años, el cual inició despues de haber llegado a Republica Dominicana y vio la necesidad de empezar a trabajar, utilizando un poco de capital para ventas de aliments. Manesa está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de alimentos como arroz, habichuelas, azucar, vegetales, aceite, y carnes. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio para mejorar sus ventas, incorporando mas productosropa nueva y de esta manera poder hacer crecer su negocio y lograr su sueño de poder terminar de construir su casa, también desea tener buena salud y tener una vida más estable económicamente. 

Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque las cuotas de pagos son más flexibles y a un menor interés. Su historia está siendo usada para representar a los demás miembros de su grupo y a los clientes de Esperanza, tanto los haitianos (quienes en su mayoría ha emigrado hacia la Republica Dominicana desde Haití, algunos de ellos recientemente) y los dominicanos, quienes por lo general viven en comunidades muy pobres, esta zona, como muchas otras zonas de escasos recursos en la Republica Dominicana, carecen de agua potable y energía eléctrica constante. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una zona de pocos recursos de la ciudad de Santo Domingo, especificamente ubicada al norte de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Manesa is a member of the “Mujeres Valientes” (Brave Women) group.  Her family is comprised of three children and their parents.  Both of them (father and mother) have educated and raised their children.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge has been to devote herself as a mother to giving her children a better future.

Manesa is very excited to receive her third loan with Esperanza Internacional.  She has had her business for around ten years.  She started after having arrived in the Dominican Republic and seeing the need to start working.  She used a little bit of capital for food sales.

Manesa is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of foods like rice, kidney beans, sugar, vegetables, oil, and meats.  She will use her earnings to continue investing in her business in order to improve her sales.  She will include more products and new clothes.  That way she will be able to make her business grow.  She will achieve her dream of being able to finish building her house.  She also wishes to have good health and a life that is more economically stable.

She started her association with Esperanza because the payments are much more flexible and the interest is less.  Her story is being used to represent the other members of her group.  Her story also represents Esperanza’s other clients, the Haitians (most of whom have immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them recently) as much as the Dominicans.  They generally live in very poor communities.  

This zone, like a lot of other zones with scarce resources in the Dominican Republic, lacks potable water and steady electricity.  This group is in a zone with few resources in the city of Santo Domino.  It is located to the north of the city.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Azra Dildar Masih's Group

texts.en:
Azra lives in Mian Channu, a small city known for its agriculture industry, located in Punjab province, Pakistan. She lives there with her family in a two-roomed brick house. She is 36 years old and married to D. M..
Azra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her son’s animal sales business. He started this business ten years ago by purchasing a small number of animals. He raised them and sold them to butchers for a profit. With this loan, he will purchase animals (such as goats) and sell them to butchers to make a good profit.
Azra is very hopeful about the future growth of her son’s business and about a better financial future for her family. She has four other children. Her second son helps his father in his wall paint business. Her remaining children are enrolled in school and getting an education. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for resale

loans.name: Margaret Wanyofu

texts.en:
Margaret N. is 43 years old and married to Josiah Odhiambo, who contributes to the family income. She has four children, ages 19, 11, 10, and 5. She sells fish to her customers in Makongeni in Thika-Town. She has been in this business for a period of five years, with an income of 8,500 KES per month.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use the loan to buy more fish to sell to her customers. 

She hopes to grow her business and become a leading fish seller and distribute to other food stores.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Upatanisho Group

texts.fr: Kavira P.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Upatanisho, âgée de 48 ans, mariée, mère de 9 enfants dont certains ont leurs propres foyers et  d’autres vont encore à l’école. Son mari est chômeur, sans emploi. La  cliente  Kavira P. est vendeuse d’huile de palme et l’huile végétal raffiné Rina. Elle expose ses marchandises au long de la rue et parfois à son domicile. Bientôt 7 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle démarra son activité avec un fonds de crédit reçu de l’IMF Hekima vers 2004. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouvelles marchandises (6 bidons d’huile de palme et 4 cartons d’huile végétal raffiné Rina, 2 sacs de farines, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et construire dignement une belle maison pour  sa famille. Selon elle, le crédit de Hekima lui a servi  de vivre dans des conditions de vie  socialement  acceptables. La cliente Kavira P.  remercie l’IMF Hekima et ses partenaires pour  leurs actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Upatanisho est constitué de 28 membres.
texts.en: Kavira P. is an entrepreneur and the leader of the Upatanisho work group. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of nine. Some of her children already live separately, and others still go to school. Her husband is unemployed, out of work. Kavira P. sells palm oil and refined vegetable oil of the Rina brand. She displays her wares out on the street and sometimes by her home. She has been doing this for almost seven years. She launched her business with a  starting capital received from IMF Hekima around 2004. This new loan will allow her to stock up additional goods (six jugs of palm oils, four cartons of Rina refined vegetables oil, two bags of flour, etc). In addition her goal is to expand her business and to build a nice, proper house for her family to live in. She says that Hekima’s loan has helped her maintain a socially acceptable standard of living. As  a client, Kavira P. is grateful to IMF Hekima and its partners for their assistance to impoverished women who do not have access to traditional banking. The Upatanisho group consists of 28 members.

loans.use: to purchase six jugs of palm oil, four cartons of vegetable oil, two bags of flour, etc

loans.name: Tuvemubujiji Group

texts.fr: Elina Byukusenge est agricultrice de mais, et client d’ACB depuis 2008.  Elle a 40 ans, elle est mariée, née au Rwanda, et elle a 6 enfants entre 5 ans et 23 ans.  Quatre de ses enfants vont à l’école, et Elina a fini 2 ans d’école secondaire.  Ce crédit est son premier cycle avec ACB, et elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 kgs de mais, louer les champs, et payer la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’augmenter des champs à cultiver.  Elle voudrait devenir une grande agricultrice dans le secteur de Rubavu.  Elle voudrait aussi assurer le bien-être de sa famille, et construire des autres maisons d’habitation à louer.
texts.en:
Elina Byukusenge is a corn farmer and has been a client of ACB since 2008. She is 40 years old and married. Born in Rwanda, she has six children, aged 5 to 23. Four of her children go to school. Elina finished two years of secondary schooling.

This loan is her first cycle with ACB, and she is going to use her loan to buy 10 kg of corn, to lease fields, and to pay for labor. Her strategy for business growth is to add to her arable land. She would like to become a major grower in the Rubavu area. She would also like to ensure her family's well-being and to build other houses to rent out.

loans.use: to buy 10 kg of corn, to lease the field, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel forma parte del banco comunal “Los jardines del bosque” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Ella se dedica al rubro de la artesanía en cueros y tejidos desde hace 10 años. Arte que realiza para las aplicaciones de ropas, accesorios y artículos para casa. Sus modelos son exclusivos, ya que además ella diseña. Su taller lo tiene ubicado en su misma casa. Todos sus trabajos son a pedido. Isabel cuenta con una página Web para promocionar y publicitar su artesanía. El perfil de su clientela principalmente son profesionales que no cuentan con mucha disponibilidad para ir a tiendas y comprar.  Por lo tanto éste sistema para publicitar sus productos está destinado para ellos, además utiliza un notebook por el cual muestra su mercadería y envía catálogos en línea.  Isabel trabaja sola en éste negocio.
Su mercadería la compra en una tienda de cueros y los demás insumos en una distribuidora.
Con éste préstamo comprará materiales para confecciones sus productos de artesanía, además enviará a reparar sus dos máquinas de coser. 
Sus metas son comprarse máquinas de coser industriales y un I Pad, para ofrecer mejor sus productos. 
Isabel vive junto a su esposo quien le ayuda con el traslado de maquinarias dentro del taller. Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio son por gusto y terapia, ya que Isabel sufrió una depresión años atrás, actualmente sigue controlándose, pero su estado anímico es favorable. 
Isabel está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por Fondo Esperanza, ya que podrá invertir en su negocio. Las reuniones a las que asiste son muy gratas, además está participando de unos talleres de venta, por los cuales se siente muy contenta.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Isabel is a member of the “Los jardines del bosque” community bank which is located in the city of Temuco.  She makes leather and woven handicrafts and has been in this business for 10 years.  She makes clothes, accessories and soft furnishings.  Her models are exclusives as she also designs them.

Isabel's workshop is located in her home and all her products are made to order.  She has a web page where she promotes and publicizes her handicrafts.  Her customers are mainly professionals who don't have a lot of time available to go to the stores and buy products.  For this reason, her system for promoting her products is aimed at them.  Isabel uses a Notebook to exhibit her merchandise and send catalogs on line.  She works alone in her business.

Isabel buys some of her merchandise in a leather store and other supplies from a wholesaler.  She will use this loan to buy materials for making her handicrafts.  She will also send her two sewing machines to be repaired.  Her goal is to buy industrial sewing machines and an iPad so that she can better sell her products.

Isabel lives together with her husband who helps her to move the machinery in her workshop.  Her motivation for continuing in her business is that she enjoys it and finds it therapeutic since she used to suffer from depression some years ago.  She is continuing to look after herself but her mood is favorable.

Isabel is very happy and grateful for the loan that she has obtained from Fondo Esperanza since it means she will be able to invest in her business.  The meetings that she attends are very pleasant and she is also participating in some sales workshops which is making her very happy.

Temuco is the capital of Araucania region.  The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the outlying areas there are a series of lakeside spas (Pucón, Villarica) and very colorful native flora and fauna in nearby nature reserves.  This region is home to 50% of the Mapuches (the indigenous people of our country).

loans.use: to buy materials to make her handicrafts and to send her two sewing machines to be repaired

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline K. is 41 years old and a widow. She sells meat and has been doing so for 10 years. Jacqueline works from 8 am until 6 pm every day. She is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more meat. With her profits, Jacqueline will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more meat

loans.name: Samara's Group

texts.en:
Samara is a young leader of this group. She is 22 and married. Her husband is employed; his monthly salary is 6000 soms. Samara has a newborn baby. In order to earn money to supplement the family budget, she takes orders at home and sews Kyrgyz blankets, pillows, clothes and dressmaking patterns. She started this business five years ago. Samara earns 5000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan she wants to purchase fabric and other materials needed for sewing. In the future Samara plans to save money to purchase furniture for her home.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: 47.thieu Chinh Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ha has worked in agriculture farming poultry and cattle for the past three years. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Ha is 28 years old and married with no children or dependents. She is the group leader of the 10.5.47.Thieu Chinh solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. The main problem that Ha faces in her business is lack of capital. This is Ha's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profit, she hopes to maintain a successful business and remodel her house.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 43 years old and married with a daughter. Her husband is a worker in a local factory. She supports her family by weaving thread and fibers at her house. 

She plans to get a loan to invest capital in her business to increase production and buy more raw materials in bulk at cheaper prices.  

She hopes that the loan will enabL. her business to generate a higher income and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials in bulk

loans.name: Grupo Salvador (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Banco Comunal Grupo Salvador. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, servicios, entre otras cosas. Ellos unieron sus esfuerzos para poder acceder a los beneficios que presta la Fundación Espoir, este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y esperan cumplir muy bien para seguir adelante en la institución.

Una de las socias es a la señora Patricia, ella tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 14, 10 y 7 años de edad, el mayor estudian en colegio y las menores en escuela. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.
 
Nuestra amiga es muy emprendedora ella es dueña de dos tiendas de comestibles,  una tiene en la casa que pudo construir con mucho esfuerzo y la otra en la casa de su hermana que vive en España y le dio para que se la cuide. Su suegra es quien  administra una de las tiendas mientras que ella se encarga de la otra. Nos cuenta que sus hijos le ayudan cuando están desocupados y los fines de semana, que lleva cerca de 10 años con su negocio y que gracias a su esfuerzo pudo construir su casa y mejorar su vida.

Este crédito es para surtir aun más sus tiendas, va a comprar víveres en general ya que le gusta tener de todo para que sus clientes la prefieran. Este es primer ciclo en el banco y le gusta la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir aumentando sus negocios.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo the members of the Grupo Salvador Community Bank meet every two weeks.  These members work in various activities such as general trading and services, among other things. They combined their efforts to be able to gain access to the benefits provided by the Fundación Espoir.  This is their first lending cycle through the community bank and they expect to do very well so as to move forward with the institution.

One of the members is Señora Patricia.  She is 38 years old and married, and from this relationship has three children aged 14, 10 and 7.  The eldest is studying in secondary school and the two youngest in primary school.  Her husband is a security guard.

Our friend is very enterprising; she manages two grocery stores.  One is in her house, which was built with great effort, and the other is in the house of her sister, who lives in Spain and gave it to her to look after.  Her mother-in-law runs one of the stores while she takes care of the other.  She tells us that her children help her when they aren't busy and on weekends.   She's had about 10 years with her business and thanks to her efforts was able to build her home and improve her life.

This loan is to stock up her stores even more; she is going to buy general food supplies as she likes to have everything that her customers prefer.  This is her first lending cycle through the bank and she likes the ease of getting the loans.

Her dreams are to continue growing her businesses.

loans.use: to buy general food supplies.

loans.name: Janelyn

texts.en:
Janelyn is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Janelyn has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits & snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy breads, biscuits & beverages.

Janelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Janelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, biscuits & beverages

loans.name: Amigas Unidas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AMIGAS UNIDAS” iniciará su décimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lucila. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de refrescos, venta de maíz, joyeria, venta de comida, tienda, taller de chaperia, venta de papa.

La señora Lucila  indica que hace cuatro años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando a la  institución por intermedio de vecinas y amigas de su barrio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de maíz que aprendio de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de maíz), los que comprara de Zorata y lo comercializará en la calle. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y salud.
texts.en:
The communal bank "AMIGAS UNIDAS" will begin its tenth loan cycle through Pro Mujer at the Centro Santiago II.  The group is comprised of nine members and has a board of directors chaired by Mrs. Lucila.  The business activities of the members are varied and include: sales of softdrinks, corn, jewelry, food, potatoes, a sheetmetal workshop and a store.

Mrs. Lucila has been working with Pro Mujer for four years and joined the institution through neighbors and friends in her neighborhood.  She currently sells corn, which is a trade she learned from her mother.

The loan she is taking out will be used to increase her capital to buy corn in Zorata and sell in the street.  This activity generates income to help support her family as much as possible.  She is married and has three children.

When asked what she enjoys most about Pro Mujer, she says the training and health-related activities.

loans.use: To buy corn.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 46 years old and married to Samwel; they have three school-going children. She has been running her grocery shop for three years, making a monthly profit of 7,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She has been loaned 15,000 KES from KADET Ltd. and plans to purchase more vegetables for sale. 

With the anticipated profit she plans to expand her business and educate her children to higher education levels. 

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and build herself a residential house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: AYIDOTE est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe Bofè Rose (qui a la main levée sur la photo)  est âgée de 43 ans. Bofè Rose est mariée à un certain Isaac. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Bofè Rose et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs trois enfants et assurent ensemble leurs différentes charges. Bofè Rose a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire. Il y a une quinzaine d'année que Bofè Rose mène comme activité la vente de yaourt et des jus de fruits à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant ainsi à contribuer aux charges familiales. Bofè Rose s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d'améliorer le niveau de son activité en la  renforçant, et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Bofè Rose désire obtenir un deuxième financement, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE.
texts.en:
AYIDOTE is a group composed of five persons whose members live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative is Bofè Rose (with her hand raised in the photo). She is 43 years old and married to a man named Isaac. They have three children, all in school. Bofè Rose and her husband live together with their three children and jointly ensure that their different expenses are covered. 

Bofè Rose dropped out of middle school. For fifteen years, she has been running a business selling yoghurt and fruit juices out of her home. This business generates the revenues helping her to do her part in meeting family expenses. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

With the goal of improving her level of business by strengthening it, as well as satisfying customer demand, Bofè Rose and the other members of the group AYIDOTE would like to obtain a second loan.

loans.use: To buy hibiscus leaves, syrups, and sugar

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 33 years old and is married to Rehema. They are not yet blessed with children.  David has been selling clothing materials for the past four years, making a monthly profit of KES 20,000.  

He has been loaned KES 30,000, which he plans to use to purchase more materials for sale.

With the anticipated profit, he plans to open another shop to supplement the profits made.  In the near future, he hopes to have a big boutique in his home town.

loans.use: purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El sr. Pedro es agricultor, nació  en Chuquisaca, convine  con la Sra. Juana,  ella es ama de casa, tiene cuatro hijos todos menores de edad. Actualmente viven y trabajan en cañada Strongert  distante a 25 km de la localidad de Santa Rita, hace 12 años que ellos se dedican a la agricultura. El destino del crédito es para la siembra de sandia y mantenimiento de yuca y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra,  Ellos vienen trabajando hace cuatro secuencias con Emprender por que es la única institución que le ha dado una mano para poder aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en: Sr. Pedro is a farmer. He was born in Chuquisaca and lives with Sra. Juana. Juana is a housewife and they have four young children. They currently live and work in Cañada Strongert, 25 km from Santa Rita. They have been farmers for twelve years. This loan will be used for planting watermelon and maintaining the yucca crop; this means preparing the land. They have worked with Emprender for four cycles, because it is the only institution that has offered them help in increasing their working capital.

loans.use: to sow watermelon and maintain yucca crops.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a twenty-nine-year-old from Kakamega. She is married to Victor and they have three children.

Vida has a secretarial bureau that she has been running for the past four years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD  to enable her to buy computer accessories to add to her stock.

She hopes to see her business expand and open another bureau in the neighboring town in the future.

loans.use: To buy computer accessories.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y productos para el hogar, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, el negocio lo aprendió con sus padres, el negocio lo atiende todos los días de la semana.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, frijoles y arroz para surtir el negocio, este préstamo le ayudara para mantener lo necesario y atender la demanda.
Su aspiración es crecer en el negocio, aumentar sus ganancias, para poder mejorar la condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
José engages in selling basic grains and home products. He lives with his wife and two children. He has learnt how to do his job from his parents, and he works in his shop every day of the week.
He is currently requesting a loan to buy maize, beans and rice to stock up his shop. This loan will help him storing the products he needs and meeting his customers’ requests.
He wishes for this activity to grow and to increase his income, in order to improve the economic condition of his family.

loans.use: To buy maize, beans and rice.

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en: Sandrine is single but hopes to get married in the near future. She has adopted two children ages 4 and 9. She sells beauty products in a store that she has been running for 9 years. She would like this loan to buy a more diverse inventory for her store. Sandrine hopes to make profits that she will put towards savings for her future.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for sale.

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.ru: Ранохон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ей 55 лет. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Она предоставляет услугу, занимается шитьем. Она принимает заказы на дому. В этой области Ранохон уже восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения цветных ниток, однотонных материалов и тканей.
texts.en: Ranokhon lives in the region of Tursun-zoda. She is 55 years old. She is divorced, with one child. She provides sewing services. She takes orders out of her home. She has been working in this business for eight years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy threads in various colors and solid-color  fabrics.

loans.use: to buy threads in various colors and solid-color fabrics.

loans.name: Elenise

texts.es: Elenise, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, carismática, con deseos de superación. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja, y de 4 hijos, asimismo a uno de sus nietos. El trabajo que realiza Elenise es la venta de ropa, de primera y segunda calidad, lo cual  realiza en el mercado de su ciudad, donde tiene todos los implementos necesarios. Tiene un año realizando esta actividad y durante este tiempo le valió para ganarse clientes a quienes atiende de manera amable. Para esto cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos mayores, que la ayudan en sus labores. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le permite tener un ingreso económico, que le permite pagar los gastos de su hogar. Su anhelo es ampliar su negocio y vender más productos para así poder incrementar sus ingresos. Esto sería el cuarto crédito con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y muy cómoda con el grupo al cual está integrada, pues considera que son personas responsables. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará variedad de prendas, considera que a mayor variedad más acogida e ingresos tendrá su negocio.
texts.en:
Elenise, 44, is a charming, enterprising woman who wants to improve herself. She lives in her own house with her partner, her four children, and also one of her grandchildren. 

Elenise sells clothing, both first and second quality, in the city market, where she has all the necessary equipment. She has been doing this for a year, and during this time she has managed to win customers who she serves in a friendly way.  In this she has the support of her older children, who help her with her work. What she likes about her business, is that it provides her with an income that allows her to pay for her household expenses. 

She wishes to expand her business and sell more products, and so increase her income. This would be her fourth loan with MFP. She feels happy and very comfortable with the group she is a member of, as she considers them responsible people. 

With the loan she has applied for, she will buy a variety of clothing, as she considers that the more variety she has, the better received her business will be, and the more income she will have.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03  hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación primaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de productos de la región.

Su nuevo préstamo será de S/. 1,000.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que utilizará para comprar un saco de habas, quinua, chuño, etc.  Su esposo le ayuda a tostar los granos y lo vende molido, de esa forma se ayudan mutuamente.
 
Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las charlas respecto al negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the “Candelaria” communal bank in the Yunguyo district and province, within the Puno department.  She is 32 years old, married, and has three children.  She has an elementary school education.

She’s been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years and her first loan was for 300 PEN; money that she invested into her business of buying and selling regional products.

She will use the money from this new loan of 1,000 PEN to buy a sack of grapes, quinoa, chuño (freeze-dried potato product), etc.  Her husband helps her roast the grains and sells them after grinding.  In this way they mutually support one another.

Her dream for the future is for them to have a home of their own.

What she likes most about her communal bank are the business chats.

loans.use: to buy regional products for resale.

loans.name: Lamie

texts.en:
Lamie is 31 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She sells plastic products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of plastic to sell.

She has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 3 years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading. Lamie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of plastic to sell.

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen Del Mar se reúne cada 15 días en el hermoso balneario de San Mateo en la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Johana, tiene 30  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 9, 7 y 2 años de edad, los mayores estudian en  escuela. Su esposo chofer.

Ella para ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, además también su esposo trae materiales de pesca para vender a comerciantes de este lugar o directamente a pescadores de la zona.  Tanto ella como su esposo trabajan todos los días, el en la venta de materiales de pesca y ella con la venta de ropa, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra los fines de semana. Lleva tres años en esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y materiales para la pesca. Está en el Banco Comunal 2 años y le gusta porque en el grupo se entretiene y también vende sus productos.

Su sueño es tener un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “Virgen Del Mar” communal bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful resort of San Mateo in the city of Manta known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year-round by local and foreign tourists alike.  Most of the residents in this area fish and do chores related to the sea.

We met Johana, 30, here.  She’s married and has three children who are 9, 7 and 2 years old.  The older ones attend school.  Her husband’s a driver.

To earn a little on her own to help her husband with household expenses she sell all types of clothing door to door.  Also, her husband brings fishing supplies to sell to merchants in the area or directly to local fishermen.  Both she and her husband work every day selling the fishing supplies and selling clothes.  She sells on credit and collects on weekends.  She’s been in this line of work for three years and does very well.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and fishing supplies.  She’s been in the communal bank two years and likes it because she entertains herself in the group and also sells her products.  Her dream is to have a car to do her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr:
Kossi est un homme âgé de 47 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a 5 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Le premier a 21 ans et le dernier a 13 ans.
Kossi travaille comme revendeur depuis 2007. Il vend des plats, des verres à boire et des palettes de boissons pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, n’a pas de difficultés.
Kossi a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des plats, des verres à boire et des palettes de boissons. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kossi voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer les besoins élémentaires de sa famille.
texts.en: Kossi is a 47 year old man.  He is married to a retailer.  He has 5 children who all attend school. The oldest is 21 years old and the youngest is 13 years old.  Kossi has worked as a retailer since 2007.  He sells plates, drinking glasses, and pallets of drinks for all types of customers in his store.  He buys the products in Lome.  He works alone.  At the moment, he does not have any problems.  Kossi is asking for his 3rd loan with WAGES in order to buy plates, drinking glasses, and pallets of beverages.  He wants to reinvest in his business.  In the coming years, Kossi would like to expand the size of his business.  He says that with the profits he plans to take care of the basic needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy glasses, plates, and other items.

loans.name: San Blás Group

texts.es:
El grupo es San Blás se ha formado con la unión de 10 mujeres de una de las compañías más alejadas de la ciudad de Curuguaty. Ya que les es muy difícil llegar hasta la ciudad, la fundación paraguaya se ha acercado hasta ellas para poder ofrecerles la oportunidad de salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudarlas a salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora Maria, quien nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de verduras, como ser cebollas, tomates, locotes, zapallos y demás tipos de verduras. Cuenta que ella misma se encarga de las ventas y de esa forma y con mucho esfuerzo puede ayudar a su familia y cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen.
Ella solicita la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y de kiva para poder comprar tomates, locotes, cebollas, hortalizas y demás tipos de verduras con las cuales podrá abastecerse y de esa forma tener productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “San Blas” group has ten women members from one of the most distant communities from the city of Curuguaty.  Because it’s so difficult for them to come to the city, Fundación Paraguaya has gone to them to offer them the opportunity to get ahead and to help them get ahead.

One of the members is María who tells us that she is a vegetable merchant.  She sells onions, tomatoes, peppers, pumpkins and other types of vegetables.  She relates that she herself is the seller and with much effort is able to help her family cover daily expenses that arise.

She is asking Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for help to be able to buy tomatoes, peppers, onions, leafy green vegetables and other types of vegetables to stock up and have products available to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa sells traditionally-made soaps and pampers. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a carpenter. Adwoa uses her income to support her family in the general upkeep of the home. She will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to prepare soap to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to prepare soap to sell

loans.name: Kulshara

texts.ru: Кулшара, 47 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей (2 дочери и сын). У нее - среднее образование, работает в лицее, также занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая семью дополнительным доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Кулшары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 бычка, 2 коровы, 2 лошади. Также имеется земельный надел мерою 0,85 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает пшеницу. Ежемесячная прибыль - около 7,000 сом (KGS). Кулшара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и перепродажи. Развитие хозяйства позволит увеличить тем самым ее прибыль, улучшить благосостояние семьи и закончить строительство дома.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.en:
Sandra is a mother of two littles ones and is married. Her husband is a waiter for special events, and so his job is occasional and his salary is not unstable. With the sitaution at hand and in order to ensure the well-being of her family, Sandra looked for a business that would permit her to incur extra earnings. This is how she started selling snacks from her own home, and that being the case she was able to take care of her home and her children as well. A sense of responsibility and her enthusiasm have always been part of her and thanks to her business she can now cover for all the basic necessities of her children.

Today Sandra requires a loan of $375 to purchase more merchandise and a table to display her products. She plans to cover the full amount of the loan in a term of 5 - 10 months approximately. You can be an important part of the wellbeing of Sandra and her family. Help them to grow and above all, help them to have a more steady income. They thank you and appreciate your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra es madre de dos pequeños y esta casada, su esposo es mesero en eventos sociales, por lo que su trabajo es eventual y su salario no es fijo ni seguro. Ante esta situación y para asegurar el bienestar de su familia, Sandra buscó una actividad que le permitiera obtener ingresos extras, es por ello que hace tiempo comenzó a vender frituras en su propio hogar, de esta manera no descuidaba su casa y a sus hijos. La responsabilidad y el entusiasmo siempre han estado presentes en ella y gracias a su proyecto ahora puede cubrir todas las necesidades básicas de sus hijos.

En este momento Sandra requiere de un préstamo de $375 DLLS, para poder comprar más mercancía y una mesa para mostrar sus productos. Ella planea cubrir el monto total del préstamo en un plazo de 5-10 meses aproximadamente. Tú puedes ser parte importante del bienestar de Sandra y su familia, ayúdalos a crecer y sobre todo ayúdalos y tener ingresos más seguros. Ellos agradecen y aprecian tu generosidad.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elizabeth would like to buy more beads so that she can make more products for sale in Nairobi and Mombasa

loans.name: Nghean

texts.en: Mrs. Nghean V., 32 years old, is a mother of 2 children and lives with her husband in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers growing vegetables and rice crops on a small piece of land and typically make about $2.50/day, meager money which supplements the household. In order to increase outputs and make additional income, this couple is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more seeds and insecticides to use in their field. In the future, Nghean V. would like to  own another piece of land to expand her crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and insecticide for her crops

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina Z. is a 35 year old single woman; she lives in an urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  She has been in business since 1999.  LAPO has improved my financial life style she said, I have being in LAPO for the past 5 years as a leader of the union.  I am 35 years old. She sells fabrics, shoes, bags and jewelery. She needs a loan to buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, shoes, jewelery & bags for sale

loans.name: Ni Wayan Kolih

texts.id:
Ms. Wayan Kolih has been doing pig farming for a while, but always in simple and traditional way from pig feed as well as stall. With an initial capital of Rp1,600,000 (about US$176) Wayan Kolih bought 2 mother pigs. Every day Wayan Kolih has to spend Rp20,000 (about $2.20) for pig feed, since she fed them twice a day. Every 4 months her 2 mother pigs would bore piglets, that were ready to be sold 1.5 to 2 months after birth. Each pig could bore 6-10 piglets. From piglets sales Wayan Kolih could profit Rp1,500,000 (about $165)/6-months.
