This profit is used for school expenses of her 2 children who still sit in Middle school, since her husband's income aa a tenant farmer is not sure, and not enough to support a family. This profit is also used to repair her semi permanent home. Loan from Dinari will be used to buy better & quality piglets to be fattened, so that she could produce better pigs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ibu Wayan Kolih menekuni usaha beternak babi sudah sejak lama ,namun semuanya dilakukan secara sederhana dan tradisional ,Baik dari segi makanan maupun kandang babinya.Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp.1.600.000 Wayan Kolih bisa membeli 2 ekor induk babi.Setiap hari Wayan Kolih harus mengeluarkan biaya sebesar Rp.20.000 untuk makanan babinya,karena diberi makan dua kali dalam sehari. Setiap 4bulan sekali kedua induk babi ini akan melahirkan anaknya dan akan siap dijual setelah berumur 1,5 sampai 2 bulan sejak lahir.Satu ekor babi biasanya mempunyai anak 6 sampai 10 ekor.Dari penjualan anak-anak babi ini biasanya Wayan Kolih mendapat keuntungan Rp.1.500.000 setiap 6 bulan sekali.Keuntungan ini dipergunakan untuk biaya sekolah kedua anaknya yang kini duduk dibangku SMU, karena penghasilan suaminya sebagai seorang petani tidak tentu sehingga tidak bisa mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga,keuntungan ini juga sedikit demi sedikit dipergunakan untuk memperbaiki rumahnya yang kini masih semi permanen.Sedangkan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari DINARI dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit babi yang lebih bagus dan berkwalitas karena akan dipelihara sebagai penggemukan ,agar hasil yang didapat lebih baik.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: "I learned the act of trade from my mother.  I sell provisions and drinks and it has be the source of livelihood of my family," says Mrs. Rosemary I., who is a 30 year old married mother of 4 children living in Benin City.  She has been in this business since 2005 and she is currently a LAPO member.  She is seeking a loan of $250 to buy more provisions and drinks.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Asep

texts.id:
A natural business person often sees business opportunity. That's what happened to Asep. His ongoing business is selling candies. With a working capital of 50,000 IDR/pkg (1 USD ~ 9,000 IDR) he gains a profit of 25,000 IDR - 50,000 IDR/pkg. Based on the number of his current customers, around 100 people, he is tempted to make new years horn. This is a once in a year opportunity. One horn that costs him 1,000 IDR can be sold for 2,000-2,500 IDR. Asep needs a loan of 4,000,000 for working capital to make the horns that are going to be sold directly as well as through his mini-mart customers.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Seorang pedagang pasti selalu melihat peluang usaha. Hal itu juga dilihat oleh Asep. Usahanya selama ini adalah Jual Permen Berhadiah. Bermodalkan Rp 50.000,00/pak dia mendapatkan keuntungan Rp 25.000,00 – Rp 50.000,00/paknya. Berangkat dari jumlah pelanggan yang ia miliki – sekitar 100 orang - dia terdorong untuk membuat terompet tahun baru. Kesempatan yang datang setahun sekali. Satu terompet dengan harga dasar Rp 1.000,00 – Rp 1.500,00, dan dijual senilai Rp 2.000,00 – Rp 2.500,00 per biji. Dan Asep memerlukan pinjaman Rp 4.000.000,00 untuk modal membuat terompet yang akan dijual langsung maupun ditaruh di warung – warung langganannya.

loans.use: to make new years horn

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Mr. Luis S. is single and comes from the City of Chontales. He moved to Managua in search of a better life. He started working in the sale of cosmetics since he was very young. First he had a cart in the local market, Mercado Oriental de Managua, then later on - and due to his hard work and determination- he was able to buy a stand (booth) at the market where he continued to sell cosmetics. Currently Mr. S. has two stands at the market. His aspiration is to continue to grow. He will use the loan to buy new products that are constantly coming out on the market.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Don Luis S. es soltero, originario de la Ciudad de Chontales, pero en busca de una mejor vida se fue a vivir a la ciudad de Managua. Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en la venta de cosméticos, empezó vendiendo cosméticos en una carreta en el mercado Oriental de Managua, pero gracias al empeño de salir adelante, tiempo después logró comprar un tramo en el mercado donde tambien siguió con las ventas de cosméticos, hoy en día don Luis tiene dos tramos en el mercado. Sus aspiraciones son seguir creciendo más, quiere el crédito para comprar nuevos productos que constantemente salen al mercado.

loans.use: Buy Shampoos, Lotions and Cosmetics

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham C., 33, sells grocery products next to her house everyday, and earns around $13 of income. Her husband, Mr. Chun Sei, 35, is a taxi driver, who makes an average of $5 per day. Their two children are both students. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more grocery products, in order to diversify their selection.

loans.use: This couple hopes to this loan to purchase grocery products.

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma belongs to the Comunal Bank Las Ucayalinas, located on 28 D. Julio Street 902, in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 51 years old, has two children, and is separated from her husband. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in a small general store. Currently her general store has grown and she wants to install a copier in order to generate more income. Every day she splits her domestic chores with attending her store, along with her sons who help her. With this loan of 2,000 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy a photocopier, and with any extra money, groceries to stock her store. Emma is doing very well and the loans she’s received have helped her in many ways since she began working with Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Emma pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Ucayalinas, ubicado en el Jr. 28 D. Julio 902, del Distrito D. Manantay del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años es madre D. 2 hijos, es separada. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad su bodega ha crecido y quiere implementar un copiadora para generar mas ingresos, todos los días comparte las tareas domesticas con la atención D. su bodega conjunto con sus hijos que la ayudan. Con este préstamo recibido D. S/. 2,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará una maquina fotocopiadora, y lo que le sobrará abarrotes para surtir su bodega. Emma le esta yendo muy bien los prestamos recibidos la ayudan en muchas cosas desD. que empezó a trabajar con Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase photocopier and groceries

loans.name: Ivon Alicia

texts.es:
Fifteen years ago Ivon began her stationery store with a small display case and a few items for sale. She started the business out of economic need when her three children starting growing up and expenses were increasing, and her husband´s teacher´s salary was not enough. Currently two of her children are in primary school and the oldest is in university. They help her in the business when they are on break from school. Little by little her business has grown and now she not only sells stationery supplies but also some gift items.

She now needs a loan for US $950, which she will repay in 6 months, to buy supplies for the upcoming Children´s Day and Mother´s Day holidays. She is confident that with your contribution her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Ivon tiene una papelería que inicio hace 15 años con una pequeña vitrina y unos cuantos artículos para venta. Ella emprendió el negocio dada la necesidad económica por la que estaban pasando cuando sus tres hijos empezaron a crecer y entonces los gastos se incrementaron y el sueldo como profesor de su marido no les alcanzaba, actualmente dos de sus hijos cursan la primaria y la mayor esta en la universidad. Ellos la ayudan a atender el negocio cuando están de vacaciones en la escuela. Poco a poco ha hecho crecer su negocio ya que ahora no solo vende artículos de papelería sino también algunos artículos para regalo.

Actualmente requiere un crédito por US $950 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía para las próximas fechas del día del niño y día de las Madres. Ella confía que con tu contribución lograra progresar en su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase inventory.

loans.name: Adelfina

texts.es:
Adelfina is married to a truck driver. They have 3 children ages 19, 15, and 13. She started the business in order to help out financially with her children’s educational expenses. When her third child began his studies, the fees started to increase. Eight years ago, she started selling shoes and beauty products to her family and friends. Little by little, after so much effort, she has been able to establish a strong client-base.

She now needs a loan of $500 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, so that she can buy shoes for the season, and so that she can fill her customers’ orders. With your support, this will be possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Adelfina es casada y su esposo es chofer de transportes. Tienen tres hijos de 19,15 y 13. Inició el negocio para poder apoyar económicamente con los gastos de estudio de sus hijos, cuando empezó estudiar su tercer hijo, se empezaron incrementaron los gastos. Comenzó hace ocho años vendiendo zapatos y productos de belleza entre sus amistades y familiares. Poco a poco y a base de esfuerzo a podido hacerse de una cartera de clientes.

Ahora necesita un préstamo por US $500 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar zapatos de temporada, y poder surtir los encargos que le hacen. Con tu apoyo esto será posible.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena Nkansah is 40 years old. She is a wife and the mother of seven children who are currently in school. For the last eight years, she has been manufacturing palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her production is on a small scale and therefore her working capital is low. Abena wants to use the loan to buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine to increase her efficiency. She believes this will help expand her business to support her husband and children, especially for food and education. She belongs to the community group called “Megyefo Tease” (My Redeemer Lives) Trust Group and was photographed at one of the meetings. Group members guarantee each other's reliability, both to access loans and to encourage and support their peers to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more palm kernels and an electric milling machine.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a twenty year old married mother of two children. She began her current business of dress making in 2006.She specializes in both women’s and men’s clothing. Florence plans to move to a more spacious site and buy tailoring materials with her loan of US $600.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 50-year-old widow who has six children. She lost her husband 8 years ago through a car accident. As a single parent, the responsibility of the children rests squarely upon her shoulders. Through hard work, Rose has been able to support four children so they could finish high school.

For the past twenty years, Rose has been trading in maize and gari. Gari is produced from cassava, and it is one of the dietary carbohydrate supplements. She obtains her supplies from the farming communities and sells retail to her customers. She plans to use the loan to buy maize and gari in bulk, so she can meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay her children's educational fees.

Rose is a member of a community group called First King Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Buy bulk of maize and gari in bulk and resell

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is the wife of Mr.S. and the mother of three children: two sons and one daughter. She lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 20 years. Her elder son is in kindergarten. Her husband is a wheat seller and has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Naseem baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). She used that loan for her husband's wheat business. Now she is applying for a loan again for her husband's wheat business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, thread) for her decorative embroidery business. Munawar baji wants a loan to buy eatable things (chips) to re-sell. Irshad baji and Manzooran baji each want a loan to buy fruit to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more wheat to re-sell

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Komlavi K. est un mécanicien auto depuis 3 ans à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 39 ans, Komlavi est marié et père de 3 enfants. Il souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV aménager son garage et aussi acheter des outils de travail afin de mieux satisfaire aux besoins de la clientèle. Il compte sur cette opportunité pour améliorer les conditions de sa vie
texts.en:
Komlavi K. has been an auto mechanic for 3 years in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Komlavi is 39 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. With this first loan with FECECAV, he wishes to outfit his garage and buy work tools to better meet customer demand. He reckons this opportunity will enable him to improve his living conditions.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To outfit his garage and buy work tools

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Hermelinda tiene 40 años de edad, está felizmente casada pero aún no tiene hijos, estudió el quinto grado de primaria y vive en el Sector Orcomplaya del C.P. de Uros Chulluni, distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.

Es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” de Puno. Al inicio, con el préstamo de S/. 300, aumentó su capital y compró bordados en bayeta, vasijas de arcilla, balsas, etc. para implementar el negocio de artesanías que tiene en la Isla Flotante de los Uros. Desde los 15 años empezó a trabajar en la pesca y en la artesanía. Cuando tenia 20 años de edad  tuvo su esposo y ambos continuaron con este negocio al que se dedican y venden en el lugar antes mencionado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados a S/. 500 (20 unidades) 25 manteles de mesa a S/. 625.

Su deseo es mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is 40 years old, and is happily married, but does not yet have children. She studied through the fifth year of primary school, and lives in the Orcomplaya sector of C.P. of Uros Chulluni, in the district, province and suburb of Puno. Hermelina is one of the founders of the "Melchorita Saravia II" community bank of Puno. At the beginning, with the 300 soles loan, Hermelina purchased cloth, a clay pot and a raft to begin her crafts business in the Uros floating Island. Since she was 15 years old, she began to work in the fishing and artisan industries. When she was 20 years old, she got married and they both worked in this business. With this loan of 1,700 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase embroidery at .500 soles (20 units), and 25 table cloths at .625 soles. Her desire is to improve her business and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 20 units of embroidery and 25 table cloths.

loans.name: Encarnacion

texts.en:
Encarnación is a member of the Nobleza (“Nobility”) Village Bank. She is 45 years old and lives with her partner; they have five children. Elizabeth buys meat and animals in local markets. She sells the meat to local stores and also sells door-to-door.

Encarnación is requesting a loan of 600 soles (US $200) to buy more meat. She has been a FINCA client for three years now, and says her business is doing much better now than it used to. FINCA loans help her keep her store well stocked, and her savings account allows her to save her profits, something that is difficult for her to do on her own. Encarnación’s goal for the future is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: Buy meat

loans.name: Khorn

texts.en: Khorn C., 26, is a rice farmer and also raises pigs for another source of income. Her husband is a rice farmer and has a rice mill for providing the service of rice grinding. The young couple lives in Kralengkort Village in the Kampong Cham Province and works hard everyday with the business to support their family sufficiently. They have two children, both of whom are teenagers. With growing business, C. would like to request a loan to purchase pig food and rice to make cleaned rice to resell.

loans.use: To purchase pig food and rice to make cleaned rice to resell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret M. is a divorced woman who has two children. Thus, she is solely responsible for paying her children’s school fees, rent, utility bills, and other living expenses of the family. She notes that she has received education through junior high.

To support her children, Margaret sells food supplies at Santiwadzi in Elmina, which she has been doing since 1996. She is now seeking a loan to buy more food supplies and groceries in order to meet the increase in demand by her customers. In turn, she hopes to generate an increase in profits so that she can further invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To expand her business and to meet customer demand by purchasing additional food supplies and groceries

loans.name: Juma

texts.ru:
Ганиев Джума 1969 года рождения. Он женат, имеет 2 дочерей и 2 сына. Джума три года дома держит скот, у него есть 2 коровы и бычок. А  также он со своей женой пекут самсы (национальные мясные пирожки)на базаре. Они пекут в тандыре (национальная глиняная печь)утром и после обеда, тесто делает жена, дочери помогают готовить фарш и лепить самсы. По вечерам дочери и жена вышивают бисером на тканях, это тоже является доходом. 
Дома он построил бассейн для содержания воды, так как все лето вода в трубе высыхает, и эту воду дает коровам. На кредит он купит еще несколько голов скота. Через 5-6 месяцев, когда коровы  будут готовы на продажу, он их продаст и купит молодых и по низкой цене.
texts.en:
Juma G. was born in 1969. He is married and has 2 daughters and 2 sons. For 3 years, Juma has been farming cattle. He has 2 cows and a bull. During the summer, the central water supply dries up, so Juma built a water reservoir at home to have a reliable source of water at all times. Juma will use this loan to purchase several cows. He will raise the animals for 5-6 months and then sell them at a profit.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es:
la Sra. Maria C. tiene 42 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella es dueña de su propia pulperia que posee desde hace 15 años, es un bonito negocio que ha podido obtener gracias a la ayuda de Dios y de su gran esfuerzo, ella tambien vende zapatos.
tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad que esta estudiando en el colegio de San Lorenzo, el es su adoracion.
necesita el prestamo para poder aumentar su negocio y tener mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
el sueño de ella es poder graduar a su hijo de la universidad para que tenga un mejor futuro y muchas oportinidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria C. is 42 years old, and sells popular consumer goods. She's the owner of her own convenience store that she's had for 15 years. It's a beautiful business that has been able to profit thanks to God and her great effort; she also sells shoes.

She has a fifteen-year-old son who's studying in the San Lorenzo school. He is her pride and joy. She needs a loan to help grow her business and to have a greater variety of products to offer her customers. Her dream is to be able to graduate her son from college so that he can have a better future with many opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of churros, beverages, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, cookies, shampoos, deodorant, soups, candy, juices, toilet paper

loans.name: Mosharif

texts.ru: Тухтошева Мошариф проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 42 года, замужем и имеет четверых детей. вместе с мужем занимается земледелием. Арендуют один га. земли , которы 50\50 засеивает картофелем и луком. Земля уже засеиная , но пришло время обробатывать землю , поэтому она решила получить кредит и использовать на покупку удобрений. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mosharif T. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 42 years old, married and has four children. She and her husband are in agriculture. They are renting one 1 ha. (hectare) of land half of which they sow with potatoes and other half with onions. Their land is already sown, but now is the time to fertilize the land and this is why Mosharif decided to get a loan and use it to buy fertilizer. She can pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is married with two children. He offers plumbing services in his city: he changes water pipes, installs water heating systems, etc. This kind of service is in high demand now. Affordable prices help Victor to win many clients. Victor has been in this business for four years. He is a hard working and entrepreneurial person. He is also very good at talking to clients. These two character traits help him to run his business successfully.

Victor would like to borrow 10,900 UAH to purchase tools that he needs for his business. This would allow him to offer an even larger variety of services and gain more clients. He would like to spend any additional income on improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his plumbing business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion L. is a 36-year-old woman from Southern Looc, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 kids. Her husband is a fisherman. Having started her sari-sari (variety) store from a meager capital, she coped well with the challenges of her business. The small business is doing so well that she has confidently decided to expand.

She has joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to avail herself of loans. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 to additionally capitalize her business. She is determined to maintain a good credit standing whatever may happen, so she can always turn to the cooperative in the future. She envisions acquiring an additional market stall. She dreams also of renovating their little house and of starting saving now for the education of their children

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
"I got bored just staying in the house waiting for my husband to come. That is why I started my own business. It is a sari-sari (variety) store that helps us to supplement our limited income. I started my business using my own savings. I am happy that I was able to sustain it for years," says Elma N., 36-year-old mother of three children. 

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her store. The loan will really help a lot to grow her store even more.

Elma is planning to expand her business. Through CEVI, she will be able to improve her sales and make it more established.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Miguel Jose

texts.en:
Miguel is the owner of a photography and TV production business in Miami. He produces commercials, infomercials and does photography for weddings and birthday parties. He is married with two children. 

Miguel has been working in the industry for fifteen years. Four years ago he formed his own company with a loan from ACCION USA. He has now been approved for a second loan to purchase a new camera and computer for editing video.

By upgrading his equipment, Miguel is able to give his clients the finest prints and video, and stay competitive. He loves his job because he is able to interact with his clients at some of the most important times in their lives. He plans to grow his business over the coming years and provide work to other photographers.

loans.use: A new camera and a computer for editing videos

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 61 años, 07 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.

Su espíritu  alegre y su anhelo D. ver profesionales  a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes con cuyas ganancias ayudaría al ingreso económico D. su familia, desD. sus  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama D. casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atienD.  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Victoria, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria belongs to the El Tiempo es Oro, "Time Is Money", community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She is 61 years old, partnered and the mother of 7 children, all now grown.

Her joyful spirit and strong desire to see her children settled in professional careers motivated her to start her own grocery business, the earnings from which would help the family. She's been gaining customers from the beginning. She now has a regular customer base that come to her shop every day because she has all the things that housewives need and because she tends to her customers with a natural charisma.

She wants to use the S/.3,000 [3,000 soles] loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar, pasta, milk, canned fish, eggs and toiletries so that she can continue to proviD. her customers with the products they want.

Victoria feels ready and able to continue working and striving day after day. She's grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping women like her get the chance to help themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
F. Sharif is happily married to his wife. Their marriage has been blessed with 4 lovely children. Sharif has decided that he wants to live the rest of his life in the place where he was born. He not only loves the peaceful environment, but it also houses their major source of income, farming. He has been involved in farm activities since childhood. He is used to the heat of the sun. Sharif has worked as a farmer for the past 10 years. However, life has been difficult and progress slow. Because he lacks financial resources, Sharif would like to borrow 2500 Somoni so that he can buy seeds and fertilizer for his crop. Sharif has gained a reputation for responsibility with his financial obligations and for keeping his word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist him with the operation of his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana N. A. is 38 years old, married and has four children. She makes a living selling clothes, hand bags and shoes. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers, and wishes to express her thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, bags and shoes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr: Nathalie est née à Kouti dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud-Ouest du BENIN. Nathalie est mariée à Jacques, un commerçant. Nathalie est mère de 5 enfants. Nathalie vend de maïs ainsi que les condiments de sauce (tomate fraîche et en boîte, oignon, poivre, ail, gombo, sésame, piment, cube…). C’est au Nord du Bénin que Nathalie achète le maïs et l’oignon. Quant au reste des condiments de sauce, Nathalie l’achète à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Nathalie sollicite d’ALIDé un prêt pour acheter et stocker le maïs maintenant que le prix est au plus bas.
texts.en:
Nathalie was born in Kouti in Ouémé County (southwestern Benin).  She is married to Jacques, a merchant.  Nathalie is the mother of five children.  She sells corn, as well as sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, canned tomatoes, onions, black pepper, garlic, okra, sesame seeds, chili peppers, bouillon cubes...).  In northern Benin is where she buys corn and onions. As for the rest of the sauce condiments, these are purchased at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin.  Nathalie is requesting a loan from ALIDé to buy and stock up on corn, now that prices are at their lowest.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and sauce condiments

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús tiene 30 años, es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su familia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica es la panadería, su labor comienza muy temprano, aproximadamente a las 4.30 ya está en pie y listo para amasar y hacer los panes que disfruta todo su barrio, él no es el dueño del horno en el que trabaja, pero si es el responsable, ya que la dueña le tiene mucha confianza. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacer los panes y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 5 años en este trabajo y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse todos los días tan temprano, ya que para él no existen fines de semana, ni feriados. Jesús anhela tener su propio horno y trabajar muy duro para darle una mejor vida a su familia. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y no quiere dejar de pagarlo por falta de dinero, así que está dispuesto a ahorrar día a día para ello. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que viene solicitando comprará nuevas latas y estantes para los panes, así podrá ganar un porcentaje de la venta de los panes, aparte de su sueldo fijo.
texts.en:
Jesús is 30 years old and is a very happy and hard working person. He lives in his own house with his family. His biggest wish is to improve his quality of life. He is dedicated to a bakery and his work schedule starts very early. Approximately at 4:30 a.m. he is already awake and ready to prepare the bread that his whole neighborhood enjoys.

He is not the owner of the oven that he uses, but he is very responsible and the oven’s owner trusts him a lot. What he likes the most in his work is to make the bread and he does it neatly. He has been working with bread making for 5 years and what he considers to be the most difficult part of it is to have to get up everyday so early, since for him there is no weekends or holidays.

Jesús longs to have a oven of his own and wants to work very hard to provide his family a better life. This is his second loan with MFP. He does not want to fail in paying it back because of scarcity of money so he is willing to save money day by day to repay the loan.

With the 800 new soles he requests, he will buy baking pans and shelves for the bread so that he can earn a percentage of the selling of the products, in addition to his regular income.


Translated from Spanish by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy utensils and shelves

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Pol S. is a 60-year-old widow who makes her livelihood in the countryside. She has three children, two of whom are married and live separately. S. runs a service sewing clothes at home. She also helps her single son, Sophon, 41, farm rice and seasonal vegetables on a plot of land inherited from her parents. Sophon and S. have sustained their small family by their farming. Recently, they needed cows to plow their field in order to avoid paying to hire cows. So they took a loan of $175 USD to buy a pair of cows for their farm. (Sophon was not available for the photograph so S. had her picture taken alone.)

loans.use: To buy a pair of cows to plow their farm

loans.name: Lucilo Nicolas

texts.es: El señor Lucilo Nicolás C. , tiene la edad de 47 años, habita en el barrio Los M., ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos, ya todos son independiente, los planes hacia su familia es poder establecer un taller de soldadura para que uno de sus hijos lo trabaja y tenga mejor condiciones de vida, don Lucilo desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura la mayor dificultad que se le presento es no haber cancelado en tiempo y forma su crédito ya que la producción se atrasó un poco por la falta de insumo que requiere para obtener una  buena cosecha, agradece a la institución por el apoyo que le ha brindado a pesar de las dificultades , con este sexto crédito va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicárselo al cultivo .
texts.en:
Mr. Lucilo Nicolás C. is 47 years old and lives in the Los Mariniz neighborhood of Ticuantepe. He and his wife work a business together. They have three children, all old enough to be on their own. They plan to open a welding shop that one of their sons could run in order to improve his livelihood. Mr. Lucilo has been farming for the past 30 years. His biggest setback was not having been able to discharge his loan in time because he fell behind in production a bit, due to lack of raw materials needed for a good harvest. He is thankful for the support he has gotten, despite his past difficulties. With this sixth loan, he will buy fertilizer and raw materials to apply to his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and raw materials for crops

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es una alegre mujer D. 57 años D. edad, vive con su hija (María), D. 14 años, quien es su principal alegría; ellas viven en su casa propia. DesD. hace 7 años se dedica al tejido D. chompas, arte que aprendió desD. pequeña D. su madre y gracias a ello, hoy en día, pueD. tener un pequeño negocio D. tejido D. chompas, chalinas, guantes, gorros, etc., las cuales elabora por pedido.
Actualmente, Nelly se encuentra trabajando en un pedido que le hicieron, es por ello que no tiene mucha disponibilidad, pues esta actividad requiere D. todo su tiempo, siendo muy cansado, pero gracias a su experiencia pueD. avanzar mucho más rápido; además, en el transcurro, aprenD. otras técnicas D. tejido como el enmallado.
Pero Nelly no se dedica sólo a esto, siendo ella muy trabajadora; por las tardes, ayudada por su hija, venD. salchipapas (plato tradicional elaborado con papas y salchichas fritas), donD. obtiene algunas ganancias extras.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual en todos sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en comprar mayor cantidad D. productos (ingrediente), al por mayor, para cocinar sus ricas salchipapas. También comprará lana y algunas herramientas para tejer.
texts.en:
Nelly, a happy woman who is 57 years old, lives with her daughter, Maria, who is 14 and is her greatest happiness. They live in their own house. For the last 7 years Nelly has worked weaving sweaters, an art that she learned while young from her mother. Thanks to that she is able today to have a small business weaving sweaters, neckties, gloves, caps, etc. which she makes to order. Currently Nelly is working on an order she received so she does not have much availability since this work requires all her time. She is very tired but thanks to her experience she is able to move ahead more rapidly. Also, in the process she is learning other techniques for weaving, such as using mesh. But Nelly does not work only at that. Being very hard working, in the afternoons assisted by her daughter, she sells salchipapas (a traditional dish maD. with potatoes and fried sausages) from which she obtains some extra income. This is her second loan with MFP and she has always been known to be punctual in all her payments. She will invest the money she is now requesting to buy a large quantity of products (ingredients) at wholesale, to cook her rich salchipapas. She will also buy wool and some tools for weaving.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool for weaving and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Los Pulpitos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Pulpitos” Esta representada por la señora Pastora y conformado por 12 miembros que residen en el mismo barrió y se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo teniendo amplia confianza en cada uno de sus miembros. La mayoría de las socias tiene su propio negocio como por ejemplo su presidenta se dedica a la recolección de chatarra para reciclarla y volverla a vender, el resto de las socias se dedican a la venta de zapatos, comida, rellenos, verduras, ropa de bebe y al transporte. La existencia de la competencia en el mercado es grande pero depende de cada una como salir adelante ya que de los ingresos diarios subsiste su familia. El destino del financiamiento es para incrementar su capital de trabajo con la adquisición de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para incrementar sus ventas y generar un mejor ingreso para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, así como un futuro más prometedor para sus hijos que son su razón de vivir. En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
The "Los Pulpitos" (Little Octopi) group is made up of 12 members from the same neighborhood who have known each other for a long time and have complete confidence in each other; they are represented by Pastora. Most of the members have their own businesses. For example, the group president salvages junk to recyle and resell. The rest of the members sell shoes, food, turnovers, vegetables, baby clothes, and provide transportation. There is a lot of competition in the marketplace but it is up to each one to find a way to get ahead since these daily funds are what provide for their families' survival. The funds will be used to increase working capital to buy merchandise, raw materials, and tools to increase sales and generate increased profits to provide their families with a better quality of life as well as a more promising future for their children, who are their reason to live. As far as their competence with regard to credit, the members have it thanks to loans they have managed from similar instittions although this is the first time they have worked with an institution that offers them trust and economic support; for this reason they wish to continue growing with us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 33 años, es una mujer muy laboriosa y madre de 4 hijos, vive con su pareja en su casa propia.
Hace dos años se inició en la venta de comestibles y verduras, de entonces está muy evocada a su tienda, pues poco a poco ha ido incrementando sus productos comestibles. Ocuparse de su negocio le gusta muchísimo; por ello, a pesar de que trabaja en la chacra de plátanos con su esposo, temprano regresa para atender a sus clientes, ya que logra obtener ganancias adicionales para su hogar. 

Su mayor dificultad en este momento es que no cuenta con dinero suficiente para surtir su negocio, es por ello que acude a este crédito, pues con el dinero que solicita surtirá su tienda con mayores productos; especialmente de comestibles y golosinas.

Siendo este su primer préstamo con MFP, tiene muchas expectativas positivas acerca de su banco comunal. Pero también hace el juramente de cumplir los pagos de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Hilda, 33, is a very hard-working woman and the mother of 4 children; she lives with her partner in their own house. Two years ago she began to sell food items and vegetables. Since then she has become increasingly focused on her store and little by little has been increasing the items she stocks. She really enjoys tending to her store. So, on top of helping her husband with his banana plantations, she comes back home early to tend to her customers because this produces additional income for her home. Her greatest difficulty at the moment is not having sufficient funds to stock her store. This is the reason for requesting this loan, to stock her store with a wider variety of items, especially food items and sweets. Because this is her first loan with MFP, she has high expectations of her communal bank but she also pledges to be punctual with her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es:
La socia SAYDA hace un año que pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”  

Nuestra socia es una humilde madre de familia, tiene 37 años de edad, es casada, tienen dos hijas. Ellas viven en la ciudad imperial del Cusco. 

La socia tiene un carro que hace el servicio transporte de carga a la ciudad Puerto Maldonado del departamento de Madre de Dios. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para el mantenimiento del carro ya que es el único medio de sustento de su familia. Ella comenta, si el carro se malogra no hay ingresos para su familia y por ese motivo tiene que hacer periódicamente el mantenimiento del carro.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Member SAYDA has been a part of the communal bank “PROSPERIDAD” for a year. Our member is a modest mother, 37 years old, married, and has two daughters. They live in the imperial city of Cusco. She has a car she uses to transport cargo to Puerto Maldonado City to and from the Madre de Dios department. She has been working in this business for several years and has been doing well thanks to all the determination she puts in. Our member is a hard-working, entrepreneurial mother who improves her family’s standard of living. She requires the loan for car maintenance since it’s the only means of support for her family. She comments, that if the car breaks down there will not be any income for her family and for that reason she needs to periodically maintain her car. She is thankful for the opportunity offered through this resource and likewise commits herself to fulfill the corresponding scheduled payments.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She requires the loan for car maintenance.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Mrs. Kalpana Bhushal and her husband Mr. Shyam Bhushal both are tailors in the village of Bhakepati, Kathmandu. Tailoring is their traditional work. They learned the tailoring trade from their parents. They make custom fitted ladies dresses like kurta sulwar which are very popular with Nepali woman.

Mrs. Bhushal is currently asking for Rs 15000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.Mrs. Bhushal lives in a joint family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law and her husband

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoeun C. and her husband, Mr. Meas Put, are farmers who own a 1.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. Aside from the farming, Mr. Meas Put is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to sell. With the farming, Mrs. Phoeun C. faces a problem because she does not have enough oxen to plow the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy another ox to add to the old one for plowing the field.

Mrs. Phoeun C. is 45 years old and lives in the village of Tmey in Takeo province. She is the mother of four children: two are employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an ox to plow the field

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is a 48-year-old woman who is married and blessed with seven children. She and her husband work together to raised their big family. They are currently living at Taghangin, Morong, Rizal, Philippines. Josephine is a woman with good faith to defeat all challenges to reach her dreams.

In 2004, Josephine joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.) a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. As a member of ASHI for almost six years, she has shown very good performance in her attendance at center meetings and weekly repayments. Her business still exists and, therefore, she is qualified to acquire larger loans.

Josephine runs a variety store. She started her store through her initiative in dealing with customers. She wants to continue her business as it gives her a good income to support the educational needs of her children. She is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to use as additional capital to improve her business and her income.

Josephine dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it to other villages. Her seven children are her inspiration to pursue her variety store.

Josephine now feels very happy with the services of ASHI and Kiva. It gives her a big chance to pursue her family dreams. She hopes that ASHI and Kiva continue the service for a long time and help many families who want to get ahead.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: DON PEDRO ES UN CLIENTE DE LA CIUDAD DE EL VIEJO ES PADRE DE FAMILIA TIENE 03 HIJOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR. EL CREDITO LO OCUPA PARA EL ALQUILER DE AREAS PARA LA SIEMBRA ES UN CLIENTE QUE SIEMPRE A TRABAJADO EL ALA AGRICUYLTURA Y A TRABAJADO CON ESFUERZO PROPIO Y NECESITA EL CREDITO PARA EXTENDER SUS AREAS DE SIEMBRA Y DE ESA MANERA ODTENER MEJORES UTILIDADES
texts.en:
Pedro is a client from the city of El Viejo. He is a family man with three school aged children. This loan will be used to pay rent for land that he uses for planting crops. He has always worked in agriculture with a lot of effort, and he needs this credit to extend his planting area and thereby obtain greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent for agricultural lands

loans.name: Melvin

texts.es:
Melvin C. C., tiene la edad de 42 años, está en unión libre, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 16,12 y 7 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros para el engorde y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Melvin tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Melvin C. C. is 42, has a live-in girlfriend, and has 3 children, who are his top priority. They are 16, 12, and 7. He will use this loan to buy some calves to fatten and feed for them. He hopes to give them adequate care so he can obtain the largest profit profitable when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has and to be able to give them the best conditions. He has a suitable area to care for them and to raise them. This is the first time that he has had a credit with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms they have offered him. Don Melvin has raised animals for several years. In the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to keep growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Amy Diagne

texts.fr: Madame Amy Diagne C. est une femme commerçante  de 46 ans qui habite dans la localité  de Bambilor. Elle est membre de la caisse depuis décembre  2009. Elle est mariée et mère  de 7 enfants dont l’âgé  varie entre 3 et 23 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits maraichers et de poissons fumes.  Elle exerce cette activité  depuis plus de dix ans. Elle a démarré  ses activités commerciales après  son mariage avec la vente de pain. Sa préoccupation  était d’aider son mari dans la gestion du foyer. Elle sollicite un crédit de 25 000 frs destine a l’achat de  tomates  de haricots, et  de poissons fumes qu’elle va revendre. Pour madame C. ce prêt pourra l’aider a avoir une certaine stabilité financière  et  sociale.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy Diagne C. is a 46-year-old retail merchant who lives in Bambilor. She has been a member of the local credit loan group since December 2009. She is married and has seven children, whose ages vary between three and 23 years. She has been actively selling garden vegetables and smoked fish for the past ten years. After getting married, she began her commercial activities by selling bread. Her concern was to help her husband manage household expenses. She is requesting a loan for 25,000 francs that will be used to buy tomatoes, green beans and smoked fish for resale. This loan will help Mrs. C. establish financial and social stability.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Tamtamnehsu Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Tamtamnehsu' group from the northern township of Magburaka. These women are petty traders who have come together to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in the group from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they can add more goods to their business inventories, make more sales, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata C.. Fatmata is a 31-year-old widow with three children to look after. A native of Magburaka town, she sells used clothes in the township. She has been running this business for ten years now. With her share of the loan, Fatmata will buy a bale or two of used clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy a bale or two of used clothes

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es:
Demetria es socia del Banco Comunal Universo.
Demetria es casada, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Demetria vende verduras al por mayor en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija.
Demetria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zanahoria.
Demetria sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y aumentar su mercadería.
texts.en:
Demetria is an associate of the Universe Communal Bank. Demetria is married, 55 years of age and has 6 children. Demetria sells vegetables wholesale in the Nery García market, an activity which she carries out every day with the help of her daughter. Demetria needs a loan of 1500 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of carrots. Demetria dreams that her children will become professionals and would like to increase the variety of her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carrots for resale

loans.name: Ala

texts.en:
Ala T. is 35 and married with 3 children (ages 3 - 13).  She owns a business venture, driving a taxi.  Ala has 2 years of experience in this business.  Ala needs a loan of WST $1250 to renew vehicle license.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Ala joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Ala's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to renew vehicle license

loans.name: Yuder

texts.es: Yuder, de 21 años, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador, vive en la casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. El campo le ha dado a Yuder los recursos necesarios para poder mantenerse, él se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde que tenía 10 años, actividad que aprendió de sus padres. Actualmente sus reses están muy bien cuidadas y alimentadas, es por eso que en la feria ganadera de la ciudad de Tarma, que es donde lleva a vender su ganado, sus reses son las más solicitadas por los compradores. Lleva 6 años realizando este trabajo y considera  que le gusta pastear a sus animales, sin embargo el tener que llevarlo a las ferias el resulta muy cansado y agotador. Es por ello que desea incrementar el número de reses que tiene, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y se siente feliz de haberlo obtenido, en su grupo comunal es un compañero muy querido ya que siempre ayuda en todo lo necesario. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, planea comprar un toro de raza, ya que desea mejorar la calidad de su ganado.
texts.en:
Yuder is a cheerful and hardworking young man who is 21 years of age. He lives at home with his parents and what he wants most is to succeed in life. Yuder requires necessary resources to remain in his line of work. He has been raising cattle since he was ten years old and learned the trade from his parents. His current interests are taking good care of the animals and feeding them so that they can be sold at the livestock fair in the city of Tarma, where many buyers go to acquire their cattle. Yuder has been managing his own business for six years and enjoys taking the animals out to pasture so they can graze. However, he finds taking the animals to the fairs can be tiring and exhausting. Nonetheless, he wants to increase the number of cattle in his herd so that he can improve his income.

Yuder is requeseting his fifth loan from MFP and is happy to receive it. He is a beloved member of his Communal Bank and always helps out in any way necessary. With the loan of 3000 PEN that he requested, Yuder will purchase a bull of good breed so that he can improve the quality of his cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull of good breed

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita A. is from the village of Olango. She is 49 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Margarita owns and operates a general store, providing a variety of commodities in the local community. Margarita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Margarita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margarita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Margarita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Margarita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie P. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 39 years old. Elvie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Elvie owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elvie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seafood products to sell & working capital. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Elvie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 27 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su pareja  Wilmer (28) y su pequeño hijo, por quien se esfuerza cada día.Le gusta sentir la tranquilidad que le transmite el campo, por eso lleva 6 años cultivando café y piña, en sus terrenos propios. Para realizar su labor contrata operarios  quienes le ayudan en los trabajos agrícolas, pues su esposo trabaja de jornalero en una mina, donde a diario le pagan 25 soles, y en sus días libres también atiende sus cultivos. Ella  considera que su oficio es bastante rentable, si se sabe administrar e invertir bien las ganancias obtenidas, además refiere -“si cuidas adecuadamente tus plantaciones, es seguro que obtendrás una buena cosecha que te retribuirá todo el esfuerzo que desempeñaste”. Para mas adelante tiene pensado incrementar la cantidad de sus plantaciones, principalmente de café  - producto natural muy solicitado y bien remunerado.Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se muestra muy entusiasmada de continuar laborando junto a los integrantes de su grupo comunal, además sabe que son personas responsables y solidarias.Elva tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  varios sacos de abono que esparcirá sobre sus cultivos, pues quiere obtener mayores ganancias que le permitirán seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Elva is 27 years old and lives in a home of her own, along with her husband Wilber (28) and her young son for whom she exerts herself every day. She enjoys the tranquility of the countryside. This is why she has spent the past six years raising coffee and pineapples on her own farmland. She hires farmhands who help her with her agricultural work. Her husband works as a miner where he is paid 25 PEN (about $9) per day. Oh his days off he also tends to the crops. She considers her occupation to be very profitable if one knows how to administer and invest the earnings. She says, “If you care well for your plantings, you will certainly have a good harvest that will repay you for all the hard work you put in.” She plans to increase the amount of plantings in the future, mainly coffee – a natural product that is in good demand and is well paid for. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is excited about continuing to work with her fellow communal bank members. She knows that they are all solid and responsible people. Elva plans to use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer that she will spread on her crops. She wants to increase her income which will allow her to continue to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi W. est une femme de 49 ans très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois. étant la seule à faire ce commerce dans son quartier elle a une grande clientèle et réalise par conséquent de bonnes recettes. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays, la demande actuelle de sa clientèle est élevée, elle sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une vingtaine de sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandise. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants
texts.en:
Akouvi W. is a very energetic 49 year old woman. Her line of business is selling charcoal. As she is the only person operating this type of business in her neighborhood, she has a large clientele and consequently makes a good income. She gets her supplies in the interior of the country and at present customer demand is high. She is therefore requesting a loan from WAGES to buy around twenty bags of charcoal and to provide for the transportation of the merchandise. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal
